Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Randolph314
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carneros Inn for a weekend over the summer. We booked a one-bedroom "Harvest Cottage." It wasn't cheap - with tax I think it was over $700. But it was one of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in, and the hotel was very enjoyable overall. The hotel sprawls out over a very large property. It is designed to feel like a small town. There are a couple of very good restaurants, a general store, postal services, etc. The hotel has a very nice pool and hot tub, as well as various other amenities that we didn't use. The main feature, was the room itself however. It consisted of a small cottage that was very luxuriously appointed, and a walled-in backyard area that contained an outdoor bathtub for two, chaise lounges, and some other amenities. It was all very quiet and peaceful, and a wonderful place to stay for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Truly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: oneidaelane
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time at the Carneros Inn and it failed to disappoint. One feels like you have been transported to another world with their private cottages-- heated tile floors in the bathroom, outdoor shower, outdoor furnished patio. I could easily live there on a full time basis. The casual restaurant is also excellent if you can't get into their main eatery. Views of the orchards and surrounding areas are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful cottages with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: baselgirl_1000
Reviews.Content: Truly lovely little cottages - beautiful rooms with outside area, fantastic bathroom, fireplace indoor and out, espresso machine and the list goes on. My only regret was I was there for business! Would love to come back for a romantic getaway with my husband. Meeting room facilities were good - perfect for a retreat / team building.

Reviews.Title: “Great vistas, casitas, and property”
Reviews.Author: ATLflyer
Reviews.Content: This property is a beautiful enclave of little casitas in Napa. There hotel portion of the property is accessed by private gate which makes it feel even more exclusive as some of the property is open to visitors. The facilities (main house, private restaurant, spa/fitness center, and pool) are world class and never seem busy. It is very expensive but you get what you pay for in this case.

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful, service good not great”
Reviews.Author: MrFordCT
Reviews.Content: Really one of the most beautiful settings for a hotel, overlooking mountains and vineyards. We rented a cottage with another couple and the accommodations were superb. The housekeeping was not great, but it wasn't terrible (we had to keep calling them to refill things or clean things they forgot). Food on the premises is quite good with a decent variety for a hotel. Make sure to have breakfast up at the pool outside--the best vistas and so peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “the best in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Tory L
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me here for an early Valentine's day weekend, and it exceeded every (already high) expectation. The service was extremely friendly from the moment we arrived when we were offered a delicious glass of pinot noir before being escorted to our private garden cottage. We ate at their restaurant Farm where I had the best oysters of my life, and the hotel was so wonderful that it was hard to drag ourselves out to see the rest of Napa. Our room had a real fire place, an indoor/outdoor shower and a private little garden area. The privacy of having your own cottage is unbeatable... the perfect getaway from busy city life. The grounds are also fantastic, with a 24 hour pool/hot tub perched on top of the hill overlooking the valley. The only bummer was we couldn't figure out how to get our ipods to work with the TV system - would be nice if they had an iHome or something easier for playing your own music instead of getting stuck with the Easy Listening channel. Carneros Inn is definitely a splurge but worth every penny... we were supposed to just stay Friday night and within hours decided to extend our stay through Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much we even got married here”
Reviews.Author: BrixNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Carneros Inn about 10 times in the past 5 years and every time our experience gets better. The rooms have been impeccably maintained and even upgraded since we started coming here. From the personal backyard, heated floors in the bathroom and outdoor showers, it's hard to beat Carneros in the valley. Most recently we splurged and stayed in a room with an outdoor bathtub and fire pit which was amazing especially on a chilly December day. The boonfly cafe has the best breakfast around and FARM is great for dinner or just cocktails and a light bite. I really enjoyed swimming laps in the heated pool every morning and the Hilltop pool is a great place to relax after a long day of wine tasting. We usually like to stay at a new hotel each trip, but we keep going back to the Carneros Inn. On our last trip we stayed at Carneros for 4 nights and went up to Solage Calistoga for 2 nights and unfortunately we were so spoiled at Carneros that Solage was a bit of a letdown by comparison...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and relaxing accomodation”
Reviews.Author: mommdoc
Reviews.Content: We came to Napa, a family of 5, for one night only on a trip to see family and chose the carneros inn. The Inn is very understated and driving in up to the registration building seemed like we were going to a vineyard. Checking in was easy and efficient, wine was flowing and people were friendly. Our accommodations were exquisite with every inch of the entire suite comfortable, clean and inviting. After a hot tub my daughter and I sat by a fire on the private terrace while the boys watched a basketball game. We almost didn't want to leave to get dinner. We had breakfast in the Boonfly cafe the next morning where the wait was ridiculous and the food was average, so really the only criticism. I had heard that a kennel was close by but never heard any animals. Will definitely come back next time we are in Napa

Reviews.Title: “Understanding the customer”
Reviews.Author: DMSG
Reviews.Content: We visited Napa 3 years ago and discovered the Carneros Inn. If we ever come back to this area we thought . . . Well, we returned and stayed for 3 luxurious nights. The quality of the resort and the helpfulness of the staff enhanced the experience. The privacy of our cottage near the vineyards, with a small garden and only the company of birds was unusual and very welcome. We cycled quite a few miles over two days and appreciated the skill of the spa staff as well. Very few hotels or airlines truly make the customer the center of their ethos. The Carneros Inn succeeds where so many others fail. We particularly appreciated seeing the head of operations serving coffee at breakfast, available to anyone who had queries or comments. Other establishments should take note.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth stay at the Carneros - honeymoon, this time!”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Carneros Inn for a mini-moon. We had already traveled to the Maldives for our official, much longer honeymoon, but because we had to be in the Bay Area anyway for my husband's work, we decided to make a fun trip out of it. When confirming our reservation, the reservationist on the phone from the Carneros Inn made a special notation that we were celebrating our recent marriage. Only because she had made our half-work/half-fun trip into a honeymoon trip, we anticipated something special from the Carneros. Mind you, this is our fourth trip to the Carneros, so as repeat guests, we expect the typical bottle of wine and cheese plate provided upon check-in. We were disappointed to find out that there were no special "perks" provided to honeymooning couples. We did receive a bottle of chardonnay and the cheese plate, as well as the general manager's note. The Carneros was noticeably less full this time than our previous visits (all during summer/crush season). It seemed to us that all guests were localized around only a few clusters of cottages. We were able to get an extra hour before check out on our final morning; check out is normally at 12 noon. To receive late check out, call the front desk around 8am on the morning of your last day. Boon Fly breakfasts and lunches were fantastic and consistently delicious, as always. Room service dinner took exactly the amount of time we were told (about 35-45 minutes). The quality of the food served through cottage dining is decidedly inferior to the hilltop dining room and Boon Fly, so we recommend going out for dinner unless you absolutely cannot make it out. I'm at a loss for words to describe the ribeye steak I ordered, and my husband's bolognese -- while tastier than mine -- was just okay. Friends who have also stayed at the Carneros have told me breakfast room service is the way to go if you want the baker's dozen donuts (perfection!) but want to lounge in your private patio. We visited Plumpjack Winery for a tasting during this trip and were told our tastings would be free as part of our stay at the Carneros. We were also told tastings are free at Cade Winery for guests of the Carneros. The Plumpjack wines were surprising and delicious -- go! This is still our go-to hotel in Napa. I'm sure we will indulge in many more visits to the Carneros in the long run, but I am curious about staying in Yountville, particularly Bardessono. The Carneros Inn is much more lively and comfortable in the warmer months, as expected, but it's luxurious and charming any time of year. One of our absolute favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Charm at its Best”
Reviews.Author: KristyT1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September and it was amazing. Luxurious, but in a country, cozy, charming kind of way. The rooms are very unique. They are clean, spacious, very appealing, and make you feel like you have your own little farm guest house. The bathrooms were huge. Decor is lovely. The grounds are breathtakingly beautiful and we rested by the pool one afternoon with a bottle of wine. Was awesome. The food at the hotel is great. We had breakfast at the one of the restaurants (I believe near or in that big red barn looking building) and we had cocktails and appetizers out by the firepit one night. The hotel is convenient to the wineries. We took a couple of day trips and had a driver take us to many boutique wineries nearby and it was a true pleasure to get to come back to the Carneros Inn and fall into that big white fluffy bed. If you want to do the California wine country and want to do it right, the Carneros inn is the perfect answer for you delivering first-class amenities with first-class country charm.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous romantic Inn”
Reviews.Author: off-for-a-ride
Reviews.Content: I have had a few very pleasurable weekends here. The rooms are very nice. It is certainly worth the extra for the larger rooms with a fireplace and outdoor bath. The garden areas are all very private and it is a great way to relax after a hard days wine tasting. The bathrooms are large and well equiped with two coffee machines (one espresso and one filter). The restaurants are both very good. I recomend taking one of the free bikes and cycling to the nearby Domaine Carneros (for Taittinger style champers) and with a little more effort up to Arteta winery. It will make your evening dip in the beautiful hilltop pool feel that much nicer. The concierge will book winery visits and suggest great schedules with barrel tastings and great meals. If you need a driver they will fix that for you too. Just enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent proposal”
Reviews.Author: rrizekperalta
Reviews.Content: We stayed last october for 3 days and it was spectacular, the enviroment, the villas, the weather, excellent, also the food. A completely different experience. Want to do it again

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: the5mccools
Reviews.Content: this place is amazing! fireplace, huge patio, and an outdoor shower?! wish we could have stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect escape for Bay Area and Sacramento resort seekers”
Reviews.Author: SFOCDN
Reviews.Content: My third stay at Carneros and I know why I keep coming back. The resort is easy to get to, provides an understated yet luxurious experience, the accommodation is very comfortable and they have thought of everything. I stayed in a premium cottage complete with it's own private outdoor patio, fireplace, outdoor shower. Highly recommend paying the extra price. My two dogs were welcomed warmly. Best memories this time, morning sunrise swim at the hilltop pool complete with steam rising from the water, crispy Tortilla and poached egg breakfast, the surprise visit by a balloon NYE morning, exception dining experiences at both the bar in Boon Fly and of course new menu at Farm... The staff are gracious and accommodating. We stayed the last two days of 2011....such a memorable way to complete 2011...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: JMYH
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Carneros Inn was part of our 10th anniversary celebration and we could not have dreamt of a better stay from the moment we booked it. A reservation agent wrote back requesting for the name of my partner and a concierge helped us with lunch and dinner reservations. As we couldn't get back to the concierge in time, they went the extra mile and reserved various time slots and restaurants so we could pick the one we wanted when we got there. The cottage was amazing - comfy bed, chaise lounge, heated bathroom floor tiles, fireplace, patio, outdoor lounge chairs and a lovely view. The outdoor shower looked great too but was a little cold for us to give it a try. The only downside is that the heating system whirls quite a bit when it kicks in and I was conscious of it at times when sleeping (so I've taken off 1 point but if you're not a light-ish sleeper and not fighting jet lag, it'd be fine). The property per se is gorgeous. It was peaceful, well kept, the gardens were beautiful even in winter; and let's not forget the 2 heated pools and hot tub. Wow! Everyone we met was professional, friendly and helpful. Service was top notch and we received a delicious treat for our anniversary celebrations. It was hard leaving Carneros Inn. We could have stayed on and on and on and on...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mb-lars
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my family. Very cool setting. We were really happy when we pulled up to see the big open court yard with fire pits blazing, bocce ball courts and open spaces. We were a bit put off at check in by the unfriendly desk clerk. We then asked about the Amex card promotion that they would upgrade us if a nicer room was available. When we asked, the clerk told us we were upgraded but when we questioned the upgrade we did not get an answer as to what the upgrade was. Anyway, another girl brought us a nice glass of wine and we were off to our room. The rooms were simple and clean. Farmhouse modern. The bathroom floors are heated and felt great. The beds were cozy but the dogs from the kennel across the street started barking around 5am and I could not go back to sleep. The pools are heated and we used the pools and jacuzzis. The hilltop restaurant has the best breakfast ever! Everything was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “The Dog Kennel Next Door...”
Reviews.Author: 415Mike
Reviews.Content: There is a dog kennel across the street from the Carneros Inn. I stayed in the Hall subgroup of rooms, and I would imagine that the same is true for all rooms near the Boonfly restaurant, but you can hear the dogs barking and yelping all night long from the kennel next door. I am a deep sleeper and was awakened twice. The rooms are very nice and the resort has wonderful amenities, but if getting a relaxing night of sleep is in your plans I would look elsewhere or make sure that you stay as far away from Boonfly as possible. The thing that most upset me was that the concierge/check-in assistant made no mention of this at check-in and at check-out just kind of shrugged when I explained the situation. At $400+ per night I would expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not the coziest”
Reviews.Author: NSIInnerloop2
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a great place. Deserving of its lofty rating, but I don't think it is QUITE the ideal place or the best option if searching widely in Napa. First, the positives. The service is quite good, the whole reception & check-in process sets the right tone right at the start, pure luxury. The rooms are also excellent in size & appointments. Fireplace, outdoor shower, killer bathroom, etc. Can't really complain. The issues I would take are these. The decor style of the place is a bit off-putting to me. Its not "old world luxury" nor is it "rustic" or even remotely "warm". Its more like "21st century shed" style. Its a sort of minimalist, clean, probably very eco-friendly style, for it leaves me a bit cold when I compare it to other places in this area that ooze character & warmth. This also extends to the pool area which, while very nice, also has a touch of "sterility" and "just built" vibe to it. This may not be a negative for everyone, but for the price I like to feel like there's a bit of history behind things or luxury materials. My other concern is that this is a combination hotel & vacation ownership property, like many top properties in this area. I can't fault them for that, but whenever I stay at a hotel that is split this way, it often makes my stay feel like less of a focus of the property. I'm sure the added units allow for more facilities (additional pools, exercise rooms, restaurants, etc.) but I generally would prefer a place that is 100% focused on the hotel side of the business. One more thing - the location is OK but not great. Its not close to any town center and its on a pretty busy street, so much so that most of the property is (wisely) behind a fence on the road-side. This leads to a sense of being "fenced in" a bit as opposed to being nestled within a wine country town. The place IS basically its own town, but lacks the warm feeling of a true wine country community.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing--but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Sarah40Chicago
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Carneros Inn twice, and it is my absolute favorite place for a quiet romantic getaway. This place is 5 star all the way, and I would never stay anywhere else in the Napa Valley (as long as we can afford it, that is!) On our last visit, we stayed in a 2 bedroom cottage with its own outdoor fireplace and hot tub. It was actually one of the "orchard homes" that they were selling as fractional ownership (aka timeshare) properties. The cottage was absolutely stunning; all the finishes were brand new and luxurious right down to the bedding. We basically lazed the day away lounging around our cottage. The grounds of the Carneros Inn are spectacular and we love the pool and spa. The restaurant, FARM, is also wonderful, as is the poolside restaurant for a more casual breakfast or lunch. The only downside is how expensive this place is. I also would never come here with my kids...I don't think it is child-friendly at all and I have no idea what kids would do around this place.

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation in the Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: lanerikeel
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here and it was absolutely FAB! The two bedroom cottage had two bedrooms with full baths/dual sinks in each. An additional murphy bed. Big, open living, dining and kitchen area. The Refrigerator was stocked with bottled water, soft drinks, cheese and crackers, and a bottle of wine. The Outdoor area was just as fabulous! Had a fireplace indoors and outdoors, an ADDITIONAL screened in patio; hot tub, barbeque, etc. Between the indoors and outdoors it was like having two full living rooms. It was spaced beautifully. The design really optimized the space. The spa was awesome! Took a bath on the roof overlooking the scenery. Services were great. Food, service everything was top notch! You could spend the weekend here relaxing if you wanted. But it's proximity to Yountville and it's great eateries, as well as Napa/Sonoma vinyards make it a great location to enjoy everything the wine country offers. Romantic for couples, but also a FAB place for a long weekend with the girls! Going back same time next year!

Reviews.Title: “Third visit at the Carneros -- still my favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: Just a few notes since my last review in July 2011. Since this was the first return visit (of three total stays at the Carneros) that had us checking in as repeat visitors, we received a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc and a cheese plate a few hours after check-in. A nice touch, which was also accompanied by a note from the general manager of the resort. This was the first cottage we have stayed in that had an outdoor private patio that turned out not to be completely private. There were two windows from a neighboring cottage that opened into our cottage. It wasn't too much of an issue since that cottage turned out not to be occupied the entire duration of our stay in September, but it was a bit of a surprise when we noticed the window shut one evening as we lounged on the outdoor chaises. Everything was fantastic, as always! I couldn't recommend the property more highly to friends and family. We love it so much that we even considered holding our wedding in the apple orchard!

Reviews.Title: “The "Country" in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: ViennaVoyager
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our fourth visit to the Carneros Inn. It is our home base for our annual trek to Napa and Sonoma. There isn't anyplace like it in Napa (or anywhere else for that matter). We love having our own little cottage with its rocking chairs on the front steps, the fire place, the comfy beds, and the bathroom with its heated tiles and wonderful indoor & outdoor shower. The back patio with its private garden, lounge chairs, outdoor dining table and beautiful landscape add to the experience. There is a great sense of being outside and being in the place you are visiting. There is a lot to say so here's my short list of highlights and things to consider. Location, Location, Location. Carneros Inn is a great spot if you want to spend time in both Sonoma and Napa. You are strategically located to get to locations in either place. If you are into Carneros chardonnay you are in the heartland. There are also many nice wineries right near the property so that you can sit out the Saturday and Sunday crowds that overtake Rt. 29 and the Silverado Trail on the weekend. Artessa is within walking distance. Carneros Inn's front desk and concierge staff are the best. Harley Carr, one of the ace concierge staff, provides excellent recommendations on where to find the best wine and food in Napa and Sonoma including setting up great personal tastings and keeping you far away from the drunk bridesmaid and bachelors motoring around Napa. His recommendations make for an excellent experience taking you to places you probably wouldn't have found on your own. This year they have Kindles so you can borrow a Kindle and read the latest. They also have plenty of interesting reads for those who prefer the physical reading experience rather than the digital one. The Hilltop Restaurant for guests only is an excellent place to relax after the trip to Napa. It looks over a beautiful horizon pool, a farm and the vineyards. At the Spa you will have great services and friendly staff. There is some spa misfiring going on here. Unlike other resort spas where you are taken to the locker room, here they send you in on your own where you forage for robes and spa shoes. The waiting room could use some more attention but you forget about all this when you have GREAT services. Having been there four times, it's not a fluke, it's not luck, it's how they do it. The products are nice, there's some nice, but expensive shopping at the little spa store. All in all a good experience. Farm, Boon Fly, and the Marketplace are very nice. Farm's outdoor fire pits and comfortable chairs make a good place to relax after a day of touring or spa-ing or wine tasting. The restaurant has a hip feel and a good wine list. The food is good but over priced in light of other restaurants in the Valley. Even taking a very expensive bottle of wine out of the equation, it was still one of the more expensive dinners in Napa - very good but not great. But again, the staff was tremendous, and patient, and very knowledgeable about the food and the wine. Everyone should go there once and then decide for yourself if you want to go back. Try the little fresh donuts a Boon Fly. They are delicious. The gym is great overlooking another pool. It looks like a barn. When the doors are open you can get your cardio while overlooking the pool. Unlike other hotels where you need to upload pictures to get a feel for the real look and feel of the place. The official pictures do the job. Here are a few things to consider. Carneros Inn requires you to pay for your entire stay at the time you book your stay. I understand the need to do this for folks who want to motor up from San Francisco for the weekend and who might be inclined to change their mind at the last minute, but having thousands of dollars tied up months in advance is ridiculous. They need a better plan - pay for the first two nights on booking (this would cover the weekenders) and then some other plan for the balance of the trip. We've also had some minor housekeeping issues - not having our room made up until late in the day (3pm or later) even when we left our room with the nice make up room light on by 9:30. This has been a problem when we are there on a Thursday or Friday. My guess is they are focusing on getting the rooms ready for the new guests. The housekeeping is great it's just the time of arrival that is an issue from time to time. The bottom line is that this is an amazing place with a great staff and great amenities. I love the outdoor shower architecturally integrated into the cottage. Every year we look around and we wind up back at the Carneros Inn. For us, that says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Country retreat meets modern chic!”
Reviews.Author: ericamcarr
Reviews.Content: When you pull into the Carneros Inn you know you are in for something special. The service at the front desk was insanely precise. You are checked in and whisked away to your little cabin. The shower and tub make you never want to leave. After 2 days I was completely chillled out after 2 days. The Farm restaurant was also very good. Although very expensive, it ranks high in wine country as THE place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Napa resorts”
Reviews.Author: hedgehog61
Reviews.Content: This was the second stay here for my wife and I. The first was just after they opened and had not been discovered and was still off the radar of most veteran Napa travelers. The experience was just as nice the second time around and in many ways better. We love the cabins with the heated floors in the bathroom and the outdoor shower. Service is everything you would expect from a high end resort. The concierge was awesome in helping us plan a couple of specialized winery stops. (We recommend Kelham, the concierge will make you an appointment. Go for lunch). The setting is fantastic and since you are at the south end of the valley, avoid the chaos on 29. Also, you are much closer to the city of Napa. This is now our first choice for a Napa getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great girls getaway”
Reviews.Author: tripalots
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Carneros - 2 rooms, 4 women cruising through Napa! Loved the fireplace and free water and soft drinks in room. Great bathroom with heated floors, indoor and outdoor showers. We had breakfast at Boon Fly, really good and an amazing dinner at FARM - would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa resort”
Reviews.Author: MEMBER23
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 2 nights at The Carneros Inn in October. The resort was ever bit as wonderful as I had imagined. The cabins were small, but tastefully decorated and extremely comfortable; the heated floors in the bathrooms were a nice touch! Dinner at Farm is very tasty, but the portion size seemed a bit small for the prices they were charging. The Inn was extremely private, quite, and relaxing. I found it to be a great staging point for visiting wineries in Napa or Somoma and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: divekaren
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Carneros Inn, so obviously we liked it enough to return. The service is top notch, starting the second you pull up, the valet comes by to welcome you and ushers you into the registration area. There you are offered a glass of wine while you check in. The cottages are very well equipped with an outside patio table and chairs, 2 lounge chairs and gas heater. The bathroom is large with both a shower (our cottage included an indoor/outdoor shower) and a bathtub. A full size coffee maker is included in the room. There is a flat screen TV with blue ray player - complimentary DVDs can be borrowed at registration (wine was offered to us again when we went to select a movie!). A small bar fridge is filled with complimentary sodas and bottled water. We ate breakfast the the Hilltop Dining Room (see separate review) which has a great view of the vineyards. Also at the hilltop is the infinity pool and hot tub (no kids allowed at this pool) - the pool staff bring you a bucket of ice with bottled water and snack menus. Sunscreen (pump) is available at the pool desk if you forget to bring some. We spent most of our time relaxing by the pool or enjoying wine on our patio. I also scheduled a massage at the spa which was wonderful (didn't need a reservation because it was a weekday, but may need one on the weekends). The grounds are beautiful with fruit trees (with fruit for the picking!) and walking paths. There is a gym and exercise pool (kids okay here), which included yoga classes on the weekend. For food, you can walk to Boon Fly (casual), The Farm (make a reservation) or The Market (grocery store/deli/gift shop) all on the property. Turndown service included 2 scrumptous chocolates in a beautiful box. We really felt pampered at Carneros Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: erin92474
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 1 year anniversary at the Carneros Inn. After we booked our stay, many friends told us to stay farther north closer to the vineyards. I am very happy that we didn't take their advice because we loved the Carneros Inn. The grounds are absolutely stunning. Everyone should make sure to at least watch one sunset by the pool. The accomodations were quite nice. The cottages are so cute and very well maintained. Lots of privacy. The cottages are a bit on the small size when it comes to storage space for luggage and clothes but that is quickly forgotten when you see the great porch/backyard that comes with every cottage. We stayed in the Crane complex. Perfect location to both the pool/spa and to the restaurants. The spa was wonderful. I highly recommend the goat milk facial. Massage was great too. Superb spa service overall! Concierge seemed very accomodating. We didn't really use them since I had booked the majority of our tastings and tours on my own but I was told by other friends who stayed there that they were very helpful in booking that kind of stuff for visitors. We stayed at the end of Harvest season so the place was completely booked and unfortunately we were not able to get the benefit of an automatic upgrade through Amex Platinum. The only regret I have is not spending more time at the actually inn while visiting wine country. I would definitely come back to stay at the Carneros Inn and will definitely be recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Beautiful, Unforgetable”
Reviews.Author: Jodi C
Reviews.Content: We just got home from the Carneros Inn located in Napa, CA. My husband and I wanted a relaxing vacation and we got just that. This place was so peaceful and the service was exceptional. We were welcomed with a glass of wine (of course) and a wonderful itinerary for the next few days. The hotel recommended a few wineries that were great. They put together a car and driver for us so we wouldn't have to worry about driving. The hotel was clean and there were no kids in sight. Our hotel room was a "cabin" with our own private enterance, fireplace, outdoor shower and tub and outdoor fireplace!! Twice per day maid service, warm pool and hot tub overlooking the immaculate grounds. There are two great restaurants on the property that were wonderful...and the spa was great. I would highly reccomend this place to anyone looking to "get away from it all". This was truly a relaxing vacation. We can't wait to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Resort”
Reviews.Author: FromAdams
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our honeymoon at the Carneros Inn, and have only wonderful memories and positive impressions from our visit. The cottage (Peck 4) was immaculate, the grounds perfectly tended, the service warm and helpful. Our check in was very welcoming, we enjoyed a few glasses of a nice red while learning about the resort. The management had a nice gift and note waiting for us, congratulating us on our marriage. The weather was rainy and cool the first few nights we were in Napa--the fireplace in our room was perfect those nights. Room service was fast and friendly, even if it meant delivering extra "EnviroLogs" for the fireplace in a downpour. And we appreciated the later in the day room cleaning; we often spent the morning going for a run, using the gym, or having coffee in the hot tub that overlooks the vineyards, and did not want to return to a cleaning staff waiting outside our door. The look of the Inn is interesting-- a funky agricultural style that somehow looks rural and modern at once. Loved our "back yard" area, with the outdoor tub, radiant heaters over the lounge chairs, gas fire pit. Once the weather improved, we spent some time out there every night (even cancelled dinner reservations at Farm to have cottage dining by our fire pit...nice). (Also, note that you can probably get anything off the restaurant menus as room device: we ordered off-menu twice and the staff was happy to accommodate.) Any drawbacks? Carneros is at the southern end of the Valley, so expect to spend some time driving if you have activities planned in St Helena, Calistoga etc. This was only a minor inconvenience to us, as we usually don't plan to return home during our trips anyway. And there are worse ways to pass time than driving past the beautiful vineyards and wineries on the way. On a plus side, you will be among some beautiful vineyards. We ran up to Artesa Winery before they opened one morning (thanks, gate keeper for letting us in!). Stunning views, makes the run up the hill worth it, mostly. And we needed more time (and better weather) to enjoy all the activities and facilities on-site. Too much to do in Napa! (Try to arrange an Estate tour at Ladera on Howell Mountain, and go to the olive oil tour and tasting at Round Pond as a nice break from all the amazing cabs you'll be tasting. A private cooking class was fun too: cooksbookscorks.com) My wife and I were exceptionally pleased by every aspect of our stay at Carneros Inn, and recommend it for couples looking for some pampered privacy in a gorgeous setting.(I suppose it would also be a nice place to bring the kids, but really, why??)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, some flaws”
Reviews.Author: vision4bg
Reviews.Content: The good - beautiful cottages, the outside shower, very good room service. Nice welcome gift in room. Loved the fireplace. The okay - a little far to get to some of the better restaurants in the area, mixed service (but generally good). Somewhat expensive. Uncomfortable bed. The bad - housekeeping came very late in the day, and disrupted our plans. Lots of mosquitos. First thing in the morning on both days of our stay there were leaf blowers and lawn mowers directly outside our room for several hours.

Reviews.Title: “The Carneros Inn: You had me at hello...THEN YOU LOST ME.”
Reviews.Author: TheCains
Reviews.Content: Driving onto this property really doesn't give one a good sense of the beauty, both natural and man-made that is to come. It really isn't until you pass through the registration area and get your first glimpse of the sky, mountains and infinity pool from the main restaurant that you take a deep breath, exhale and think to yourself "Hello, Carneros Inn." Just as your initial entrance to this property is deceiving and has you seriously wondering if you have made a costly mistake, the same goes for the journey to your cottage. The property's narrow streets are dotted on each side with what looks like small and smaller cottages squeezed onto every square inch of land separated by narrow paths and wood fences. Something about the space and the design gives you the distinct feeling that you may be in the deep south and that it's possible you will be accosted by a "gator" at any given moment. In the nick of time you open the door to your cottage and again think to yourself "Well hello Carneros, I think we will be friends." The cottage (we were two couples staying in a two bedroom suite) was perfectly fine; spacious, well stocked and very comfortable with a full bath off each bedroom. Ironically, I found the decor to be a bit confused, much like the rest of the property (not to mention the management-see below), as it wasn't sure if it was a sleek Manhattan penthouse (marble dining table with ivory leather chairs) or a cool, casual, California cottage (painted white wood walls, wicker outdoor furniture and painted wood fence surrounding the unit). Hmm...odd but acceptable. As I said, the villa was very well equipped from the small, yet functional galley kitchen stocked with necessities like water and milk (even a bottle each of red and white wine - keep reading as this becomes a big issue), with a nice sized deck with outdoor grill, an outdoor fireplace with pre-made fire starter kits and several outdoor seating areas with individual blankets. There was a small outdoor hot tub and the bedrooms were comfortable with exceedingly fresh, white linen bedding and a bathroom with a shower that had a door leading directly into an outside shower. Oddly duplicative? Yes, but an interesting and very "natural" design making you wonder if you showering inside or out. Frankly, I still don't know. After all of this, how then, dear Carneros Inn, could things have taken such a turn as to land on the dark side of non-existent guest satisfaction? One word: Management. Immediately upon arriving at registration, there wasn't any warm welcome. I would call it a luke warm welcome with a side of smarmy. dWe arrived around 10:30 am and as they knew, we had travelled quite a far distance from out of state. We were told that our unit was not yet ready but that they had requested expedited housekeeping and they would call us as soon as it was ready. We were briefly shown the adjacent area of the property and sent on our way feeling like children told to go outside somewhere and play until called. We all felt it was strongly implied that we would be able to get into our cottage before the very late 4:00 pm technical check-in time. Having heard nothing by 2:00 pm we contacted them and were abruptly told that it still wasn't ready and that it would be ready at 4:00 pm. Annoying. Having run out of things to do/see over the last 5+ hours and now completely exhausted, we head back to the property shortly after 3:00 pm. We are once again, now tersely told, it is not ready, then arrogantly reminded that the check-in time is 4:00 pm and it would be ready at that time. We sit, we eat cheese, we drink wine, we try to laugh it off and of course, we wait...and wait. A young waiter, named Stephen, seemed to be the only one around with any sense whatsoever as to how to treat guests and he did an excellent job trying to diffuse the situation, and imagine this...to make us feel welcome. Time check: 4:33 pm. Management decides it is time to let us know, albeit unapologetically, that the air conditioning was broken but is now fixed so we can get in. Glory, glory hallelujah. As mentioned above, the unit came with a bottle of "Shop-Carneros 2008 Pinot Noir". We enjoyed it and given our deliriously exhausted state, decided it best to order room service for dinner and another bottle of this 2008 Pinot. Not to be caught wildly off guard related to the cost of our new found friend, I asked and was told it was $59, which was fine. The wine turned out to be $80 a bottle because of the room service fee (we always knew there would be a service fee) and over the course of the weekend, we ordered another bottle of the Pinot for a total of 2 bottles delivered to our cottage. Over the weekend, in addition to the room service and wine, we patronized the restaurant for breakfast 3 times, had spa treatments, lunch from "The Market" (their on-premise deli and gift shop), and purchased numerous gift items in the shop as well. It was while we were in The Market that we noticed something quite disturbing...the wine we were charged $80 a bottle for was being sold to anyone who could jump off a party bus for $25 a bottle! (The Market is not restricted to guests and is just off the main road.) Logically, we thought there must have been a mistake in our charge; we should have been charged maybe $40-$45 a bottle which would include the room service fee and seem reasonable given The Market's $25 price tag - not $80 a bottle. Upon check-out we pleasantly addressed this as an obvious honest mistake. Ah...afraid not. Although we gave very valid reasons why this wasn't a proper thing to do to guests who were spending $2,000 a night for the cottage, our complaint, clearly based on the principal of the matter versus the actual dollar amount, fell on deaf ears. The management was smug and glib and eventually offered us a $20 credit towards one of our breakfasts as compensation for the issue! They had no coherent or valid argument as to why this was appropriate but they just kept saying the same lame, arrogant, patronizing and dishonest statement, "Oh...so sorry, but there is nothing we can do about it." Well, right back at you Carneros, as there is nothing I can do about the bad review you are now receiving that will be posted often and forwarded extensively. If The Carneros Inn wasn't motivated to deceive and gouge their guests, then why wouldn't they put one of their silly little notes on the complimentary bottle (said silliness, by the way, litter the cottage advising ludicrous things like the date the wild flowers in the bathroom were picked) telling guests that this wine could also be purchased directly for a reasonable price at The Market. The Carneros Inn seriously lacks proper guest service from management. They could take many a lesson from places such as The Ritz Carlton, Mandarin Oriental or an amazing property with equally amazing service, The Villa by Barton G. located in South Beach, Miami. Frankly, even young Stephen their restaurant waiter, could "school" them on guest treatment in a G- rated manner of beat down. Be sure to avoid The Carneros Inn if you expect a certain level of service for a couple grand a night and do not wish for a luke warm welcoming, late check-in, being price gouged, nickeled and dimed, patronized, insulted and unceremoniously dismissed - in that order. There are lots of other big fish in the wine country sea so accept my condolences, Carneros Innâ€¦youâ€™re dead to me. Quite a shame; you could have been a contender.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: DavidChavkin
Reviews.Content: I might start off by mentioning that this was the most expensive hotel room rate that I have ever paid (with one exception for the Inn at Little Washington). It was scheduled to be harvest weekend in Napa (although the peak harvest was pushed back a few weeks by weather) and I was delighted to find any space at any inn. The Carneros Inn was available and I jumped at the opportunity for a romantic weekend away. I would have been hard-pressed afterwards to deny the "value" of the experience. The complex is relatively small and set on one of the hillsides just off the main road through the Carneros region of Napa. As you drive through the gate up to registration you feel incredibly confused initially and soon discover your way around a complex that is designed to maximize privacy and intimacy. Staff members at registration were friendly and helpful and the staff generally were always available without being obtrusive. We were offered wine and fruit and chocolate at registration and the process was speedy and efficient. We were then escorted to our cottage by following a staff member on bicycle and got the basic lay of the land. My partner is a swimmer and loved the heated infinity adults-only pool (there are family pools on the property as well) at the top of the property near registration. From the right positions at the pool, one can see cattle graze on hillsides near beautifully manicured rows of grapes. Since I am a runner, I was especially pleased by the beautiful running paths on the wide well-marked shoulders of roads nearby. Our cottage was large and comfortable with an outside shower and fireplace. The bathroom had both a soaking tub and shower and every aspect was comfortable and well-designed without being ostentatiously showy. The bed linens were soft and only added to the overall experience. We had the opportunity to have breakfast/brunch next to the pool and had an excellent meal overlooking the vineyards nearby. Spending harvest time in Napa on a sunny weekend is a tough job, but somebody has to do it. We also had the opportunity to have a couples massage in the spa. Since there are extensive locker facilities (with steam room and sauna) in the spa, we were not troubled (as apparently some have been) by wearing bathrobes in the lodge. We were treated in a friendly professional manner at check-in and the locker room was clean and well-stocked with amenities. The massage was in a room that was clean and well-designed and almost industrial in style, but stocked with the requisite new age music. The massage therapists were very effective and solicitous - not always an easy thing to do when meeting new customers for perhaps the one and only time. All in all, the experience was a 5-star experience from beginning to end.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: RobinGDayton
Reviews.Content: The Carneros Inn is very unique. The furnishings are contemporary and upscale. We loved the outside showers. The window looking out onto the vineyards is breathtaking. The hot tub and pool are beautiful. The massage I had at the spa was fabulous. The only shortcomings I saw were that the rooms were a bit crowded with the furniture and we were supposed to have an early checkin which did not happen. Otherwise, I would highly recommend Carneros.

Reviews.Title: “The only bad thing here is the fact that we had to go home!”
Reviews.Author: stb3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 5 yr old daughter. We absolutely loved this place. The little farm house rooms were so incredibly charming with a luxurious simplicity that is totally California. We stayed in the Larson 2 room. It was a handicapped accessible room, though we did not need it. One note... A person in a wheel chair could not possibly use that six foot high make-up mirror or hang their towels on those very high hooks! I was standing on my tip toes just to put on mascara! We experienced such a wonderful hospitality from the staff and The Farm restaurant was really incredible. The children's pool was clean and quiet, the staff was fantastic and really went out of their way for my daughter. There are lots of little places to enjoy little picnic at items bought at the Market, right on the property. I wish we had a little more time to do that but we were dead set on eating our way through Napa and Sonoma. The Rutherford grill was just incredible. Order the cornbread, if you want the best cornbread of your life. There are so many great places to eat, but we enjoyed a nice casual BBQ at V. Sattui winery, on our way to Castello Di Amoroso. We all enjoyed the castle- it was so much more authentic than I imagined. We did do the horse and carriage ride, which was a real treat for my daughter. The dungeon was kind of cool- I have never been in one before. Make sure you set up a tour for that- it's not able to be seen without one. We ate in Sonoma square at a place called El Dorado Kitchen- it was awesome. I'm not sure if I can complain while I am drinking good wine and eating great food and enjoying some of the most lovely scenery in the country. Anyhow, the Carneros is not in the best location as far as being at a winery every day, but it is so nice that you won't care. A great place- wish we could stay but life must go on. It is so chilly in the morning so bring a light jacket. If I hear one more explanation of how the fog makes it chilly and the warm air drags in the fog, blah blah... We get it! I will miss this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn”
Reviews.Author: Edward P
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Carneros Inn. We are from the East Coast and, while we frequently travel to San Francisco, I had not been to Napa for many years. The staff at the Inn are very friendly and outgoing. You are greeted with a class of wine, and the check in process is similar to a European hotel. The cottage and views were excellent. What really does not come across is the fact that you have a private side yard approximately 30'x 40'. The food also was excellent, and we would really recommend having breakfast at the Hilltop. We stay in a lot of nice hotels, but as I looked around Napa and the environs, this was a little unique. Apparently, the cottage design is due to the fact that they purchased a trailer park many years ago and could not get it rezoned. But, it has an upscale feel to it. The only other accommodation in the area I would be interested in is the Vallageo (sp) - but the Carneros Inn is a different and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JStanzione
Reviews.Content: The cottages here are so nice. We had great views and a lot of privacy. It was so relaxing and very clean. We will definately come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny, Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: CourtneySC01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed 4 days at the Carneros, Inn; having just returned last night, I'm already dreaming about when we can head back to the property. Although it was just the two of us this trip, it is a property that easily accommodates adult-only and family trips alike, and next time, we plan to bring the little one after seeing how family friendly it is without being overrun by kids. In fact, it wasn't over run by anybody - which is the beauty of the layout of the property itself. Before I go any further, I'm going to state the obvious: it is expensive, but we all know that prior to booking, and in relation to some of the other luxury properties in the area, it is reasonable; we found it to be absolutely worth the investment, especially after taking advantage of the discount since we booked 3 nights mid-week. We stayed in a King premier garden cottage, complete with front porch and rocking chairs, fireplace, spacious and totally private side yard, indoor-outdoor shower (this was way too much fun, I loved this feature, as did other guests - walking around you could recognize the water falling in the backyard and the delighted chatter) and heated bathroom floors (even in August, the chilly evenings lent themselves to use this feature, as well as the outdoor patio heater and fireplace.) The decor of the cottages was Restoration Hardware meets a Montauk bungalow. I absolutely adored it, and as a girl who is very picky about hotel bathrooms, this one knocked it out of the park. Clean, spacious, light, beautiful. Service was attentive at the adult pool without being annoying, the food was delicious, and the views throughout the property - but especially from the Hilltop pool and sitting areas - were FABULOUS. It was actually hard to leave the property to go wine tasting, and we spent much more time on site, (enjoying our garden and the heat lamp) that we originally expected to - which was a welcome change from our fast paced lives, and satisfied the true reason for this trip - lots of R & R. The grounds are beautiful, immaculate, and spacious - kudos to the landscape architect and maintenance team- there is plenty of quiet privacy, the perfect spot for a get away without the pomp and pretense of a typical luxury resort. The food at Farm was delicious, we dined on Sunday night - I highly recommend the lobster risotto and Diver scallops. Fantastic. And if Farm is closed when you are there, there is always food available, and it's always delicious. We had zero complaints about the restaurant schedules, although I did notice from some other reviewers that this was an issue for them. I simply recommend noting the different restaurant schedules and plan accordingly. We made use of the bikes, the gym, bocce, admired the cows, and appreciated self-parking and access to Market and a post office on site. Overall, an absolutely wonderful, memorable 4 days and we cannot wait to return next year. Truly, I found my happy place.

Reviews.Title: “Carneros Inn is still a winner”
Reviews.Author: 5starmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carneros Inn August 5-7 for the second time (our first stay was about 3 years ago). The staff upgraded our room to a heritage cottage and sent a fruit and cheese plate to welcome us back. The room was gorgeous and very private. One small issue - it was difficult to regulate the water temperature in the shower. The staff also gave us tickets to a complimentary wine tasting at the Vintners Collective in Napa, which was a lot of fun. We ate dinner at The Farm (good, but with a limited menu) and breakfast at the market was inexpensive and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “So amazing!”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaMom2boys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary at the end of June. First the one and only complaint I have about the hotel is that they didn't acknowledge our anniversary. Not that I'm expecting an upgrade and a bottle of champagne, but we are in wine country, how about a glass of wine? A note maybe? Other then that tiny thing the hotel made up for it with everything else and there was no need to find fault. The reviews speak for themselves. This hotel is fantastic. The concern I had going into the trip was if the hotel was in a good location having not been to the area before and I was uncertain if the location was what we wanted. We originally looked at hotels in Calastoga, and we were really happy we didn't end up there as it was a bit out of the way at the way top of Napa. We were also concerned that the Carneros would be too far from the restaurants in Yountville and we would spend too much time driving, however it was only a 15 minute drive. Here's the short of it, if you stay at the Carneros, you have this breathtaking property and facility that you won't find in Yountville. Words cannot describe it, and the trade off is the 15 minute drive to Yountville. If you stay in Yountville, your in this quaint little town where you can easily walk around but you miss the expansiveness and sheer beauty of the countryside. Which matters more? Next time, maybe will try Yountville, but you won't find any fault with the Carneros, we were in heaven. A truly amazing hotel, if you are looking for the best you won't b disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Approaching perfection....”
Reviews.Author: SpinRX
Reviews.Content: We decided to book a last-minute trip down to Napa to soak up some sun (a commodity missing in Seattle), drink some wine and generally decompress. I stumbled on The Carneros Innâ€™s web site. I wanted an experience similar to Meadowood, but not at the now-astronomical prices they charge. Carneros seemed to have the same vibe, so we took a flier. It was a great decision. If youâ€™ve read my reviews before, I have high â€“ perhaps impossibly high â€“ standards for hotels. Donâ€™t get me wrong â€“ it isnâ€™t about price. Iâ€™ve stayed and crowed about $80 Courtyard by Marriott hotels that stand and deliver what they promise, and screamed like a scalded cat about high-end resorts that just go through the motions. Carneros was such a perfect experience; I may include them in my hotel hall of fame. They succeeded at meeting and exceeding all our expectations. First, the grounds are lovely. The property apparently was built on the site of an old mobile-home lot. The construction is tasteful, in keeping with the landscape, and built with an eye to sustainability. When we arrived, the front desk crew and concierge staff was unhurried, helpful and seemingly truly interested in making sure we enjoyed our stay. They showed us the grounds then directed us to our a very well-appointed free-standing bungalow with ample interior room, a private patio and outdoor shower. We immediately headed over for the adult-only pool, where the staff there took excellent care of us while we let the sun burn away the mold from our soggy Northwest bodies. The pool had a little road noise interrupting the tranquility, but had big views and was a grand feature. The food in the informal dining room was great â€“ breakfast especially. Again, the staff there went above and beyond, doing as far as to dig through the lost and found to loan my wife a pair of sunglasses when decided to dine outside and the sun was affecting our Pacific NW mole-like light sensitivity. The formal dining was a bit of a disappointment â€“ the executive chef tried â€“ unsuccessfully â€“ to convince us that the farm-raised Atlantic salmon was far superior to the wild stuff we consider table-stakes in Seattle. We tried not to openly giggle as he made his case, but we failed. The little things, here, stood out. For example, lightning-fast wireless throughout, and no ridiculous up-charge for access; when I asked if there were papers for sale other than the free, daily Oakland Chronicle, the immediately offered to have the NYT and WSJ delivered daily; expert housekeeping that didnâ€™t miss anything in the two-times-daily cleaning. We also took a couple of yoga classes in the fitness center - top notch instructors and a great vibe there as well. So, if the management of the Plumpjack Resorts are reading this, know youâ€™ve got a great crew and a great property. My only fear is that if we visit again, it will be hard to approach perfection, which you did this time.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel In Napa”
Reviews.Author: beetrvln
Reviews.Content: The Carneros Inn is a great place to stay. We were served wine during the check-in process which was a nice touch after a long drive. One of the Bellman had us follow him while he was driving a golf cart. He took us to our cottage and WOW!! He spent time showing us all of the amenities and how to use the fire pit and high tech features. We booked into the Harvest Cottage and I highly recommend upgrading to this cottage. The back wall of the sleeping area is french doors that overlook the backyard. Each cottage is individual so you aren't attached to anyone else giving a very private and secluded feel to the resort. The bathroom is quite large with tile floors that are heated, so no cold feet in the morning. The indoor shower has a door on the backside that leads to an outdoor shower, so cool! The backyard was perfect. Stepping out onto the deck we had 2 lounge chairs with an overhead heater for the chilly mornings or nights. Stepping down a few steps we had a nice patio table, outdoor soaking tub, water feature and a sofa with a fire pit. We sat out every night by the fire pit enjoying our favorite wine from the days tastings. I really can't wait to go back, there is not one negative about the resort, our stay was amazing and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre service, but lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: cbernard1sc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 other couples for the Napa to Sonoma Half Marathon, July 16-19. The resort is lovely, the rooms great, the pool service was also very good. However, we like to use the Concierge at hotels for transportation, reservations or special events. Here, that just wasn't a good option. For $600/n we thought a courtesy car to drive us to the start line could have been arranged. Instead we could call a cab or walk (1.3 miles) before our 13.1 mile race. When they did call us a cab, it took several calls to get them to arrange the cabs and they only allow cabs to pick up at the front desk, not convenient since the rooms are a five minute walk from there. For appointments at wineries, they just said "they're full." Did you call? "No, we just know." This would be fine for a less expensive property, but we were disappointed at this price point. The spa was fine, but not over the top or particularly nice. The resort shop had lovely options as did the spa store.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in the world - definitely my happy place!”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: Napa is my happy place on Earth, and the Carneros has no small part as to why. This was my second stay at the Carneros, and I have nothing but generous, overflowing compliments for the hotel managers, staff, and maintenance workers. The grounds are beautifully maintained, and service is low-key and friendly but precise. It's everything a hotel should be! The Carneros Inn is located about a 15 minute drive from Yountville (where the desirable restaurants -- Bottega, ad hoc, Bouchon, etc -- are clustered). It's not the most convenient location if you plan on spending your time in Napa toward the north end near Calistoga. My fiance and I spent four full days in Napa this past month visiting wineries all over Napa (including Calistoga) and relaxing at the Carneros' wonderful pool and spa. Location wasn't an inconvenience for us at all. Every day, knowing that the heated chaise lounges in our private patio where we would drink wine was waiting for us after dinner made me quite content actually. If you plan your winery visits so that you're not constantly driving up and down Route 29, where you stay in Napa isn't that significant. Enough has been glowingly written about the Carneros' award-winning spa (it's definitely deserved!) and their amazing food at Boon Fly, FARM, and the Hilltop Dining Room. All are great options, even in Napa's crowded restaurant scene. FARM is likely the restaurant I would least recommend about the three -- it's generally crowded at night and the entrees aren't anything you won't find back at home (assuming you're from an urban area that has a fair number of organic/locavore-focused restaurants). Boon Fly has wonderful breakfasts, which should always include their baker's dozen donuts. I call them doughy bites of heaven; my fiance had his doubts about the donuts, given the number of superlatives I had used to describe their perfection. But he is a convert and devout follower now. Eat. Those. Donuts. The Carneros is really a semi-autonomous village of sorts that caters to wealthy vacationers. There's a Market that sells organic produce and products (including a small selection of wines) as well as a post office that can ship wine back to your home for an additional fee. Everyone stays in their individual private cottages, replete with all the amenities you will find in a five-star city hotel. There's not much I can say about the Carneros except stay there! It's my absolute favorite hotel in the world, and it should be yours too!

Reviews.Title: “Complete Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: alk
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Carneros Inn. It is one of the most peaceful places I have ever been. The grounds are gorgeous with beautiful flowers, lavender and plants everywhere. The pool's setting is absolutely breathtaking. I never wanted to even leave the pool that's how relaxing it is. The cottages are really nice inside. We stayed in a Harvest Cottage. The inside of the cottage is small but very nice. The bathroom is large with heated floors! The outside area of the cottage is amazing with a private firepit, soaking tub, outdoor shower that leads to the indoor shower and heating lamps above the lounge chair. We found the service to be great. The spa was very nice and relaxing. Our meal at Farm was delicious although the service there was slow. All in all, the hotel is very peaceful and quiet. The hotel is at the southern end of the valley so be prepared to drive to get to places. We loved the Carneros Inn and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved it here, but shame about some of the service”
Reviews.Author: boppy80
Reviews.Content: The cottage and pools were stunning and overall we loved our stay here. However we felt the service did not match up to the price or rating of the resort. Check-in was adequate, though by no means the welcome we would expect from a 4 star hotel. This was a honeymoon booking and we know that had been noted when booking, but nothing was said or done to acknowledge this. Others checking in at the same time were allocated rooms early, but we had to wait until 4pm. We were told we could ring on our last day for a late check-out. When we did this, we were offered just half an hour extra. The manager we spoke to with this request was abrupt and unhelpful. I have an issue with the fact that even if they were totally booked out that night (and they weren't) then there is no way they can clean all the rooms at once, and so could easily have been more flexible than this. We know for a fact that our cottage was not cleaned until a good few hours later - so we could have been in enjoying it still in that time, rather than it being empty, and us having to leave feeling disgruntled. The Farm had been closed the other 2 nights of our stay (Mon&Tues it's shut) and so we explained we wanted to keep our room a few hours more so we could stay on for dinner. They still wouldn't budge on check-out time, which meant they didn't receive our custom at the Farm. I just don't understand this sort of inflexibilty, especially when we paid so much to stay here. We also found in-room requests to be hit and miss - we asked for fresh milk and extra tea to be sent to the room on one occasion, and despite waiting for it (as other times this had taken a while to come), it simply never turned up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for couples wanting a little luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bradbys
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel where you get your own wooden air-conditoned 'hut' with private garden, ours had a outside shower and bath. There is the normal spa, pool with super views and the service that you would expect at this price. We dined at the Boonfly Cafe which was very informal - recommend the ribs and donuts. We also ate at the Farm which is a high end restarent with a superb wine list. We met a couple on their honeymoon and they were delighted - we can't fault our stay either. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon made great by the Carneros Inn”
Reviews.Author: hokiejonp
Reviews.Content: There is a wide range of 4-star hotels in Napa/Sonoma but the Carneros Inn is definitely a fantastic memory. The grounds are peaceful and serine, the staff is responsive and yet able to remain in the background, it is exclusive but does not ooze pretentiousness. Even at full capacity you tended to not run in to others. This hotel is also a great way in to a lot of difficult reservations and the staff will be happy to help get you a table/tasting/tour at otherwise near-impossible locations. We loved every second of the trip, special thanks to Kevin at late-night check in, Lisa and Rosemary at concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “a rough diamond? Carneros Inn vs Solage”
Reviews.Author: LarryCable
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a couple of days at the Carneros Inn Napa, Ca. We chose the Carneros Inn, having passed it many times on our way to Solage, because neither Solage in Calistoga nor Bardessono in Yountville had no suitable vacancies. We stayed in a 2 king bed suite, since my SO's brother was in town. The suite was certainly the match of Solage, a chic "restoration hardware" look, with a small, bull full kitchen including fridge/freezer, dishwasher, Viking range, sink, coffee maker, kettle and assorted pots pans and cutlery etc. (there is even a washer/dryer in the closet). The dining/family room was a good size with large flat screen tv, couch, chairs, coffee table and LCD TV with Bose surround sound and Direct TV (there is also flat panel tvs in each bedroom, with directTV and dvd players, bose etc) The ability to open the family/dining room completely out to the enclosed back yard is wonderful; with outside lounge and dining, including a fireplace (and a gas BBQ also) while the garden is not huge, it is very private and comfortable, with your own hot tub to hand there is almost no reason to leave your room the whole weekend! We were in the Robleno area of the property which is relatively close to the main gate, Farm etc, which in turn is close to the main road bounding the property. The downside of this is of course you can hear the heavy traffic heading to/from Napa. This could be a major issue for some, especially compared to Solage, which despite being next to the Silverado Trail, is much quieter than Carneros. We dined at the superb Farm restaurant, the food was spectacular, and easily on a par with, if not exceeding that of SolBar. The restaurant and adjacent bar/lounge seem a lot less "claustrophobic" than Solage's SolBar area. The adult pool is located at the top of the hill near registration, the spa, and the main restaurant, it has some great views, and the hot tub is nice, it is a lot smaller than the main pool at Solage, but the pool services is about the same AWFUL. You have more chance of drinking from a desert mirage than getting one from the pool staff at either location! Room service seemed a bit more on the ball than the pool guys ... the continental breakfast was good, as were the hot items, on the whole I preferred the CI menu to that of Solage ... Overall I think both properties are about the same, I think Solage is a better, quieter location for Napa etc than Carneros, but in terms of accommodations, service and food both properties are about equivalent. While there is room for improvement in both properties, staying at either will be a wonderful experience for any Napa visitor.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place ever...”
Reviews.Author: jazzgator
Reviews.Content: If I could live in the Carneros Inn, I would. It's that good. My husband and I recently stayed in a Harvest Cottage, and it was by far one of the most unique/awesome places I've ever stayed in. From the fireplace and soaking tub inside to the fire pit and outdoor shower in the cottage's private patio outside, I did not want to leave. Despite unusually rainy/chilly weather, it did not take away from the resort in the slightest. We still used their amazing lap pool, lavender-scented steam room in the spa (which is free for guests), and all the cottages' outdoor amenities. We even used the fire pit to make s'mores, which the hotel thoughtfully left us a gift basket for. My only regret is that we stayed there two nights instead of three. I HIGHLY recommend staying in this hotel if you're going to Napa. The hotel is a destination in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimstooth
Reviews.Content: The cottages are amazing, it makes it so you don't even want to leave to go wine tasting! A great resort from top to bottom!!

Reviews.Title: “Showering under the stars and proximity to vineyards= heaven”
Reviews.Author: KristeninDenver
Reviews.Content: The Carneros Inn is a gorgeous modern farmhouse style resort that has it all. 3 wonderful restaurants onsite... private, spacious rooms that are immaculate and modern... lovely privates yards with your own outdoor shower and/or bath.... great spa... The list goes on and on. This resort is the perfect getaway in Napa with a modern flair. It has great conference facilities for business yet is perfect for a leisure vacation as well. It was the most romantic place I have ever stayed and I plan to go back again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “boutique cottages and peaceful groves”
Reviews.Author: marie6613
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a couple of days once you drive up to the main lobby and step out of the car, you immediately feel the warmth and peace of the place the lobby is very inviting and the cottages even more comfortable soft bed, eames chair, heated floors int eh bathroom, outdoor shower, wooden deck patio its so quiet here i love it the food is even more amazing! the farm has the best roasted chicken hands down in the US basted with butter! yum service is perfect as well

Reviews.Title: “Unique + Perfect Balance between Luxury and Summer Camp for Grown-ups”
Reviews.Author: GoBlue1975
Reviews.Content: I actually think that this hotel is under rated by Trip Advisees and I've NEVER given a perfect rating! Highlights: Beautiful breakfast experience both 'in cottage' in your backyard or overlooking the pool and vast views of vineyards over the hillside. We were actually shocked at how much we enjoyed this little spot. More Tips... Take their bikes out for a spin around the vineyards, Enjoy the rain-style outdoor showers could NOT be eco-friendly but really nice. Enjoy the fitness center - also a really nice surprise, with a relaxing view of the lap pool, Evening: Farm, Cocktails by the fire. One drawback: The cottages are on the small side, but the large doors that open to the outside make it feel very spacious and comfortable. We were upgraded so our outdoor area was extra large....but the cappuccino machine + coffee makers in the room with fresh milk in the refrigerator completely made up for that!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Farmhouse Meets Under the Tuscan Sun”
Reviews.Author: Andrena11
Reviews.Content: Whoever designed The Carneros Inn really knows what they are doing. This is a stunning property, with a crisp, modern farmhouse vibe. The Inn is actually a sprawling estate, which consists of individual free-standing cottages throughout. Each is equipped with all that one desires in a country house -- front porch, fireplace, private garden with outdoor shower and loads of charm. What makes these cottages special is that every last detail exudes a modern sophistication, ensuring that the most cosmopolitan city dweller will feel completely at home. The materials used are natural -- stone, brick, wood, with pops of stainless steel- and draw in the natural beauty that surrounds. There are two main destinations on the property. The town square which includes the stunning and delicious FARM restaurant, a gourmet market, business center, and a recreation area which includes pools, gym, and great yoga classes. It get's better. The crown jewel of the property is it's hilltop retreat, an awe-inspiring farmhouse with views of the hills, a lovely terrace with outdoor dining, and a pool which is delicately nestled into the hilltop, surrounded by grass and stone. It is truly an image which is reminiscent of something under the Tuscan sun. Just add chirping birds, a light breeze, and a chilled glass of local wine. There is no better place to enjoy all that Napa has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A great all-round experience”
Reviews.Author: julesabc
Reviews.Content: This hotel has won numerous plaudits and having stayed there 2 nights recently, I can see why. It has the full package. The rooms are great, especially the outdoor areas which feature the hugely romantic double person claw bath and a fire pit for added ambiance as well as a few seating areas. It was especially romantic having a bath under a blanket of stars. Coming back inside the bathroom and open fire were great and when added to the fantastic bed you have all the ingredients of a great (and very private) room/villa. The Room Service food is great and you donâ€™t get charged an arm and a leg for it either which is always nice. The Farm has a fantastic reputation but unfortunately we needed something more relaxed on our first night and then it was closed on the Monday night (the only night it is closed from memory). I would definitely say that F&B was a highlight of our stay. The staff are great although you really only see them when you want to as your room is fairly self-contained. However, whenever we did see them they were friendly and helpful, especially on arrival where you are greeted by smiling hosts, the offer of a glass of wine and an introduction to your room. We didnâ€™t give the spa a go as we ran out of time (too much winetasting) but I believe that it is fantastic also. Next time!!! This is one of the best all-rounded resorts that I have been to in recent times.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Romance in The Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Milly09
Reviews.Content: Carneros Inn is the most wonderful and luxurious place to stay in Napa. The views surrounding the property are breath taking (borrow a bike and go for a long cycle ride) the restaurants and shop on the property fit for any foodie (buy a picnic and bottle of bubbles from the shop for your lunch or dinner if you're staying more than a day). There is a pool and heated tub up near one of the restaurants where you can have brunch / lunch with incredible vistas in the background and another more secluded pool for those that want to just worship the sun with a little more privacy. Then of course, there are the spotless accommodations. Cosy, clean, luxury personal cabins. We went for the most basic and it was fantastic. The bathroom is great with both bath tub and huge shower that opens up to an outdoor shower. There's a fire place for the cooler months and private patio for the hotter months (perfect for that evening picnic!) They have every detail thought about. The curtains in the room didn't seem to entirely cover up the window so there was a moment of feeling like people could look in but you get the distinct feeling, that everyone is tucked up in their cabins and it's not the kind of place where you'll get people trying to pry. The only downside to all of this, is the price. If you're lucky and go off season, you can get a deal for around $470.00. Usually the rooms are around $600 a night. Yes. That's spenny. But when I say this is the ultimate in romance and luxury and that everything is on hand to you - truly, I mean it. It's the whole experience that surrounds Carneros (the wine tasting / the restaurant / the cabins / the views) that make it all in all, a night or two well worth the expense. We stayed just one night and we still got the full flavour for it and even off season, it was wonderful and sunny.
