There are lots of wineries within distance that you can visit (and don't have to pay for) just be careful if you use e.g. designated driver (suggested through the hotel) which Is a great idea, just don't let them recommend other wineries in place of the ones the Carneros books (that are usually all free entry) as you'll find you get taken to a not as great place, and pay at least $30 per person which they didn't mention! Dine at the restaurant on an empty stomach. The food is truly great. Have a cocktail outside around the open fire pits. Definitely buy a picnic from the shop (it sells alcohol too to take back to teh room) Have a swim in the morning with the views in the background And take someone you really care about and surprise them with a truly special stay. It's the perfect spot for romance!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: dmwilsondvm
Reviews.Content: Amazing location (easy to venture into Napa or Sonoma), amazing service, awesome combination of modern design with a quaint feel, Harvest Cottage was unbeatable. Outdoor tub, fire pit, space heater, outdoor shower, beautiful garden....nice way to spend the afternoon after wine tasting. Room was very beautiful. Bathroom was impressive to say the least. Food was very solid, but compared to the fine dining establishments in the region, its maybe just a touch below (i.e. an imaginary "Michellin 0.75 star"). Still....very good. Breakfast at the Hilltop was the best way to start the day. The bar/patio at FARM is a chill place to have a nightcap and a cigar. We didn't check out the spa. Screwing around in the Valley took priority. Don't get me wrong...the place is not cheap, but its worth every penny. You won't regret it. We will be returning soon for a longer trip!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Perfect”
Reviews.Author: water026
Reviews.Content: We planned a 10-day honeymoon in the Napa Valley. We had considered splittling our time and doing a few days in the heart of Napa and another few days in the heart of Sonoma. We ended up finding The Carneros Inn and decided to stay there for our entire trip. So glad we did! The Carneros Inn may be a little off the beaten path, but (A) that was exactly what we were looking for in a honeymoon, and (B) the location was positioned perfectly to tour both Sonoma and Napa locations. Everything was PERFECT! The cottage was amazing...from the bed, to the porch, to the fireplace, to the bathroom. Uh, the bathroom was wonderful! The outdoor shower was such a treat. Aside from the cottage, the grounds were superb, as was the staff. We had some delicious meals at the restaurants and were able to take advantage of the heated pool and hotub on multiple occassions. Walking the vineyard trail in the morning was so picturesque. The rolling hills and hot air balloons were like a postcard, and the cows grazing were so much fun to see as well. Wherever you go within the resort, there's bottled water and wine. We even took the bikes they provide out for a ride one day. It was very easy to hop on 29 and drive up the Napa Valley, and almost as easy to drive up Sonoma. Great stay for a relaxing, romantic, enjoyable Napa honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot to relax”
Reviews.Author: Travel9898
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely, the outdoor shower a real treat and the Spa excellent

Reviews.Title: “Sleep deprived for $400 a night. Caution. Wanted to love it so badly!”
Reviews.Author: californialovesu
Reviews.Content: I have been sitting on this review for about a month. Out of fairness I've waited for the general manager to email be back, regarding out stay, and he never repsonded to my email. So...here goes. If you can afford to book a cottage with the fire pit/tub, do. You are rewarded with rooms that have shutters and are dark at night. If not, you will be in a room that is virtually lit up all night. Why? Thin roman shades and cottage lights from neighboring cottages that are on all night. One downer to the tub, it will only fit one, or two if you are a very small person. Thought that sounded great in theory but was quite uncomfortable to enjoy together. Room service was uneven. Terrific one night, great burger, terrible at breakfast. Cold food, hour wait. I felt vindicated for complaning when I read a former review commenting on the same issue. When we complained about the light the next am, literally everyone at the front desk looked at us like we had landed in a space ship. I asked if they had eye shades, and no they didn't. The front desk did explain that they're some people who like a well lit room to sleep in, so if they are disoriented in the middle of the night they can find their way around. That's a first, truly. And, he was so ernest about the explanation. I thought the # 1 rule to any hotel is black out shades, so if you are traveling and you are jet lagged you can actually sleep. Or, in our case, sleeping in. Their will be no sleeping in at this hotel since some of the cottages are east facing and you know what that means, up with the chickens with the thin roman shades. It is also strangely corporate sponsered???. Other quirks. At wine hour you will the odd feeling that you're on a car sales lot. You are. The wine hour is held in a residence cottage with nice people trying their to sell a cottage. Also, the wine hour is given by various wineries who are (surprise!) selling their wine. That said, we'd never stay their again. Not for that price. I've wanted to stay at this property for years, so disapointing. I hope they will take the time to listen to their customers, and do what other hotels do when they have a challenge. For instance, at the SB Biltmore you get ear plugs by your bed at night. There is a train one can hear, they accomodate you. Maybe having eye shades would be a brilliant thing to offer? Better yet, switch out those cheap shades and put something proper in. Maybe Audi will sponser it...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tupapi
Reviews.Content: Few hotels surprise me on a positive way. Carneros Inn did in almost every way. We loved the rooms, the bathrooms (especially the outdoor shower!!), woodburning fireplace, private patio with heater, etc. Service is fast and excelent. Room service food is delicious. I would have to say I have no complaints whatsoever. I would definitely return, not sure I would pay high season prices, but low season absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Small, expensive, haughty - avoid Carneros”
Reviews.Author: Biz_Cindy
Reviews.Content: I spent $1200 of my employers money in 2 days while at a business function. That was $900 on 2 nights of a cottage (approximately the size of a single garage) and the rest on food, drink and tips (FYI - they BILL YOU for tips like a cruise ship, whether you want to pay them or not). The cottages are about 5 years old judging from the floor and wall wear. They are small, about 12 x 30 feet for the $400 per night ones. The staff is haughty and the place is sponsored by Audi - a bit odd. The food is average at best, especially for the Napa Valley. The rooms are loud and sleeping in is impossible since there are not light darkening shades, and there is a lot of noise outside due to all the corrugated metal walls. The wireless internet signal was "poor" and so you were using either your own wireless (poor reception) or the ethernet cable. I'm a 100+ night per year international traveler, and I must say, I am very very confused about the all the 4 and 5 level ratings. All I can surmise is that the raters don't travel much and don't have a good idea of what a $500/night experience SHOULD be like.

Reviews.Title: “If I could live at this hotel, I would!”
Reviews.Author: JRae27
Reviews.Content: There are not enough wonderful things to say about The Carneros Inn. From their sprawling, unique property with sweeping views of the Sonoma Valley, coupled with world-class service and amenities with the finest attention to detail that even I (the most scrupulous guest) could not find a single fault. If you are seeking refuge, solitude and pampering--Carneros Inn surpasses all others. From the moment you arrive, you are greeted with 5-star service which is omnipresent throughout the duration of the stay. There is no shortage of activities--bike rides, swimming, yoga/pilates in the Motion Studio, Precor machines in the fitness center, strolls through the expansive property, shopping in the market, wine tasting, fine dining, day spa...but I warn you...it will be hard to leave your room! The cottage was so wonderfully comfortable, plush, private and serene that we found it difficult to enjoy any of the outside activities! We spent much of our time lounging in our courtyard, soaking in the tub, rocking on the porch and enjoying the fireplace. If I could choose a hotel to make my second home--this would be it. GO VISIT CARNEROS INN--you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Third Time Around Was Good”
Reviews.Author: JorjeJaj
Reviews.Content: After spending a few nights at Solage in Calistoga, we came down to Napa for two in Carneros. Overall, the service wasn't quite as meticulous as it was during our prior visits. But that's not to say it was bad or cold. Perhaps staff turnover is taking a bit of a toll on the details. Our room in the Haire section had a tight, horizontal floor plan that was a bit confining. However it was very clean and the private yard seemed a bit larger and open than prior ones. An outdoor heating lamp and gas fireplace allowed us to linger in the yard well into January dusk. A complimentary half-bottle of Chardonnay (appreciation for our return visit) was delivered warm, but it was a nice gesture. In terms of food, Boon Fly Cafe is a fun breakfast nook, but the seating is limited and tight so get there early. One thing to watch for is that the Hilltop Dining Room and the Farm are closed several days of the week, and this highly limits dining options in the immediate area. That said, a rejuvenated Napa Center, with several good restaurants like Celadon and the funky Bounty Hunter Wine Bar, is a mere 10-15 minute ride. The resort is very well situated for exploring Sonoma Center and wineries as well. If you like classic Chardonnays like us, you're in the right spot here. While this review may come across as harsh, Carneros Inn is definitely a very relaxing, clean and luxurious destination. Like Solage, with a few years under the belt, they will need to stay crisp and not get too complacent going forward.

Reviews.Title: “A little oasis in the middle of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Murrandasp
Reviews.Content: My husband had to be in San Francisco for a meeting on a Monday, so we thought we'd go a little early and spend a few days at the Carneros Inn. We've stayed several times before, and whenever we want to escape and feel pampered, we just look at each other, and both say "Carneros". If I could live there I would. We came in late Friday and ate at The Farm, on site. It was so good, even though we are 15 minutes from some of the best restaurants in the world, we ate at The Farm again on Saturday. With drinking, it's just too easy to walk the 2-3 minutes "home" to our little cottage. Our favorites: The cottages themselves. Free standing rooms with private garden, outdoor shower (the best thing ever) and heated bathroom floors. A beautiful workout room. The restaurants. We ate at all the restaurants at the resort this time, The Boon Fly, The Hill Top & The Farm. All excellent. The chicken at the Farm is the best I've ever had. I've never been to Napa in January, and it was unbelievably green & warm, in the 60's each day. Perfect time to go, hardly any tourists (like us). Best winery we visited, Heitz Cellars. Fab cabs, and no crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort with Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: skrentzm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 25-29 and had a great time! The Harvest Cottage has a great bed, large outside deck with heat lamp, outside fireplace and bathtub (and shower!). The bathroom is spacious with a terrific heated floor with both a spa-like shower and tub. The food is phenomenal at the casual Boon Fly Cafe and the formal "The Farm". Their Spa is small but well appointed with good service choices. Would happily come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “one of my favorite hotels EVER!”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: my close friend from college and i drove the pch (for the first time!) and decided to end the trip on a high note, with four days at the carneros inn. it was the perfect ending to a wonderful vacation. everything about the hotel is divine. the pools, the views from the (adults-only) pool, the drinks, the service, the privacy provided by fenced patios (with heat lamps, lounge chairs, outdoor shower, and garden area), the heated floors in the cottage (and bathroom), everything! the hotel even provides adorable orange flip flops for all hotel guests! there really isn't anything about my stay in the hotel that wasn't fantastic and well put-together. i cannot wait to return to the hotel next year with more friends, who will also become adoring fans of the carneros inn!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing retreat....”
Reviews.Author: tmarie_03
Reviews.Content: The serenity and beauty of the Carneros Inn is an unbeatable experience! The intimate cottage-style lodging offers amazing amenities; fireplace, garden patio with heat lamps, outdoor shower, luxurious bath tub, heated floors - you don't want to leave the room! Service was prompt, friendly and ever-so-accommodating. Hugh Cottage Kitchen (room service) menu served us two of our meals; both timely and delicious. The property boast two pools, three restaurants - plus a market, amazing spa services, a fitness center, yoga & pilates classes. Truly a spectacular retreat! The proximity to San Francisco and also the rest of wine country is unmatchable; that is, if you decide to leave the property, which on a rainy or sunny day, is hard to do! I've had the priveldge of staying at many hotels, but few rival the Carneros Inn experience. I'd definitely return to this oasis to relax in such an inviting atmosphere and enjoy the abundance of thoughtful amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with everything”
Reviews.Author: CH15
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Carneros and we loved it. Rooms/Cottages were clean, very accomodating and comfortable. Great turn down service and fireplaces. Loved the outdoor shower, which actually is better than the indoor shower. We at the Boon Fly and The Farm - which both were excellent. Loved the infinity pool, hot tub and spa too. Only negatives in our opinion (and some are minor): 1) Wish they had a docking station for the Ipod in the room 2) Boon Fly breakfast which was execellent was a bit pricey 3) location puts this in between Sonoma and Napa, but that was far outweighed by how great and unique it was. Very romantic, quiet and fun place to be, I would receommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty-near perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTravelBlog
Reviews.Content: The Carneros Inn is about as perfect a resort as the wine country could have. First of all, it's luxurious without feeling stuffy. The individual cottages with private courtyards give a sense of total privacy, while the communal spaces offer a warm, comfortable social ambiance. Between the Boonfly Cafe and the Farm, you really don't have to leave the property to eat. And perhaps best of all, we can bring our young kids and our dog and enjoy ourselves completely, without feeling like we're bothering other guests (they have separate pools for adults and children, and there is enough outdoor space that adults can have a totally romantic time without being bothered by children). I have stayed there three times over the past few years, with my husband alone for a romantic weekend, with my sister alone for a girls' getaway, and with my kids and my sister's kids for a family vacation, and the Carneros Inn provided the perfect place for each of those totally different types of trips. I just booked a return trip for Thanksgiving with the family. We don't normally do expensive resort vacations, not because we can't afford it but just because they tend to be boring and seldom seem worth the money, but the Carneros Inn is the exception. I'm excited to go back. You'll note that I gave 4 out of 5 stars for service. I'll admit, I'm hard to please with service, and especially at this price range I expect perfection. Since I'm a return customer, I expect them to know whether I'm a woman or man (last time they addressed a note to me as Mr. instead of Ms.), and I would like to be able to book extra services such as dinner reservations and spa treatments through the concierge rather than having to contact each of those reservations desks separately. But people are always kind at Carneros, and the service is generally prompt. I give 4 out of 5 stars on value because, well, this isn't a value hotel. It's a luxury hotel. That's not a bad thing. They deliver on the luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing Treat!”
Reviews.Author: pumababe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more like a "couples" type of place, but I had a wonderful girls getaway (3 girls total) despite that. Who needs a man to take us to a place like this? :) Service was excellent from beginning to the end of our stay. Each room is a little cottage with a private patio that has a shower from inside that can go outside for some al-fresco showering. Once we checked in, we drove to our cottage and a bellhop met us there to take our luggage from our car to our cottage. So sweet! The property is huge! They have free bicycle rentals for use within the property and we had a blast exploring the property via bikes. There's a great brunch place on the property too, so we were able to bike to the brunch restaurant, leave our bikes there (no locks needed), and grab something to eat. The property also has multiple-bedroom units to book. This would be great for multiple couples to stay in one "house". Someday, when the 3 of us have significant others, we will do this as 3 couples! There was nothing bad about this hotel at all! Well, actually, maybe it'd be nice if they have a complimentary happy hour/wine & cheese tasting for guests to mix & mingle. Okay - maybe another thing... the spa is a bit small. Although you can do al-fresco massages or bath treatments, which is pretty cool. They have heater lamps in case it's cold. I highly recommend this place even for singles!

Reviews.Title: “Total Luxury & Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: JLWEED
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with the Romance Package. The package includes dinner at FARM or $150 dining credit, 1 breakfast in bed and 1 bottle of sparkling wine at arrival. Kevin upgraded us to the Harvest Cottage, which was our definition of HEAVEN. We loved the Harvest Cottage becuase of the added outdoor space and privacy. The cottage had an outdoor soaking tub for 2, which I used every morning while having my espresso. My husband loved the double chaise lounge chair, which he used to read his book with coffee in the mornings and together at night with a good glass of wine while relaxing under the stars...The heated lamp above the lounge is a nice touch as the nights can be rather cold. The backyard had an expansive garden that also hosted an outside fire pit and fountain for ambiance. The cottage had a comfy bed with working fire place. The bathroom was AMAZING with heated tile floors, separate shower and another huge soaking tub. The inside shower had a door that open to another alfresco shower...wonderful and why not. To top things off, the Harvest cottage also includes an espresso machine that maded the perfect steamed beverage in the morning...great after a long night of wine! We had an amazing time relaxing and having fun with another couple from NYC at the adult only infinity edged pool and hot tub. The CADE Sauvingnon Blanc is a must along with a yummy menu of other cocktails. For families there is also another fabulous pool. We had room service the ENTIRE 2 days...It was outstanding, especially the housemade Boon Fly Donuts and Dungeness Crab Cakes. My only recommendation is to please add 24hr room service for those of us who just want to live in the rooms. In an example of service, I was able to call the front desk after midnight for food and they did have a couple items sent to our room. The resort is a little bit out of way for a night snack. Michael at concierge was attentive, professional and quick to respond. The staff wasable to accomodate us nicely with travel changes and for that I am appreciative. We will be back to try FARM and the Spa, of which I've heard outstanding feedback from friends. If you love the American Traditional style and you are Pottary Barn fan then you can't go wrong with The Carneros Inn. I can see now why Travel & Leisure magazine ranked it, "One of the Top 25 Romantic Getaways in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LAEventPlanner
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the property are gorgeous. The rooms are ridiculously overpriced (but all of Napa is). They look like army barracks on the outside but are actually very nice on the inside. We were upgraded to a room with a hot tub but it was by the road so we moved to a smaller cottage with a nice view of rolling hills. The concierge was very gruff and pushy when we asked about hiring a car for a wine tour. We felt pressured into booking one and it wasn't worth the cost. I think she received a kickback for it. The pool is gorgeous with views of vineyards. I just wish someone had told us about it before we were checking out. The restaurant is very good but we only at breakfast there. Our room had a broken TV remote and our refrigerator wasn't working so our white wine didn't chill. I called a few times but no one came. For $700 a night, they should have at least comped our breakfast or given us small discount. The manager was very defensive when I told him about the maintenence issues. I would expect more from such a highly rated property. Iwouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge!”
Reviews.Author: laurenkaygraham
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend The Carneros Inn! The rooms had lots of amenitites such as an outdoor shower, outdoor tub, outdoor fire place, and electric heater. The FARM Restaurant on site was also wonderful. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: sevysf
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the Carneros Inn, you feel like you have entered another world. The grounds are beautiful and the staff goes above and beyond. Feel free to have a glass of wine while you check in! You are then seamlessly guided to your cabin where you will find room with all the amenities you could ever want and more. I think my personal favorite is the indoor/outdoor shower! After 24 hours at the Carneros everyone I saw thought I had just come from a day at the spa, but I hadn't even been to the actual spa! I would definitely recommend it to everyone as a place to stay or to buy into the Orchards which are also amazing!

Reviews.Title: “The Carneros Inn is pure heaven. Everything about it make us never want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: BrieBackus
Reviews.Content: From the moment you drive up to the Carneros Inn, you know it's going to be an amazing visit. The staff are friendly & helpful, the cottages make you feel at home. The food is excellent, the pool is incredibly relaxing, and the spa services are out of this world. We would live there if we could!

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off- never going back”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel702
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the weekend at this hotel with his side of the family (brother & girlfriend, sister & husband, & mother-in-law). This hotel was so cheaply constructed I cannot believe the prices they charge per room. Maybe they ran out of money midway through construction? I am perfectly happy to pay a lot for a great experience. This hotel is not it. -Check in people were rude and condescending to us upon arrival. You have to go through a gate and call the front desk to be let into the compound. Not very inviting. -The bed linens were cheap (made in Pakistan, not to be a snob but for a 5* hotel they should be Italian linens), the pillows hard and uncomfortable. It is so disappointing to pay for a 5* resort and have an uncomfortable bed. -A Queen size bed? Really? -The room lay out was so awkward. Long and narrow and hard to get around the bed. There was no where to place luggage or put clothes away- except a tiny little closet large enough to hang 5 things. They had to put my suitcase in the bathroom next to the shower! My husbands bag on the couch! My small suitcase on the tiny little desk. -They charge you $30 per bottle if you want to take one of the toiletries from the room. Not that I liked the toiletries, but really? They should either be refillable ceramic or glass containers (eco friendly) or plastic ones to take away. I have never heard of charging guests for small shampoo bottles. -I think they must have bought the furnishings from Ikea- very cheap and no clothing storage. -Location: this hotel is not in the nice part of Napa Valley. It is south of Napa near Vallejo. So you have to drive a while to get to any of the cute downtown areas & nice restaurants (Younteville, St. Helena, Rutherford). From the pool you have a nice view of Vallejo, industrial power lines, and the highway that leads into Napa valley. -Room Service: Is printed on computer paper in a folder. There are about 4 options for breakfast every thing really heavy and greasy. It was strange they did not have healthier, lighter breakfast options. -Overall the materials were just so cheap, the doors, the curtains, the light fixtures. It made the hotel (a new construction) seam like it was dated. And did not seam inviting or comfortable. Positives: -It was nice to have your own little cottage, I just wish that they were a little more posh. - The gym was nicely equipped and I think that they had some group classes offered in the mornings. My mother in law and sister in law did they yoga and liked it. -My husband and I got a couples massage and they were really great! The spa was nice. Although I did not like the location- right next to the pool bar. Next time we will be returning to the Auberge du Soleil or Meadowood.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Skurber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caneros for the first leg of our honeymoon. I am happy to say that it is the best place I have ever spent the night! not only was it beautiful, but the service was impeccable, food tasty and private outdoor space extremely romantic. We look forward to returning many more times in the years to come!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing as one could ever imagine”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: Not being sure what to expect because of the cottage idea, we were extremely pleased. When we first arrived, we were met with a glass of wine and some chocolates. The check in was very fast and we then followed our bell person to our cottage. We had a small king cottage that was quite and very private with its own private patio. The shower was a treat as you could shower outside or inside and wear whatever or whatever not you wanted to wear : ) while sun bathing in your lounge chairs. If you like pools, this one is very nice as it overlooks the vineyards. The bed was very comfortable and the fireplace topped off the romance of the room. The room service was good and the lounge at the Farm was nice for sitting around the fire pits for a drink. If you are looking for peace, quite and a very relaxing romantic place, you canâ€™t beat this. The location is good for travel to both Sonoma and Napa as it sit between both. The market and deli on the premises was pefect for picking up picnic foods before taking off for wine tasting. Also good for room snacks or morning light breafast items.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms/mediocre service/closed restaurant”
Reviews.Author: maddeline
Reviews.Content: When you first drive in the grounds are pretty spectacular. There is an enormous amount of space with beautiful views from the top pool. The property is expansive and well groomed. We knew everyone gets their own "cottage" so we were expecting the best and figured it was worth the splurge. So we were beyond disappointed when the "premium cottage" (meaning one level above the basic) was the smallest hotel room either of had ever stayed in. By far. There is literally not enough room to put down two suitcases apart from having them sit right at the entrance to the room. With that said, the outdoor space connected to the room was bigger than the room itself and quite beautiful. When we mentioned to the front desk that the room was tiny we were told "well most of our guests don't spend too much time in the room so they don't seem to mind". Huh? Well then using that philosophy I should have stayed in a cheap hotel instead of one that charges $450-700 per night for an entry level room. We were looking forward to eating at the restaurant there which is highly acclaimed . . except that it was closed on Monday and Tuesday night. Really? In the middle of the high season? We then tried to bury our disappointment in some spa services which were only available at extremely limited times and the front desk offered no help. Bottom line, if these rooms were $150-250 per night, I would say its probably worth it. At the prices they are charging in the summer you will be far better off choosing something in Yountville or even the emerging city of Napa itself. Dollar for dollar this place was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: musicman401
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Inn. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was a bit rustic, but that added to the relaxing charm of the place. We really enjoyed the individual cottages in the individual neighborhood. It was a large property but you could walk every where. The cottages were comfortable with individual courtyards with tables, firepits, outdoor showers and huge tubs. The Boonfly Cafe was great for a relaxing breakfast with good food. I found the Farm dinning experience "interesting", with high prices and just "OK" food. You can get a great dinner experience in Napa for half the price. If you are looking for "lavish" , this isn't it, but for quietly understated eligance, relaxation, and charm, I highly recomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it...”
Reviews.Author: thorwp88
Reviews.Content: the pictures are accurate--you will not be dissappointed with the property. concierge and front desk staff were awesome...gal at the front desk didn't hesitate to help print our boarding passes...concierge was excellent in helping to ship our wine and arrange travel. we only encounetered one "less than enthusiastic" staff member at the pool--but his partner stepped in and more than made up for this shortcoming. we are healthy eaters, so breakfasts were a challenge here...we had to go with scrambled egg whites and toast at the "boonfly" each day because the hilltop is only open frid to sun....the farm was excellent on 3 out of 4 dishes...i was dissappointed with the filet...i ordered it medium and it still lacked flavor...my wife had the scallops and halibut and both were awesome...the duck was great as well. when we paid $100 to get to and from mustards in yountville, we quickly cancelled our reservation at harvest moon in sonoma and just decided to eat at the farm two nights...you will pay as much for your taxi to and and from dinner as you will pay for your dinner--this is one of our only real complaints about the inn--it is centered between napa and sonoma, so you are just far enough from everything that it will cost you to get to everything. yountville will cost you atleast $100 and if you go further north, just keep tacking on. by the way, they make excellent drinks at the bar at farm--nice and strong (and a good break from wine). the pool is incredible...i wish we could've spent more time here. overall i highly recommend carneros inn. if you're going to stay in napa for several days, i'd suggest splitting time between carneros inn and staying at an inn closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular setting. Truly luxurious with a hip, chic vibe.”
Reviews.Author: michdan13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Carneros for 3 nights and it was absolutely wonderful. The scenery is probably the most beautiful you will see, vineyards and rolling hills all around. The resort is convenient to Napa wineries. Our room was spacious and felt calming. The bathroom was huge; we loved the heated floors and the huge, separate shower with numerous jets. It is unusual for me to take a bath in a hotel (hello, bacteria?) but the bathtub was so sparkling clean that I couldn't resist (nice bath salts too). Unfortunately, we didn't use the outdoor shower as the weather has been unusually chilly. We rarely rave about breakfast, but we had breakfast all three days at the Boone Fly Cafe, which offers the most delicious food and friendly service. In retrospect we should have tried lunch or dinner here too. The one thing that was not superlative was dinner at The Farm. It was just okay. As others have suggested, the hilltop pool was absolutely gorgeous. We sat out there for a few hours and I thought the service was pretty good (I know other reviewers thought otherwise, maybe we just got a good day). We did a couples, side by side mineral bath. I don't know if we would do it again (very pricey for 1/2 hour) but glad we did it once for the experience. What was not so nice was the view of the hotel's retention (detention?) pond/pool as you are relaxing in the tubs or sitting on the back deck of the spa area. There's probably not much they can do about it but they should do a little more to obscure that view. Also, there could be more privacy/serenity in the spa waiting room, which seems to be a primary route for the staff to walk through as you are sitting in your robe drinking chilled mint-infused water (which was delicious). Our other spa services were great, the spa staff was extremely friendly and professional and the overall spa experience was still very memorable. We will definitely stay at The Carneros Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Every vacation is down hill after this!”
Reviews.Author: bamafutbal
Reviews.Content: went to the napa to sonoma half marathon. first trip to the wine country and this will not be the last. from top to bottom this place did not disappoint

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravelSavvySMD
Reviews.Content: A beautiful setting, great rooms, and a staff that generally goes out of their way to make you feel taken care of from the second you arrive make Carneros Inn really feel like an escape. The rooms were great - modern but cozy, with a touch of rustic. And I always love an outdoor shower. (If I had one thing to change... I do wish it was a little less bright in the mornings. If that will bother you - bring an eye mask.) I appreciate that the cottages give you more privacy -- no sounds from surrounding rooms, etc. The pool is fabulous. Gorgeous, calm (adults only so no kids running around), and once again, great service. Easy to spend hours and hours poolside. One disappointment for me was the food. We had seen generally favorable reviews for Farm, so started off our weekend with dinner there. Maybe we just had an "off" night, but the service was noticeably slow (an hour or so for appetizers), and almost everything we tasted was mediocre and bland. It was almost as if the steak hadn't been seasoned whatsoever. Didn't ruin my stay by any means, but I would recommend to others to skip it. Overall a fantastic stay and a wonderful weekend. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and generally good”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlLouisiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property following a stay in San Francisco. Pros: 1. Excellent cottages with large outdoor private garden and lovely outdoor shower 2. Beautiful setting and concept, with great views 3. Lovely pools, with separate "adults" pool & hot tub 4. Great vibe 5. Two restaurants open on site, FARM and Boonfly Cafe 6. Close proximity to wineries in Napa and Sonoma Valley 7. Located in Carneros wine region, which has excellent wineries like Artesa, Domaine Carneros, Trouchard, etc. Cons: 1. Concierge knowledge and information provided concerning area wineries wasn't always accurate or complete. Seems like they could make this more seemless. 2. Hillside pool, aka adults' pool, lacked very good service. Poolside attendants didn't stay outside most of the time, and instead disappeared into the hillside building. They would be gone for 45 minutes and you'd have to go hunt for someone. It's a no brainer that someone should be posted all the time as the hotel would make more money that way through guest purchases of food and alcohol. 3. Spa could be a little bit more serene. My massage was excellent. However, the relaxation area outside and inside had people walking in and out (example, one of the attendants was taking out the trash through the relaxation room inside bringing it outside, through the relaxation porch, presumably to the dumpster. That's not good policy and certainly not acceptable when you're paying $180 for a massage (and the experience). I must note that following our stay I received a survey to complete from the hotel via e-mail. Upon completing it and noting the pros and cons I listed above, the hotel called my house the next day to discuss areas for improvement. They also said that they were going to mail a bottle of wine from the company's winery to our house. This is a good sign that management cares and is to be commended. The hotel will benefit if some of the cons are fixed to truly take the hotel to the next level. That being said, I would recommend this hotel and think that it provides an excellent base for wine country touring (wineries) and eating.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best in Napa-Bottom Line”
Reviews.Author: robby516
Reviews.Content: I asked around and I was told that I should stay at Auberge and Meadowood. I was so glad I did not listen. This Hotel and Inn is the best in Napa. The service was oustanding, the cottages were awesome and the grounds were funky and fun. The gym was great and tghe spa was also a treat. Truth is I did not want to leave. I even looked at fractional ownership. Boon Fly is a great eatery and "The Farm" was also excellent. I visited the others not worth the money. Hands down I will be at Carneros again soon.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous property, a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: sunshinelover33
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever stayed in. Gorgeous scenery with rolling vineyard hills all around, beautifully landscaped resort, and modern yet warm decor--it felt like being in a perfect paradise. I loved having our own cottage with its private backyard, and the outdoor shower was awesome (as was the three-way shower inside). Very comfy robes, a spacious bathroom and plenty of free bottled water. Awesome. The service at the hotel was phenomenal, from check-in to the pool service to the concierge and the front desk throughout our stay. Unpretentious and friendly, but clearly willing to go the extra mile to make this a great visit. We took in some spa treatments one afternoon, and though pricey, were thoroughly relaxing and recharging (I recommend the couples massage). The lounge at the spa is filled with a great selection of magazines, comfy chairs and a really nice atmosphere. We also ate at Farm one night and though the service was pretty slow, the food was among one of the better meals I've had in a while (I recommend the filet/short rib entree and the pea soup--yum!) The proximity to other activities was great--we borrowed a couple bikes one morning and took a ride around the beautiful back roads. Another day, we drove about 15 minutes and went on a wonderful 5 mile hike. Downtown Napa is not far, so you're close to many restaurants. A few cons: -the bed--Although not terrible, the bed felt very soft and although I'm usually a heavy sleeper, I kept waking up in the middle of the night and did not wake up feeling as rested as usual. The pillows were also not that comfortable, however, housekeeping did their best to provide better ones when we requested them. -the entertainment system--The hotel doesn't have an on-demand movie system, but you can borrow DVDs from the front desk. The two DVDs we borrowed were scratched to the point that the DVD player couldn't read them. The netflix DVD we brought from home skipped every 4 seconds and we had to shut it off midway through the opening credits. Not a big deal as we didn't want to get away to watch movies, but I expected a slightly better entertainment system. -the pool--I loved that there was a separate adult-only pool with a wonderful hot tub and a great view of the vineyards. However, it was quite crowded when we were there (4th of july weekend), every single chair was taken and it was a bit noisy (probably in part because a whole party of people on the other end of the pool were pretty intoxicated). Though I really can't blame the hotel for having such a nice pool that everyone wanted to lay out next to it! Despite these small things, we had a great weekend here and i would go back in a heartbeat. Loved loved loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: MisterBalls
Reviews.Content: probably the best place I've ever stayed, and would go back again in a heartbeat. The cottages were so nice and you really felt you had your own little world. The restaurant was brilliant, with great food and wine. Really good location for exploring the rest of napa too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: TG1981
Reviews.Content: This resort was exceptionally beautiful. Everything looked like a postcard! It was picture perfect. The beds were comfortable, and so were the rooms. My only complaint would be in the bathroom, where there was no door separating the shower from the bathroom- there is no door period to the shower and water would float in to the main part of the bathroom, and I would add an extra mirror in the bathroom. Hard for 2 people to get ready at the same time. Besides that- beautiful, friendly staff!! I loved my milky facial at the spa and my margaritas by the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: onesquid
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed two nights for a little mini-vacation to relax by the pool and get some spa treatments. I had been to the Carneros Inn 5 years ago when it was still pretty new, and I LOVED it then. It was much smaller (the homes and the "town square" and whatnot were still being constructed, and I don't remember the spa being there), and the vibe was 5-star but very laid back and quirky. I feel like it has lost a little of that now that it's bigger -- I got the sense it's now a bit of a wedding mill in the summertime, and it seemed a little more buttoned up than I remembered. But it's still great. The great: -The cottages are darling -- each one like a little house. They have hardwood floors (love that!), Eames chairs, fireplaces, and outdoor showers -- very cozy but modern and fresh. We booked a Premier Garden Cottage and were very happy with it. -The adults-only pool on the Hilltop is fab. Absolutely gorgeous setting. Pool attendants were great, the sunscreen they offer smells like coconuts (hey, it's the little things), and it's so relaxing to look out over the vineyards in a quiet, kid-free zone. -Great service overall. Everyone was friendly and clearly wanted to meet our needs. The pretty good: -The spa was good but not the best. My boyfriend and I had a couples massage, and it was good ... but didn't go as smoothly as it could have. The massage therapists seemed a little flustered -- they ran out of heated massage oil halfway through, they kept getting up and walking around to get more oil or adjust the heater or something, and my boyfriend said that his therapist seemed to have lost track of time and didn't have much time left to massage his back (which is the area he most wanted de-knotted). The locker rooms are fine, and the lounge area is small but nice. There's also an outdoor area, but it looks out onto a parking lot and industrial-looking reservoir -- not the same gorgeous vista you see from the pool. Also, we had to traipse through the reception area to get to couples treatment room, which my boyfriend hated. But we still walked away very relaxed and happy after our treatments. -The food was okay. We eat mostly vegetarian food and fish, and we were bummed about the lack of healthy stuff on the room service menu and in both Farm and Boon Fly (and by the pool). Lots of burgers, fish and chips, pizza, chicken, etc. on the more casual menus, and not as much inventive but healthy California cuisine as we had hoped at Farm. We found things to eat and were fine, but definitely not blown away. Farm was a little snootier than I expected. -There isn't much shade at the pool -- no umbrellas (I think because of the wind) and no tree cover or anything. We started to feel a little crispy after a while and would have loved to be able to lounge under an umbrella for a bit. The not so great: -The resort's website says that there is an infinity-edged lap pool and a children's pool at the family and fitness pool complex. I assumed that meant a separate pool for kids and a pool set aside for laps. We're pretty hardcore swimmers, so we showed up at the lap pool Sunday morning with our swim fins and goggles and whatnot, to find that the lap pool is also a kids' pool. The separate kids' pool was small and shallow and totally empty, and the lap pool was full of kids. The pool manager tried to clear half the pool so we could swim laps, which was nice of him, but it didn't really work because the kids kept drifting into our half and I almost mowed one of them down. My boyfriend also got spit on by a little boy. We were displeased. We feel like you can't call it a lap pool if it's actually a kids' pool -- at least they could have designated some hours that are lap swimming only, or just call it what it is so we know to leave our fins at home. -The cottages are really cute, and we liked that we had a private little yard with an outdoor heater, but the landscaping back there really left a lot to be desired. We get that the resort doesn't want to use any more water than they already are, but our little yard was basically just deck and dirt -- could definitely have used some drought-resistant plants back there to spruce it up. The furniture layout was really awkward ... it wasn't an inviting space. Not a big deal because we spent 80% of our day at the pool anyway -- and we loved the front and the interior of the cottage -- but the yard was definitely not a plus. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, and we'll probably be back. If not for the few drawbacks, this would be a favorite spot.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations.”
Reviews.Author: scheck-r
Reviews.Content: In April, my husband and I finally had a chance to go away without the kids and it was very important to me that we stayed in a fantastic hotel to ensure a relaxing vacation. We heard about The Carneros Inn from family members and decided to check it out on trip advisor. The reviews were very mixed. Some people even compared it to a trailer park. Those people couldn't have been more wrong! The Carneros Inn felt like an oasis. When driving up to check in, we could see how beautiful the grounds were. We were met by friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable staff. The concierge was excellent. Our room was perfect. The bathroom was my favorite part as the floors were heated and the shower was both indoor and outdoor. The bed and linens were plush and comfy as well. The spa experience was awesome. The massage tables were even heated. After a morning yoga class, I had a wrap and a massage and it was the best spa treatment I have ever had in my life. It was much better than the spa treatments I have had at Sonoma Mission Inn and Spa a few years earlier (the last time we got to go away). I need to mention that the fitness center also had a yoga studio. That was a bonus because it is not mentioned on their website. The yoga instructors were knowledgeable and taught great classes that accommodated all levels of students. There are 2 pools. The one with the incredible view, was for adults only-which is great if you are traveling without your kids. We had lunch poolside after our spa treatments. It was the most relaxing day! The food at the pool was excellent. The food everywhere at the hotel was excellent. It was the best room service we ever had-ever! Both the Farm restaurant and the Boon Fly Cafe had fresh delicious food. The wine tastings at the hotel were fun and the wineries they sent us to were all great. The only thing we did not get to do was to use the complimentary bikes. Maybe next time because I know we will definitely return there again. I rated value a 4 out of 5 only because it was expensive compared to what we normally would have spent. That being said, it was very nice and we don't regret spending the extra money for what we experienced. I strongly feel that their website does not do it justice. I would recommend that they update their website pictures and include a virtual tour so that people could get the true view of the grounds and accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great food and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: eyehearttravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our one year anniversary here and we absolutely loved it. The food at Market, Boon Fly, Farm, poolside and room service was a very high quality and in season. We were usually too tired to hang out in the outdoor area by Farm but it looked amazing with a fun crowd. Service was helpful, polished but not intrusive. The look and feel of Carneros is very lush but not overdone. It's essentially a luxury farm... I can't believe an earlier review called the cabins a tin roofed trailer home??? It rained at night on our second night, we heard absolutely nothing. The rooms are not spacious but are very very well maintained with a high end bed/bedding, huge bathroom with a deep tub, a fireplace, robes, slippers, free soda and water constantly restocked, a front porch with rocking chairs, a fridge, DVD player, two french doors opening up to your backyard, free wireless, etc.etc. All in all, the cabin itself left nothing to be desired. Because of our anniversary the resort treated us to a bottle of champagne and a card, which was a nice touch. The spa was great but expensive. Not the best massage of my life but relaxing to say the least. My only minor complaints... We paid more for a premier garden cabin, with the photos for this particular room on their website having a larger backyard seemingly by itself and not surrounded by other cabins. Our backyard however was much smaller than expected and less private as one of the walls was an adjoining cabin and another adjoining cabin could see into our backyard if they tried. The photos on their site are misleading in that regard. The landscaping in the backyard was just a bunch of weeds and really really ugly which to me meant that no upkeep was being done. Why not just cover the landscaping/weeds with some pretty river rocks instead? Our indoor shower had several nozzels and was overly complicated because after about 10 minutes of trying to get it to work we gave up and used the simple, but fabulous outdoor shower instead.

Reviews.Title: “Carneros Review”
Reviews.Author: DouglasY
Reviews.Content: Great place with excellent service, spa, and restaurants. A bit pricey, but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pat616
Reviews.Content: One of my best friends got married at the Carneros Inn in August. My husband and I decided to stay at the hotel for 3 nights and it was a glorious stay. We're not wine drinkers so we mainly stayed at the hotel and relaxed at their various amenities. The resort was peaceful and comfortable. The cottage rooms were excellent. We loved the large bathrooms with heated floors, outdoor shower, patios and fireplace. We also rented bikes (complimentary) and took a ride to the nearby vineyards. The food at the restaurants was also excellent. This resort is not for those looking for an elegant place to stay. It has a farm concept, so expect nature and quaint dirt paths that take you around the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Trailer with a tin roof”
Reviews.Author: Momoftwins21407
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely worthless to travel to unless it's in the summer months. Rain, tin roof = no sleep. Creepy compound style living. Not a romantic getaway. Too expensive for the type of room. We decided to leave early and found another place to stay. The manager literally would not let us leave with a refund for the remaining days. We spent one entire day arguing about the quality of the room and why we were not happy there. We left and stayed at the Fairmont which is absolutely incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled”
Reviews.Author: mfinn624
Reviews.Content: This review is 2 years in the making, but ever since spending our honeymoon at Carneros, nothing else has compared. This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at and we feel completely spoiled because it has set a standard in hotels that is hard to find elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Private cabins, outdoor showers - Pretty much perfect”
Reviews.Author: kitseng
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in January which is a fairly slow time in Napa. Each room is a private cabin (done to get around some odd zoning rules in Carneros). The cabin we stayed in had an indoor outdoor shower, huge bathroom, massive flatscreen TV, great private patio area with a little heater for the evenings. I would say this hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in. On the property there are several great restaurants. The FARM is the higher end restaurant with a spectacular outdoor patio with fireplaces. The food was great and the setting was top notch. The Boon Fly is the more casual dining establishment and a great spot for breakfast before venturing out wine tasting for the day. The doughnuts and the Eggs Benedict (with the Jalapeno Hollandaise sauce) is a must try. The pool area and gym are awesome, the gym is one of the better hotel gyms I have ever worked out in, it was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PLACE, ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS I'VE EVER BEEN TO”
Reviews.Author: vickypu1
Reviews.Content: A very special place for sure. I spent four days there with my boyfriend. And the experience was incredible. First of all, the whole concept is very different and original. Imagine a series of luxury farmhouses, filled with all the amenities you can imagine: great bathrooms, outdoor showers, out-of-this-world beds, flat screen TV, yummy bathroom products, etc, etc. All of them surrounded by manicured gardens consisting of olive trees, lavender and rosemary plants, roses, etc. The attention is outstanding. The two pools (one is on top of a hill overlooking some Napa vineyards) are wonderful, great, well equipped gym, a general store that resembles a farmers supermarket... All this, in a secluded, yet very centric area of Napa Valley. I would go back in a second (of course, all this niceness is not cheap... but DEFINITELY WORTH IT). Way to go Carneros Inn, keep it that way!

Reviews.Title: “This place is just the best and the...”
Reviews.Author: Galindenba
Reviews.Content: This place is just the best and the management "gets it" in so many ways it's frankly amazing. The property is centrally located at the base of the valley midway between Napa and Sonoma so it's a perfect base for going pretty much anywhere in the area. The property itself is gorgeous and feels more like a small town rather than a resort Our room was huge, luxuriously appointed with a huge, very private deck with a great view of the surrounding countryside. Service was prompt, exact. and polite/friendly. My wife had a great time at the spa and fitness center. There are 2 pools both good for lap swimming with hot tubs nearby. The hilltop pool has an amazing view. The food was wonderful! Our dinner at Farm the on site restaurant was our best of the trip blowing our 350+ dollar meal at L'Auberge D'Soliel out of the water. Two things I really liked: Free wireless internet. So many resorts overcharge for a service that should be free. It's free at the Carneros Inn. Well done guys!! The rooms have tons of electrical plugs. Most travelers have laptops, cameras, MP3 players, and the like and these resorts never have enough outlets in the rooms. I always carry a powwrstrip when I travel. Our bedroom alone had 24 receptacles!!! Wow!!! This will be our "go to" place in Napa/Sonoma from now on.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE The Carneros Inn...Will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: winetravelingal
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how fantastic this hotel was... by far the best hotel we've ever experienced. We travel a lot and have stayed at many of the resorts in Napa and this one is hands down our favorite. From the service to the rooms to the beautiful property, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. At check in we were greeted right away and offered a glass of wine, exactly what I wanted on a trip to wine country. The reception staff were very pleasant and sincere, they were very focused on making sure we were enjoying ourselves. The Concierge helped us with wineries and restaurant reservations - their knowledge and experience with the little known wineries was impressive and allowing them to plan my itinerary took the work out of my hands and gave me a chance to relax. The bell staff was great - he showed us down to our rooms and told us all about the hotel. Definitely the best check in experience I've ever had! They have bikes for guests to use, so we went on a little bike ride around the Carneros region. It is so incredibly beautiful... rolling hills and vines all around. The views from the hotel are spectacular. We were told that you have to rent one of the Vineyard View rooms to get the view from your cottage, but we rented the Harvest Cottage, with a tub and fireplace in our private backyard and I loved it! I would certainly get the Harvest Cottage again... the perfect romantic getaway!!! The rooms were so nice, very relaxing and well thought out. The TVs were a little weird but when I mentioned this to the staff they told me that they were about to replace every TV. I love that they listen to their guests and they really gave me the impression that they are always working to improve the guest experience. THe bathrooms were incredible, they have those heated floors, wonderful bath tub and even the coolest outdoor shower!! The bed was the most comfortable ever, I even asked the concierge where I can get one just like it. The backyard was such a cool concept. We had our own outdoor table with a heater and umbrella. So one day we went down to the Market (their own grocery,deli,etc - they thought of everything!) and got some wine and cheese and just sat in our backyard soaking up the sun. We ate at Farm, their fine dining restaurant - the best meal we had on our trip. And there is this fantastic lounge that you can sit by the fire and drink wine... we could have stayed their all night. We also had breakfast at both the Boon Fly and the restaurant by the pool. Both amazing. the service was fantastic and the food incredible. I wish we could have stayed longer - but we will certainly be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bliss. Pure Bliss”
Reviews.Author: phadra
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to The Carneros Inn to celebrate our anniversary and I must say it was the perfect place to go. When we arrived at the front desk we were greeted by an incredibly helpful and pleasant staff. We were offered a glass of wine and given an itinerary that had not only our restaurant reservations on it but what the weather was expected to be during our stay. A nice touch. Then we followed the bellman in our car to our room where he explained how to use everything. Very, very nice. Now at this point I need to tell you that even though I'm young and pretty savvy I couldn't figure out 1. How to turn the TV on 2. How to turn the heated bathroom floors on & 3. I started a fire in the fireplace without opening the flue which caused my room to smoke up and the alarm to go off. Never, never did the staff make me feel like any of this was an inconvenience. I greatly appreciated that. They were so nice each time coming to the room very quickly (in some hotels it takes forever!) and showing me how to work everything. The room was beautiful as well. So well equipped. Each room is it's own cottage with a small, very private, fenced backyard that included two lounge chairs, a dining table with heat lamp, and an outdoor shower. We were in the least expensive room and I felt it was just gorgeous. The first night there we went to dinner at The Farm. When we arrived the waiter brought over two glasses of champagne and wished us a happy anniversary (When we made our reservations for the hotel and restaurant they asked me if we were celebrating anything special and I had told them it was our anniversary) So nice! The food was excellent and the restaurant very beautiful. Our waiter was wonderful too! When we arrived back at the room there was a bucket with a very nice bottle of CADE wine with two glasses and a note from Philip Kendall, the hotel's general manager, wishing us a happy anniversary. We were blown away. The grounds are beautifully maintained and I loved the fact that they had two pools; one for families, and one for adults. I love being able to lounge quietly by the pool but I also understand that when families are on vacations children want to play and have a good time. The two pools makes it so everyone is happy. We were the March 7-9 so the weather wasn't very warm but the pool was heated so we were still able to swim. One day I ordered a pomegranate lemonade by the pool the bartender brought it over to me and told me that he had run out of pomegranate so he made it with cranberry instead so their would be no charge. Seriously! This hotel has the best service I've seen in a long, long time. The people that work their seem genuinely happy to help you. Even in the market I was looking for a honey I had had at the hotel she said they didn't sell it but would find out what it was and let me know. And she did. Again, above and beyond. Never did I encounter any attitude from anyone. The only hiccup was that one day we got back to the room around 3:30 and they were just cleaning our room, a bit disappointing because we were looking to take a quick nap, not a big deal at all. Thank you Carneros Inn for making our anniversary so special!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Amazing Weekend EVER!”
Reviews.Author: cashmyre
Reviews.Content: It's taken me ages to write this review up, but I couldn't not say anything about the Carneros Inn--it truly was one of the most fabulous weekend getaways we've ever experienced. I don't know how we could ever stay anywhere in Napa again. The Carneros Inn exceeded our expectations in spades. We booked The Good Life package directly with the property, and it turned out to be just perfect for a little romantic getaway. Upon arrival, we were greeted by very courteous staff, and were given the full low-down on all the amenities we had access to. Jim, our super nice and knowledgeable guide, then had us follow his golf cart in our car to our cottage. There are no rooms at this inn--everyone has their own private cottage. Each cottage has its own mini, private "backyard" with a deck, seating area, and enclosed outdoor shower--you access this by opening the door from the indoor shower. Standing under the rain shower head with the sun on your face is a wonderful experience! The cottage is wonderfully equipped--big flat screen with an accordion-style mount, so you can pull it from the wall and angle it to your liking, whether you want to watch from the desk, the bed, or the sitting area (loveseat and club chair). The toiletries, furnishings, and amenities in the cottage were all lovely and luxurious, and the bubbly and fruit/cheese platter they brought after we'd settled in was a perfect touch. The Carneros Inn property is breathtaking--we took many walks on the grounds, through the gardens, and around the buildings. The fitness center is quite large and full of the latest equipment. We had an incredible dinner at FARM, and a delicious breakfast at Boon Fly Cafe. We had a fantastic Couples' Massage at the SPA early one morning, and walked across the path to FARM's outdoor terrace for breakfast in our spa robes. We drank Mimosas in the morning sun, while overlooking the beautiful valley and the pool. Then we swam for a bit and then followed that with a mini nap on one of the hammocks. We played Bocce at one of the Bocce courts. They also had bikes to lend, but we didn't get around to it. The Inn is perfectly situated for exploring Napa Valley. But you are almost torn--should we go to a tasting at a winery? Or lounge around the Inn? Tough choices ;) We will definitely return, and hopefully for a longer stay, maybe 3 or 4 nights. It was R&R at its best.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: NYUgradgal
Reviews.Content: We have gone to the Carneros Inn three times and are planning a return trip for 2010. I cannot express how amazing this hotel is. You have your own little bungalow, with a backyard and lounge chair and heat lamps. Each cottage has amazing bathrooms and a fireplace. Plus, every room has an outdoor shower! The best way I would describe the hotel is understated luxury. The service is excellent, but in a California, laid back way. It's not pretentious at all. This is definitely a 5 star place. They also have a wonderful gym, pools and restaurants on the property. The only problem is that once you check in, you might not want to leave the grounds!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Napa”
Reviews.Author: HollyL2
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel for our anniversary. The hotel is a collection of luxury cottages. We had a 2 bedroom cottage. The cottages have fireplaces, flat screen TV's, and nice bar. The bathrooms are huge and upgraded with heated floors and the best part, outdoor rain showers. We liked the heated pool and Jacuzzi. The restaurant, Farm, was excellent and had a fun atmosphere. The staff was attentive but also left us alone which we wanted on our anniversary. The rooms felt very luxurious and were the perfect place to relax after long days visiting vineyards The only down-side was location. The hotel is at the southern most tip of Napa which made for long drvies to some vineyards and restaurants. Not a big deal though.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, the best resort we've ever visited”
Reviews.Author: LizinATL
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, the Carneros Inn delivered on everything. Being greeted by very friendly staff with a glass of wine wins me over every time! Once we got to our cottage, (one thing that attracted us to the CI was not being in a "hotel room") my husband and I both said we didn't want to leave the resort because we loved the atmosphere so much. We wallowed in relaxation by the pool for hours just gazing at the view whenever I could drag myself out of the luxurious bed. Dinner at Farm and breakfast at the Boon Fly Cafe were both quite a treat. I simply could go on and on about everything but you just have to go and experience it for yourself! The only thing I regret is that we didn't visit the spa, which we will do next time we visit, because we WILL be back.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Property”
Reviews.Author: LisaW6
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations, plain and simple. I'm a frequent traveler and stay at many hotels. I'm constantly disappointed. For our vacation and birthday celebration, my husband and I wanted something special. This was definitely it. We stayed in a Harvest cottage and the pictures do not do this place justice. My one reservation prior to visiting was the tin looking walls. It screamed "compound" to me. In reality, it was not all that noticeable. Particularly in the evening, the room and the back deck were beautifully lit. This created a very romantic atmosphere. We did have one problem with the fireplace while visiting due to heavy rains (which they usually never get). It caused soot to back up into the room. When we called about it, we had the general manager himself come straight to our room to check it out. Talk about service! He immediately had us moved to one of the Orchard homes...that was a treat! We were also treated to one of the most delicious meals at FARM with the most attentive sommelier and knowledgeable waiter I've ever had. The staff was exceptional. Due to the rains we were picked up and driven to other areas of the property in an Audi SUV (instead of the usual golf carts). The concierge was fantastic and made many great recommendations. We will definitely go back to The Carneros Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I didn't have to leave”
Reviews.Author: travelmore10
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place. We have now returned three times, most recently staying in one of the wonderful homes - which are amazing. Carneros Inn is so close to SF, but a world away. The staff is so warm and accommodating. The property is so comfortable great for a romantic retreat or for a family. It is really comfortable - my favorite spot is the outdoor lounge with fireplace in front of Farm. The pool at the hilltop is spectacular. Make sure to eat at both FARM - beautiful room with fabulous food and Boon Fly Cafe (which has the BEST breakfast!)

Reviews.Title: “Carneros Inn is a perfectly elegant resort.”
Reviews.Author: Chicitygirl806
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carneros with my husband in August 2009 during our 3 year anniversary trip. I was more than impressed with the resort from the moment we drove up to the main entrance. The staff immediately responded to our questions upon arriving and greeted us with a delicious glass of wine. The concierge was more than helpful in booking our wine tours and tastings. We ate at both Farm and Boon Fly Cafe which are the two restaurants on property. Farm had a beautiful and quaint feel to it, however I did not enjoy my meal. I decided to try duck for the first time, and through no fault of the chef, realized I am not a fan. My husband ordered a delicious pork meal, which we both really enjoyed. Boon Fly was fantastic for both breakfast and dinner. I recommend the jalapeno benedict...it's to die for. The poolside restaurant was good, but pricey. I suggest ordering a cheese plate while sipping your drink of choice by the amazing pool. As for vinyards to visit, it's personal preference, but I liked the Cakebread tasting best. The staff there had the most relaxed and fun attitude and the wine was my favorite among all the places we visited. On your way to the vinyards, you must stop at Oakville Grocery for a picnic lunch. The sandwiches were absolutely delicious and we were told this place was a local favorite. The picnic area outside was cute for a quick lunch. Our cottage was beautiful. There was a large, luxurious bathroom which also featured an outdoor shower that I did not use, but looked old and unkempt. The bathroom also had heated floors, which added a nice touch to the chilly nights. The outdoor area of our little cottage was very cute and private with lounge chairs, heaters, and a picnic table. It was a really neat spot. The room was modern and comfortable, but could use more space for luggage and clothes. As for the location, one could easily bike to vinyards from the resort. I would plan to make a day of it if you choose to travel this way and leave early. We used our rental car and were able to visit 3 vinyards and have lunch (we got off to a late start). The spa and pool were both fantastic at this resort. I had a massage as well as a facial and really enjoyed both. The spa staff are very friendly and make you feel really comfortable. I'm not one to lounge in a bathrobe, but felt I could without feeling awkward on the pretty deck. The only complaint I have is that there was some construction going on outside the spa, which took away from the cool views on the spa deck. The pool is the best I've ever seen. Words can't describe the view and feeling you will experience at this pool. It was serene and breathtaking. Even if you don't stay here, definitely check out the resort's pool area on a visit to this place. It is well worth it to have lunch on the patio. The resort store closed rather early on a Sunday, which was disappointing. Though this resort was expensive (600+) it was so well worth the splurge. I definitely recommend staying at the Carneros if you are looking for a beautiful spot in the middle of wine country to relax and pamper yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but $$$$”
Reviews.Author: BikeRiderCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed there as a perk from my company. Looking at what my company paid for a night in a cottage( $813 total ) including room and tax plus a resort fee? ($10) I had to see what these rooms actually rent for if we had rented it ourselves. I now see they are charging in the range of $400 per night. Must be the economy but when this room was reserved over a year ago it wasalmost double in price. The Inn was nice and well located. The BoonFly Restaurant was very good with excellent service, The cottage we stayed in had a beautiful bathroom but was overall cramped for what we paid. Too much deck space with no views. Overall a nice inn but funky tin siding looked cheap. I would pay $250 to $300 to stay here in the future based on amenities such as pools and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we hadn't left.”
Reviews.Author: Tulane5280
Reviews.Content: Granted, this was the most expensive hotel we booked on our October 2009 honeymoon trip - but then again, it was the most worth it.. The good: FABULOUS cottages with lovely backyards! Just beautiful - hard to explain really. High-end, perfectly appointed without being snobby or pretentious. Staff was always there for anything you needed - and room service was absolutely excellent! Parking is free and right in front of your cottage - mini-fridge is modestly stocked and included with the room (just a nice touch - I like not being nickeled & dimed, don't you?) What you should know: You have to drive to Napa - it's a little off the beaten path. This is really not a big deal, but something to know. FARM restaurant is apparently closed on Monday & Tuesday - which were the 2 nights we were there. A pity, because it looked so beautiful! In short, I wish we had spent the whole week here instead of 2 nights. Just amazing - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “This Property Astounds and Romance Abounds”
Reviews.Author: dhill93_9
Reviews.Content: I don't know how anyone could rate this resort less than a 5 on anything. It nailed every category. We recently returned from an Anniversary trip at the Carneros Inn and it was one of the most romantic places we could have picked. The cottages are beautifully appointed with a rustic feel. The spa is beautiful. The housekeeping was perfect. And the service was impeccable. Be sure to visit the Farm restaurant on property. It was our favorite in the Valley. The only problem with this place is that you won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and a fabulous destination!!!”
Reviews.Author: PVDawg
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Carneros Inn with my wife and extended family and had a wonderful time. The Hill Top was great for relaxing in the pool and the views were amazing! I highly recommend the Inn to first timers to wine country as well as seasoned veterans!

Reviews.Title: “Country feel with city amenities”
Reviews.Author: BurgerMonster
Reviews.Content: Up front caveat - we were on our mini-moon (short version of the honeymoon, with real honeymoon coming a year later), so we were a little drunk with love. Carneros Inn has a rustic feel with a lot of the amenities you would get in a big city type of hotel. Located at the southern end of California's beautiful Napa wine region, the hotel sported many of the rolling vineyard views that make it a popular destination. When we first arrived, we were quite smitten with the level of service. The entry area where they check you in had a few staffers there who made us feel quite welcome. With cordial service and conversational style, we knew the service would be to our liking. They gave us the obligatory introduction champagne while they checked us in and gave us the layout of the property. The rooms are a little different. They do very much resemble high-end trailer park places. With tin corrugated tin roofs and set in small of groups of 6 or 8 rooms, they are an odd mix of luxury and country style living. The rooms feature a king size bed, a medium-sized bathroom, and a nice tub with both an indoor and outdoor shower. Each room has its own little firepit area and a nice little outdoor area along with a front porch area that looks out on the other rooms in the grouping. This gives it a little bit of a community feel, so if you are looking for isolated bungalows, this is not the place for you. The property has a couple of restaurants (Farm and another place I cannot remember the name to). We had breakfast at the unnamed place, which was excellent. Green Eggs and Ham is a must-have dish for anyone who likes eggs florentine. The restaurant has a distinct diner feel, so again, this is not the place to go for a secludeped high-end type meal. We had dinner at Farm one night, which was fantastic. The corn soup was fantastic, and the chef even provided us the recipe so we could try our best to mimic when we got home (we did quite well, actually). Farm is an exquisite restaurant with great food and a very good wine selection. The prices are high, but the service, ambiance, and food justified it. As a frame of reference, we did eat at French Laundry later on the same trip, and the Farm food, while not as good, did feature the best single item we ate (the aforementioned corn soup). The upper grounds have a beautiful infinity pool, which looked to be mostly unused in May when we were there. We did watch the sunrise from the jacuzzi, which was a stunning sight. They serve pool-side food, so we enjoyed a lunch and the views. The manager introduced himself and spent 20 minutes talking with us, a nice personal touch. We also had a couples massage and enjoyed the mineral bath overlooking the vineyards. The tubs overlook a mostly gorgeous view, though there was some construction to the right that made it less than perfect. The massages were good, and the bath was refreshing. They provided champagne and rose petals on our first night, a small detail that speaks to the service levels here. Overall, the place is expensive but beautiful. If you are looking true high-end, this is probably not the perfect place, but it is great for something that offers friendly and high-end mixed. The location is a little bit odd, since it is a bit south relative to the rest of the gems in the wine area. That being said, we both recommend this as a weekend getaway for anyone looking for romance and rustic style.

Reviews.Title: “Carneros Inn is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jdbaviation
