Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Carneros Inn for 3 nights at the end of Jul 09. We were both extremely happy with everything at the Inn. The rooms are fantastic. We had one of the harvest cottages with the outdoor soaking tub and outdoor shower which was great. We highly recommend it. The entire resort is emaculently clean and well maintained and the views from the hill top are amazing. The resort is also well positioned for wine touring in either Napa or Sonoma (although it is on the southern end of the valley) with several winerys within walking or biking distance with the free bikes. We ate at both the Farm and the Boon Fly cafe and both were very good. The spa was good, not great, and a little pricey. We had a few small negatives but I stress these as minor issues. It is a little pricey, but well worth every penny. I honestly can't wait to go back. Second, the A/C in our room went out twice. First time we noticed was late in the afternoon after returning from wine touring. We let them know the next morning because it actually got quite cool, if not cold at night and we really didn't need it at that time. Second time they sent out the maintenance guy (who was there in less than 20 min) and fixed it right away. They also gave us a nice bottle of wine for the inconvience. Overall, like I said before the stay was amazing and we really can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: nahgem
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon at the Carneros. I have traveled all over the world and this is the most relaxing place I have ever stayed. The service is unbelievable. The private cottages make you feel like you are the only people at the resort. The spa was amazing, Farm was excellent, and the Boon Fly Cafe is great for a quick bite. We liked the Carneros so much we extended our reservation our first morning there. Words cannot do this place justice. The staff was so helpful. We were an hour late for our wine tour and the concierge said no worries we will take care of it only to find out from our driver that she had to reschedule our whole day. Not to mention the grounds and views from the property are even prettier in person than they are on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Couples”
Reviews.Author: sbeia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 nt. stay with a total of 4 couples. The service is wonderful, very helpful when our luggage didn't arrive for 24 hours. The cottages are very comfy with heated bathroom floors and fireplaces. The outdoor shower is wonderful! Food is great too. Did not experience any spa services but took a steam shower. Pool /hot tub is in a beautiful setting. Overall a very pleasant place to stay. One small downside is that you do hear the slight roar of the highway but it's not too distracting.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, romantic, innovative, well done....best in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: mktozd
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, we were impressed both by the grounds as we were with the staff. From the concierge who helped us plan some of our winery visits to the front desk clerk to staff around the property, we were really impressed with the people. Moreover, unlike some of the larger luxury chains, most seemed to be more genuine and proud to be a part of Carneros Inn. Indeed, in talking with one of the bartenders at the Boon Fly Cafe he told us of the corporate events that Plumpjack has, etc. and this all shows through to the guest experieince. The rooms are fantastic, and we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a Harvest Cottage, which includes a fireplace, fountain and bathtub in the backyard. The room also had a lot of nice little touches like heated floors in the bathroom, an expresso machine, a fridge filled complimentary everyday with soda and water. The restaurants were also good, from Boonfly cafe to Farm, there is something for every budget and every taste. We particularly enjoyed the view in the morning from the Hilltop cafe as we did the lounge at Farm. However, our favorite breakfast was over at Boonfly Cafe. Overall, we would recommend the property and plan to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Carneros Inn”
Reviews.Author: PollyAberdeen
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Carneros Inn. Our cottage was extremely comfortable, staff were helpful and polite, breakfast at the Boon Fly Cafe was wonderful! I would not hesitate to stay at the Carneros again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best - Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: GRoscrans
Reviews.Content: Simply the best. Great facility, service and room. Thanks, we can't wait to go back. Our cottage room had a backyard garden, shower, tub, fireplace, patio set, lounge. Yes an outside shower and tub. Very romantic. Top notch service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every way”
Reviews.Author: cstaples
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of cool luxury hotels in the world, but very few top the Carneros Inn in Napa. Here's why: 1. The setting. The hotel is a collection of 80-something cottages set amidst rolling hills and vineyards between Sonoma and Napa, meaning all of the major sights in both valleys are just a short drive away. The landscaping is flawless, and the whole place feels like a Twenties-era resort town or Pleasantville on a small scale. 2. The rooms, or rather "cottages." Each of these is free-standing, arranged in land-scaped cul-de-sacs with gravel footpaths between them, plus large, truly-private garden patios complete with an outdoor heater and shower (which is amazing). The style takes the vernacular of the farms and vineyards nearby and gives it a fresh, modern spin. It's Martha Stewart meets Phillipe Starck. Oh yeah-- did I mention the rooms have huge soaker tubs, flat-sceen TVs, and real wood-burning fireplaces (which are almost extinct in hotels these days)? One tip: Ask for a room near the Hilltop to guarantee no traffic noise from the highway. Also, from what we could see there was no advantage to paying more for a cottage adjacent to the vineyards, since your garden walls shielded the view anyways. 3. The service. Amazing from the get-go, when you get poured a nice glass of red wine at reception (which is then refilled prior to your drive to your cottage). The staff is attentive and professional, but friendly in a very California kind of way. They actually have conversations with you, instead of simply exchanging pleasantries. The concierge staff deserves a special mention-- we've never experienced better pre-stay planning, complete with detailed maps. Every recommendation proved perfect. 4. The food. It's great. Make a reservation before you go, or you'll be out of luck at Farm for dinner. We ate breakfast at the Hilltop Dining Room rather than the Boon Fly Cafe-- the menu was basically the same, but the view is better and there were no crowds at all. Minibars are stocked only with water and pop-- but there are amazing snacks and beverages at the Market on the property (milk chocolate with maplewood bacon in it, anyone?). 5. The amenities. The hilltop pool is saltwater, with one of the best views you can imagine. Best of all, kids are banned, since they have their own pool nearby. A welcome touch. One suggestion: Ban cell-phone use around the pool, please.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: Spakat
Reviews.Content: We were taken by the beauty, character, and ambiance of The Carneros Inn. No detail is left unnoticed. We highly recommend The Carneros Inn for any couple interested in relaxing long weekend. We found it difficult to leave the property. Very romantic. We plan to stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Carneros Inn”
Reviews.Author: texguy32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Carneros Inn for our 5th anniverary in August 2009. When I asked for recommendations from co-workers, I got the usual Meadowood and Auberge suggestions. I went out on a limb with Carneros, on the basis of the website and Tripadvisor comments. Without a doubt, I'm glad I chose Carneros. The property and rooms are very nice. Very modern with clear high-end touches. Many high end hotels spend all their money on the common areas, and leave the actual room feeling a bit dingy and outdated. Not this place - it felt like a well decorated private residence. The high point of the rooms are the bathroom (my wife actually liked taking a bath - something she never does in most hotels) and the courtyard outside (we fell asleep on the oversized chaise lounge several nights under the heater). The pools are both very well done, with attentive servers and a good bar-type menu for lunch/snacks. We did not eat any dinners on the property, so I can't comment on the Farm. Boonfly for breakfast was fine, but not extraordinary. But the staff is what sets this place apart from many of the top tier hotels I've stayed at. We were greeted immediately upon driving up (the small scale of this place helps provide personal attention). My wife and I spent less than an hour at the pool the first night before dinner, but upon arriving the next day the same pool attendant remembered our drinks and went out of his way to serve us. Small touches like that go a long way in my opinion. Pros * Staff is top notch from top to bottom * Rooms are luxurious and feel like new (the only caveat as has been noted is the oldish TV but we didn't really use it anyway) * Common areas are well done - the pools are a great place to go after a day of winetasting. Workout facility is small but nice as well * Rural setting is relaxing but still fairly convenient to Napa and Yountville restaurants/activities * Seemed like a good value versus some of the obvious alternatives at least when I was comparing pricing. Especially nice was that they don't ding you for small stuff - in-room cokes/waters are free and refilled every day, and they give you nice coffee to make in the room. Didn't feel nickle-and-dimed at all Cons (pretty minor compared to Pros above) * The spa is a bit pricey. We had a great massage, but paid $125+tip each for 45 mins. Overall I would strongly recommend Carneros Inn. I found myself evangelizing about this place the week I got back from my trip to colleagues. Next time we're in Napa we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: havegunwilltravel
Reviews.Content: We really loved this unique and relaxing Inn where we stayed for 3 nights. Prior to arriving, the concierge staff was incredibly helpful in suggesting and booking restaurants, balloon flights,and wineries, based on our criteria. When we had to cancel one winery tour, and could not reschedule, the concierge found another that was just what we were looking for. Yes, the individual cottages do resemble a trailor park, but don't be deceived. The cottages deliver a level of privacy not available in most hotels. The beds are the best, and the linens are a soft as butter. Gets cold at night, so the heated bathroom floor was fantastic. The staff is uniformly helpful and professional. The "adult" pool offers a great vista, and the fitness center is well equiped and free. The Boonfly is great fro breakfast, but quite pricey for what you get. You can go into downtown Napa or find a "Denny's" if you don't want to spend $20/person on breakfast.. The FARM, however, is not to be missed. Make your reservation early - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “4-Star Luxury in an agricultural setting!”
Reviews.Author: DoubleTroubleMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights as a 15th wedding anniversary splurge. We had an adorable, basic cottage located in the middle of the property. The resort is billed as upscale, "agri-chic" and it delivers on that unique combination. When you first arrive, it seems very spread out, but once you familiarize yourself with the layout, the pathways provide short walks to everything. They will also send a staffer to drive you to your on-site destination in a large,golf cart type vehicle should you choose not to walk. We utilized that service on one evening when it was drizzling and we were dressed for dinner at The Farm. The resort is very clean, quiet and relaxing. We loved the heated tile floors and indoor/outdoor shower in our cottage. Staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. Dinner at The Farm was a true dining experience and breakfasts at the Boonfly Cafe were delicious but a bit uninspired. I would expect more fresh veggies and fruit in their dishes to match the "farm" feeling. We did encounter one distressing event during the final night of our stay. We had around $200 stolen from our wallets while we were gone. This has never happened to us before and we are frequent travelers, both domestically and internationally. I must admit that we were lulled into a sense of security by the upscale and quiet atmosphere of the place and failed to use the in-room safe for our valuables. In hindsight; I'm embarassed by my lapse in judgement but the staff never once made us feel that we were to blame. Thankfully, the staff, security and management were very understanding and professional -- they immediately rectified the situation by refunding our money and providing us with credit toward a future stay. Unfortunately for us, the delay (as it was our departure morning) resulted in us missing our flight home, adding a $64 bus trip to our itinerary and encountering a 4 hour delay in our travel plans. As an aside, if you choose to fly out of Santa Rosa Airport, be forewarned that they will close the gate a few minutes early and you will be completely SHUT OUT from your flight! There's only 1 attendant (it's a tiny airport) and when he's gone, you're SOL. We heard later that it's a regular occurance at this airport....shame on Horizon Air! The Carneros Inn is a fantastic resort and service is top-notch. We loved the 24 hour pool and spa and the quiet and serene grounds. The staff went out of their way to serve us breakfast by the pool when it was a cold morning and they were closing early for a wedding. All in all, I loved our stay here and would recommend it to anyone.....just be sure you use the in-room safe for your valuables. Other than that, I felt very safe and would feel safe staying there again. We're looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “All the modern amenities in a beautiful Napa Valley setting”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandTraveler22
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in the service was incredible, offering wine or other beverage at check-in. We had dinner reservations that evening in Yountville and we were provided with printed directions, as well as pre-printed maps to surrounding restaurants and wineries. We used the pool once and within 1 minute of sitting down, we were brought an ice bucked with water and a bar service menu. We got a little lost while walking to one of the restaurants and an employee in a golf cart stopped and gave us a lift to the restaurant. We needed to ask for nothing! Initially, when booking the room on-line, I wasn't sure about the room because I am more of a city person and love modern decor and amenities. However, I loved the Carneros Inn. Not only was the room interior modern, but the entire resort did a Fantastic job of combining modern convenience with the beauty and serentiy of the Napa Valley countryside. The grounds were spectacular, the bathroom was luxurious (loved the Red Flower toiletries), and the bed was very comfortable. We were surprised that we used the outdoor shower and LOVED it and our absolute favorite part of the trip was sitting on the private patio in the evening, with the use of the outdoor portable heaters, and watching the stars while sipping wine. The ONLY downside to the room was that it was a little narrow. We ate at the Boonfly (good, large portions), the FARM (very good food, modern, enjoyable atmosphere) and the Hilltop (beautiful vista view). The location was convenient to the Yountville restaurants and both Napa and Sonoma wineries. My husband, who has traveled all over the world summed it up by stating that the Carneros was hands down the nicest place he has stayed out. I couldn't agree more!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!!”
Reviews.Author: arugulaah
Reviews.Content: Carneros Inn was amazing. I stayed there with a couple of friends last summer during a visit to wine country. We stayed in two guest cottages joined by an outdoor terrace. The furnishings were top of the line and the staff were all extremely friendly, helpful and welcoming. The grounds and landscaping were gorgeous and gave the place a country-meadow type vibe, in a good way. There were many outdoor areas ideal for just hanging out with friends or family. Bocci courts by the restaurant "Farm" kept us entertained for hours. I hope to make it back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place!”
Reviews.Author: elysiafit
Reviews.Content: The Carneros is a great choice! We took a road trip from San Diego along the coast and ended in Napa and it was just the place we needed.. From the check in where we were greeted with a glass a wine, the spa treatments, and dinner it was wonderful! We also received a 3rd night free when booking with Amex so what a deal! The place isn't cheap but the room was the best, we stayed in the garden cottage the backyard/patio made it worth it with a firepit, tub, heatlamp, and lounge chairs. The pool is open 24 hours so it's great to take a night swim and relax in the hot tub, it also has a great view and sunset. I would definitely recommend going for a romantic getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Sublime!”
Reviews.Author: tamstrat
Reviews.Content: I love the Napa/Sonoma area and so when planning our 30th wedding anniversary I wanted to stay some place really unique, I chose the Carneros Inn and wow, I'm so glad we stayed there. Everything was absolutely perfect starting when we arrived and checked in at reception-a glass of wine-how lovely. We were upgraded to a "suite" which was huge for my husband and myself but was greatly appreciated The rooms were lovely and well appointed. We both loved the outdoor shower feature, amazing to shower and look out over the fields and rolling hills in Napa. We also loved the privacy of the deck area, very rustic and charming. My husband and I shared a bottle of wine and sat on the deck in the evening, very quiet and romantic. Every single person who worked for the hotel we encountered was friendly and helpful. We ate one evening at the Boonfly Cafe and the service was great and the food wonderful. I wanted to have a wonderful and memorable stay for our 30th wedding anniversary and the Carneros Inn exceeded our expectations in every way. If you are wishing for a lovely, quiet, romantic experience in Napa, I highly recommend this hotel. The cottages are lovely, well appointed and different from a regular hotel experience. We hope to one day return and stay here again. Thank you Carneros Inn for upgrading us and giving us a wonderful anniversary experience!

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, THE CHOICE in Wine Country!!!”
Reviews.Author: capuferg
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and when we do, I tend to obsess over the hotel selection. I had read a couple of blurbs in travel magazines about the Carneros Inn but didn't know anyone who had stayed there. So I felt like it was a bit of a leap of faith when I booked our three night stay there. Well, it turned out to be not only a great choice but it was THE choice as far as I'm concerned. We had also considered Auberge du Soleil (stayed there a few years ago and loved it), Solage, and Bardessono (both fairly new). But having visited them all on this trip, hands down, there is no comparison. Not only is the physical environment at Carneros stunningly beautiful, the service was over the top fantastic. We have stayed in some pretty incredible hotels around the world, but I've never experienced such top notch, unsolicited, bend over backwards service. The property is immaculately maintained, the Hilltop pool heavenly, and the rooms so comfy cozy. I've decided that on my next visit to wine country I will check into the Carneros Inn and not leave the property until I check out. Don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: domenico624
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carneros Inn for three nights (but only paid for 2! Ask about their deal right now!). After a rough flight and no luggage with me, arriving at the Caneros made me feel MUCH better. We had the best cottage (Lee 1) and it was gorgeous with an even more gorgeous back deck and view of the vineyards. The pros: The staff was more than helpful, the beds were soooo cozy, the bathroom was amazing (we want to re-do our bathroom at home now just like the Carneros!), the outdoor shower was wonderful with the rain showerhead, we got breakfast delievered to us every morning which was soo yummy! The pool was beautiful (and empty!) and the grounds were too. The spa was wonderful too - I recommend a body scrub by Patricia! The cons: If you want your room cleaned before three, make sure to ask for that. Also, don't have a fire in your fireplace! Our whole room smelled like campfire! And everyhing is obviously very overpriced from the spa treatments to the snacks at the Market...Also, dogs are allowed and there was a barking dog for two days straight, which is all I heard while at the pool, but the staff did everything they could to get it to stop. Overall, The Carneros was AMAZING. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: loribDallas
Reviews.Content: Carneros Inn is a wonderful place to stay. Staff is friendly and helpful! Cottages are clean and very nice. I will always stay her when traveling to Napa! Boonfly is great for breakfast! The Market is nice to have on property and the pool with poolside drinks is great! Spa is great, massage by Patricia is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and tranquil - it's all in the details”
Reviews.Author: JulesMenloPark_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carneros a few years ago on the recommendation of a co-worker. We still dream of returning there - it encompassed our illusory trip to Napa. The staff - phenomenal and friendly, never a step out of cadence. We love minimal and modern, and this place had it. Al fresco shower - amazing! Heated floors for those cool nights, perfect white sheets, fireplace, jacuzzi tub, etc etc etc. We also visited the spa and had such a relaxing experience. We chilled by the pool that overlooks the vineyard and took walks around the resort, which was well groomed. I love that Carneros has taken five star to a different level, the small details made this place something we will definitely return to again.

Reviews.Title: “Barn yard chic, or nouveau trailer park, you decide!”
Reviews.Author: ByronDreams
Reviews.Content: I get the feeling this place is a love it or hate it thing. Stayed just one night and I can definitely see how it could induce some polarity in opinion. It is either barnyard chic or nouveau trailer park and I guess that is in the eye of the beholder. On the one hand, it's an easy location, not as far out as some of the nicer properties in Napa, making it an easy drive from SF. However, the grounds are much less lush than some of the other nicer properties in the Napa Valley. It's a bit spare and reminiscent of, well, a high end trailer park or Agresta (which will only make sense if you watch Weeds.) The use of corrugated metal as the barrier fence between the cottages is brave but also a a bit questionable. It's next to impossible to make any material like that look high end, and at $600 a night, high end is important. Okay, I get the whole "Farm" theme, but perhaps some weathered wood might have been a more inviting choice and more fitting for the vibe they are going for? Extremely high marks for the entire experience at their restaurant "Farm". The food was excellent and the outdoor dining room exactly what one hopes for on a warm night in Napa. The radiant heated floors in the bathrooms, the indoor/outdoor showers and the rocking chairs on the front porches also are worth mention. Additional shout out to the 24 hour pool and hot tub on the hill top. Nice view, nice touch. Low marks for the general lack of lushness and views from the rooms, the very odd lack of space for setting up the luggage valet even in one of the larger cottages, sparse landscaping, semi-characterless rooms and as mentioned and did I mention the weird use of corrugated metal? Neutral marks for the extreme neutrality of the rooms. They are very comfortable, but as mentioned a bit cramped (even in the larger ones) and also lacking in character. It's hard to love them unless you happen to love things that are completely neutral, which is hard to do by definition. Additional high marks for the spa -- one of the best massages I have ever had. Also for the pool -- gorgeous view of the valley. Over all, this is the kind of place I would recommend that you go visit before you stay if you can. Very difficult to describe it accurately if you've not seen it in person. It warrants a tour prior to your stay of possible. But if you end up there, make the most of the heated floors, the lovely view from the pool/hot tub and the food at Farm.

Reviews.Title: “Solo girl has found Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: BlondeandBlue99
Reviews.Content: As the sweet young bellman helped me from my car, told me to leave the keys in it and then slapped a glass of cabernet in my hand along with a welcoming smile, I knew I was on to something. This type of greeting goes a long way with me. I'm just saying. I've been reading about and lusting for The Carneros Inn for almost a year now in the course of developing my travel singlegirl solo grove. At long last as the economy has approached depression along with the unique alignment of a last minute vacation and an Easter Sunday with no family commitments, the room rate gods said "we'll give the girl a break". I reserved a vineyard view cottage - I've gotta have a view. I've got to have my privacy. Admittedly I was there during an "off" time (early in the week) and the resort was pretty much empty. The nice man at check in was kind enough to upgrade me to a vineyard view suite which consisted of two connected buildings, one housing the bedroom/gorgeous bath, and the other a living area and full bath which I walked in one time. MONSTROUS deck in the back connecting the two. And oh yes, there was a view. There are over 100 reviews here about how lovely the rooms are and exceptional the service is - yes it's all true. But let me say how the combination of a heated slate floor in the bathroom, sexy outdoor shower and a beautiful sunrise in the morning can be pretty much a religious experience. I'm no tree hugger but I might have to become one after two days of gazing out over the hilltop pool, admiring the utterly *stunning* grounds which I don't think have been emphasized here enough, and ... this is a hard thing for a city girl to admit, but also....bird watching. They are very busy there. I may have lost my mind. There are some cool amenities to this place that also make it worthy of staying on campus for a weekend and not fret too much about hitting every winery within a five mile radius. I went large for lunch at The Boon Fly Cafe with the burger and it was worth every one of the 5,000 calories I ingested. Two glasses of wine too and I got to walk back to my cottage without the angst of "should I be driving?". The swimming pools are both beautiful and vanishing edge. Definitely worth a couple of hours of your day. There's a very nice market place at the entry to the Inn with a well stocked deli counter and monstrous refrigerator case with an impressive wine collection. Nice gift shop also. Cute little post office next door. The Hilltop restaurant was closed when I was there but I didn't care. Between the burger and the treats I scored at the market place, it was more than enough. I've got to have my patio, balcony or deck. As far as some valuable inside "reconn", when I go back I'll reserve a simple "cottage". No view required - the surroundings and space are all spectacular and I don't need the grandure of the big meadow and vineyard to know I will have an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection- cannot imagine a better place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Dwarren70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carneros Inn for three nights at the end of March to celebrate our 10th anniversary. I could not have asked for a more lovely place to stay. Check in was very smooth and we were given a glass of wine during the process. From the moment we arrived, the staff was simply exceptional. The grounds are spread out and well landscaped in such a way as it never feels crowded. The decor in the cottage was very modern with clean lines. The best part, without a doubt, is the backyard which allows for complete privacy. We had a table with four chairs and a double sized lounge chair as well as the outdoor shower. We used the heat lamp in the evenings and were very comfortable. I should also say that there are different room set-ups in the garden cottages as our friends' cottage was arranged differently as was their backyard. It seems to me that the better set up is where the bed faces the french doors out onto the backyard. If you are looking for a resort where you are not on top of your neighbors and enjoy outdoor space- this is definitely the place for you. As I stated before, the staff was great. The concierge services were professional and friendly. Prior to arriving they had made arrangments for us to go on Playtpus Tours one day and for a driver from Napa Valley Tours on the second day where we had appointments at mostly smaller wineries and were provided with a very personal experience. I would recommend both highly. The first night we returned to the room to find a complimentary bottle of wine and a nice note in celebration of our anniversary. A nice touch. The breakfasts at Hilltop were excellent as was the view from the outdoor dining. One morning I had asked for a wake-up call but having awakened early, we left for breakfast before the scheduled time. When we arrived back to the room, someone knocked on the door just to make sure everything was okay since we hadn't answered the phone. Another evening, ice was delivered to the room in less than five minutes of calling. Boon Fly was good for dinner. My only disappointment was Farm where the food was just okay even though the atmosphere and service were above average. In all- I would not hesitate to highly recommend this property. It is near perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hospitality in the heart of wine country”
Reviews.Author: johannaeh1
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend a stay at this inn. My huband and I had been travelling California, from South to North, for a week before we landed at the Caneros Inn. Needless to say, our one night stay here made up for the rest of the trip. We were welcomed at the reservation check-in with attentive service, that did not end till the moment we left. Our "room", a private cabin, was decorated from the pages of architectural digest and included an indoor shower that led to outdoor shower and private deck/back-yard with heat lamps. The grounds were well maintained, the swimming pools magnificent. We played bacci, swam outside, had a steam/sauna, ate well and had a great nights sleep. I highly reccommend a stay here. We intend to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, unique rooms - not a great value though”
Reviews.Author: Gate
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on our way to San Francisco. It's a unique hotel in that the rooms are little cottages which are actually unattractive from the outside but unique and lovely inside. Modern room with modern conveniences (heated bathroom floor, hardwood bedroom floor, plasma TV, outdoor heated patio and outdoor shower that connects to the bathroom shower stall - very fun!). The service is wonderful and there is a sense of privacy that you don't normally find in a typical hotel. Two pools and a jacuzzi, one of which overlooks a spectacular valley. Had a lovely dinner at The Farm which was very good. At $390/night though, it just isn't something I would do again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Very Best...”
Reviews.Author: blossom
Reviews.Content: I have hesitated to write this review, because I thought I might gush too much! Because for me, this hotel is just about as perfect as a hotel could be. My husband and I were driving through the area and I've always wanted to stay here, so I gave them a call to ask them about room rates. We got a very good price on their garden cottage (a quiet Superbowl Sunday in winter) and then were upgraded to a Vineyard suite, which was a lovely gesture and much appreciated. A true mark of a 5 star hotel. The service was excellent, as good as any 4 Seasons, though with a casual California style. Our room was heaven, especially the bathrooms, with the heated slate floors and all the natural light. And the patio, too, was wonderful...even though we stayed on a January day, the weather was sunny and in the 60's, and we used the patio in the evening and morning thanks to an outside heater. Our vineyard view was soothing and bucolic. Don't know if I'll ever be able to return, but would love to, and the Carneros Inn is on my list of the best hotels I've ever visited. Truly romantic, and relaxing. The only faults were expressed by my husband. He would've liked an Ipod dock and a tv in the bathroom (which I could care less about! I'll take the lovely warm floors anyday!) A very special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hl248
Reviews.Content: We went to the Carneros Inn with another couple at the beginning of January. The experience was overall very positive. Staff was incredibly professional. Food at the Farm was very good. Make sure you book with American Express so you get some food credits for lunch. The rooms were very nice - heated bathroom floors, fireplace, comfy beds. Wouldn't recommend going there when it's cold though. We couldn't really take advantage of the patio space / outdoor area. Lock your cash in the safe provided! $180 was stolen from our room when we went to the pool. But we reported it and they were EXTREMELY professional about it and refunded us immediately. They have a very sophisticated security system where they can track who goes in and out of your room and at what time. The Carneros Inn is very pricey but you pay for this kind of service.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: ParisDreamin'
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed here this past weekend for the first time for a weekend getaway with our friends. I don't say this often, but I don't think that I would ever stay anywhere else in this area in the future. Admittedly among the most expensive accommodations in the Napa area, but there's definitely a reason for that. The service was not bad, although I wouldn't say that it was of 5 star hotel quality. It was more of a friendly, helpful nature than a refined, anticipate your needs and meet them nature. The grounds are truly gorgeous, from the common gathering areas, to the pools, to the vineyards, to the restaurants. Among the best facilities that you will ever find. The cottage was not spacious but very cozy. The bed was nice, not too soft, as many luxury hotel beds are for my taste. The bathroom was outstanding, with our favorite feature being the outdoor shower. What a unique, memorable touch. The private back patio was a great place to spend some quiet time. Overall, I simply have to say that this is one of the best places to simply relax that I have ever stayed at. Now for some comments about dining, since I would consider that mandatory for a Wine Country review. We had dinner at Redd on Friday, lunch at The French Laundry on Saturday, dinner at Tra Vigne on Saturday, breakfast at the hotel's Hilltop Restaurant on Sunday before leaving. Redd in Yountville was outstanding. One Michelin star, well deserved. Good value for the area for fine dining. Excellent foie gras trio as an appetizer. Both the beef and the duck cooked beautifully. The desserts were outstanding, the chocolate peanut butter gianduja and the Thai coffee panna cotta. The French Laundry in Yountville was very good, although it's hard to meet or exceed the hype. Service was good, as expected. We all had the chef's tasting menu, noone had the vegetarian tasting menu. I would say that the best dishes were the duck, the foie gras, the striped bass. The bread from Bouchon bakery was outstanding. The dessert was good, not necessarily out of this world. The petit fours plus chocolates was a nice touch. All in all, a very good meal, worth the trip once at least, particularly given the fact that the cost is relatively reasonable for a three Michelin star restaurant. That being said, I have definitively had better meals at three star restaurants in Paris as well as at Gordon Ramsay in London. Tra Vigne in St. Helena was a surprising find. We didn't think that we would like what we had for dinner after the 4 hour lunch at French Laundry, but we were surprised. Casual, relatively inexpensive, completely different from the pomp and circumstance of French Laundry. Creative, tasty pasta dishes, nice shortribs, very nice pizza. Breakfast on the patio of the Hilltop Restaurant on a picture perfect day, with the view of the vineyards over the pool, was a great finish to the weekend of dining.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JoJoBeAn44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like to try and stay at the nicer places when we travel. It's always a hit or miss when you start reading reviews and second guesses. We decided to try The Carneros Inn is Napa ... The level of service is amazing, from the staff directing arriving guests in the parking lot at the main entry to the staff that greets you at your car door offering you some champaign at the main lobby entry. Then sitting down with the front deck staff going over the check-in ... We had dinner at the onsite resturant "Farm". Again, service level was perfect ... Breakfast at "Bon Fly Cafe" .... service was perfect ... The room was very private and comfortable. Fireplace, indoor/outdoor shower, heated bathrrom floors, cozy beds. Very clean rooms and bathrooms. The soda, water, juice bottles in the fridge are all complimentary. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The goods & the flaws”
Reviews.Author: sasima
Reviews.Content: Indeed amazing, as is apparent from countless glowing tripadvisor reviews. The resort is very true to its locale in design & ambiance. The employees are well-trained, provide polished service, & are genuinely happy & personable - Four Seasons level or better. 0% snobbery. 100% R&R. We were there the Christmas week, leaving before Christmas. Then returned for a shorter stay the following week. This is the low season for Napa Valley â€“ very low. I had initially planned a spring trip, but decided to take a chance on winter. We all absolutely loved how quiet & private it felt. It never felt dead boring quiet, because the restaurants & public areas are well trafficked by locals & other visitors. RESORT LAYOUT - The cottages are spread across the resort in various unique configurations (clusters of cottages, each cluster is assigned a name such as Larsen/Ceja/Bartolucci/etc). Each cluster has its own parking area, so it's very easy to fetch your car. There's no valet. You just walk a short number of steps from your cottage to your car. - The detailed resort map is available on its web site (www.thecarnerosinn.com > click on Photos > click on Virtual Tours). Very well done. It shows all the cottages, with their cluster name & #. - Although itâ€™s spread on 27 acres, itâ€™s a short walk to get anywhere. And the way the whole place is laid out makes you want to walk, and meander about by taking different paths to get to/from a destination. However, if you don't want to walk, simply call the bell desk & you'll be picked up at your cottage & taken by courtesy car/golf cart to your desired destination. - The Vineyard Walk path (I call it the 'backway' to the Hilltop area) is very dimly lit at night. Because it has some steps, it's an ankle twist/fall waiting to happen if you're not careful. - True, this place is a little south of the heart of the valley. But I consider that a blessing -- it's a freestanding haven (not like, say, Yountville where you can see a hotel every block). Downtown Napa is an easy 10min trip, Yountville 15-20, etc. THE COTTAGES - Fabulous, as any photo of the cottages make obvious. - Beds are soft in that feather bed sort of way. I like very firm bed, so the beds weren't the greatest for me, but they did the job. The problem w/ feather beds is they can be heavenly when new, but develop a concave in the center when they get old. - For the standard cottages, Ceja #2, 3, & 4 offer the most privacy (from what I saw) - King cottage Larsen #4. A lot of light into the cottage & patio all day long. It's also an end unit. Only down side is water takes about 5 minutes to get really hot. - Double-Double cottage Mahoney #6. Not a lot of light into the cottage in the morning. The patio is big, really nice. Right outside the front door is a lawn, good if you have kids/dogs. - Double-Double cottage Lee #7. The patio is small. The beds have started to concave. It was ok, but I wouldn't stay there again. PET FRIENDLY - A lot of people take their dogs to the Apple Orchard. Parents can sit & chat on the benches while the children & dogs run around the big grassy expanse. SPA - This is the tiniest hotel spa I've ever seen. 18 lockers total, 2 showers, 2 toilets, 2 sinks. This is no problem in low season, but can you imagine what happens during the busy months when 90% of the time the resort is at capacity? - The lounge area is co-ed. It's nice to be able to relax pre-/post-treatment with your spouse in an oversized sofa lounger. The steam room & sauna are segregated, but you can always meet up with your spouse at the Hilltop Jacuzzi which is directly outside the spa (sorry, you can't see the sunset from the Jacuzzi). BTW, the Jacuzzi is heated to 101deg, which is perfect -- most Jacuzzi are set to 105/higher which is too hot. The pools are heated year round, set to 82deg in winter. - Between the 4 of us, we had 3 massages, 2 hair & scalp treatments, & 3 facials. We rated them from OK to very good. Massages all very good. The quality of the facial & what is done is dependent on the therapist. My sister's 1st Mini-Chardonnay facial was excellent (result: super hydrated, soft, smooth, dewy), but the 2nd one just ok (soft, dewy); the 1st therapist used scrubs to exfoliate, whereas the 2nd therapist used acid peel. - In-room massage is a good choice if you simply want to roll off the massage table & onto your bed. Otherwise, just go to the spa. The in-spa massage tables are the best & most comfortable I've seen; and the masseuse will be able to do heating packs for you that's not possible in the in-room setup. - Book your spa treatments early, otherwise it could be slim picking. FITNESS CENTER - Nicely equipped, but not a true gym. It looks to me to be ~ 900sq ft. - Plenty of cardio machines, all with direct view of the lap pool. - Not a lot of weight machines, but enough to work out all your main muscle groups. RESTAURANTS - All 3 restaurants do fine jobs for what they're trying to be. - The Boon Fly donuts are indeed worthy of its fame. Although we had it 3 times, every time very good, but only 1st time was perfection. - The huevo ranchero (they call it 'crispy tortilla and farm eggs') @ the Hilltop restaurant for breakfast is very good. - The seared scallop in meyer lemon broth (foam of broth, really) @ the Farm is so simple, but so very good. - If you like bread & butter, the Farm uses the tastiest butter. But we didn't ask them what brand of butter.

Reviews.Title: “Best time Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rikki13
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Carneros Inn was wonderful. I read reviews about this location, and I did not expect for all of the good reviews to be true. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. It was my guests Birthday and we were both first timers in Napa. He was beyond shocked at how well our stay turned out. It was a little on the pricey side, and the restaurants we went to (all of the ones on the residence) were great, but were also on the more pricey side. For those of you who are willing to stay for a little more cash I highly recommend this place for a first time. Staff was very friendly, our cottage was excellent, and the restaurants were great. I would definitely recommend The Carneros Inn for anyone staying in the Napa/Sonoma area.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Unforgettable/amazing”
Reviews.Author: WestVillGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carneros for fourth of July weekend with my boyfriend. My review: don't even THINK about staying anywhere else in Napa. This hotel is incredible and quite possibly the best hotel I've ever stayed at in my life. The entire property is stunning and we joked with the staff that the pictures on the website don't do it website. Each guests stays in a private cabin. This brings luxury to a new level. Most comfortable plush beds, marble bathroom, wood burning fire place (even in July it got chilly in the evenings), outdoor shower, and big patio. I can't rave enough about the property, the restaurants, the pool, everything was 10 stars! As for other Napa tips, you MUST get a driver if you're going tasting. You absolutely can't drive yourself around if you're going to drink all day. You get absolutely plastered and the cops are very strict. Besides, how many times in your life are you going to be in Napa? Do it right!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: rangers23
Reviews.Content: little bit south of the valley, but loved it here. staff were so friendly and totally helpful, even when we had a fireplace "incident" (flue wasnt opened someone tasted too much wine that day). I'd 100% stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Thank goodness the Calistoga Ranch was full !”
Reviews.Author: DepDawg
Reviews.Content: To be honest - this was our second choice. We wanted to go to the Calistoga Ranch but it was full. What a stroke of luck !! This is a great property with lovely styled buildings. The cottage concept is good, and the rooms themselves are nice with open fireplace, front and back deck, outdoor shower, free internet, flat screen TV with DVD and complimentary soft minibar. We came on a package which included dinner one night, breakfast, wine tasting and treatments and I would strongly recommend this as a good value option for a 2 or 3 day stay. We also ate in Sonoma one night which is really nice place, and walked Main St in St. Helena which is worth while too after driving down the Napa valley. We like peace and quiet and I would advise you to ask for a cottage that is appropriately situated (at the back or side of the property away from the road / Farm restaurant , and where the sun makes it in to the back garden in the afternoon. The pool area and hot tub on the hill have the most fabulous views with horses grazing in the field next to the pool looking down over the vineyards and up to the hills in the distance... Service was excellent and we ate well for Breakfast in the Hilltop and also at the Farm where fresh seasonal excellent cooking is the order of the day and its clear that the staff take a real delight in the their work. Thank goodness the Calistoga was full !! I think we got a much better deal for our money and a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LoganAshley
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this amazing resort and did not want to leave! Stayed in a Garden Cottage with a King bed. From the moment we pulled up the customer service was exemplary...we were greeted with wine and then escorted to our room. Hotel staff quickly met our needs when we requested ipod charger and a wine decanter. In addition, we had the opportunity to eat at the Farm restaurant dinner and the Hilltop Dining Room for breakfast (both were terrific!) In addition one evening we spent by the pool and the fireplace (had it all to ourselves) which was amazing! We have had the opportunity to stay in some of the nicest resorts in the world and this was definitely one of our favorites!! It was a lifetime top 10 experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...Truly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sdc0915
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay at the Carneros Inn was just perfect. This hotel has thought of everything. We got a package from the hotels website that made the cost a little more palleatable, since so much was included (breakfasts, one dinner, massage for two, etc). The entire experience was romantic, comfortable and thoroughly enjoyable. We hope to go back again really soon!

Reviews.Title: “One of best hotels I've stayed in US”
Reviews.Author: hate_flying_economy
Reviews.Content: This place rocks - we've stayed all over the USA and never had the level of service and relaxation in this place. Rooms are great - cosy (i.e. small) to get two cases and all your gear in, but the outdoor deck and bathroom area make up for it. The day we arrived there was Beer, BBQ and Bocce (runs once a month) which meant we could enjoy a beautiful sunset with local draft beer and BBQ (very cheap prices for both!) there was a great atmosphere around the place that night. The pool was very quiet with beautiful views across the Napa Valley - staff were excellent from check-in to check-out. Napa itself isnt exactly exciting, but this place more than made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise -- We Liked This Place A Lot”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: Found this place via Amex Platinum Fine Hotels and Resorts. Thought we wouldn't enjoy it as a family destination but actually we did. The region has limited activities of interest to children but it is a beautiful setting and there is enough to satisfy a 3-4 day visit. Very stroller friendly; great staff; little kiddie pool our kid loved which is not more than 18 inches deep. Our vineyard suite was really pretty and picture postcard perfect from the little picture windows in our bathroom and outdoor shower. Sitting in a hammock at the hilltop pool at night you see a full sky of stars, something I see rarely. Feed apples to the horses that border the property and see cows in the meadow. Pick apples and figs on the trees. Farm fine dining restsaurant is excellent but it only has one fish on the menu and not conducive to return visits if you are a fish eater and want some choice. The outdoor area outside Farm is a great place to chill; have a guitar and flute player there on weekends when we visited. The Market is excellent as a grocery. A few things could use improvement: Food at Hilltop and Boonfly Cafe comes out slow and breakfast at Hilltop is uninspired; a real problem with little children. After a few days, they figured out they needed to get stuff on the table for the kids more quickly to avoid meltdowns and trashing the place. Concierge sent us off to an attraction which was closed that day of week and didn't tell us to take care to arrive at another attraction in time for it to close. Didn't say sorry either. Sent us to a restaurant for fish without calling to find out if they had it on the menu (they didn't, but we lucked out with a fish special that night). But she was very friendly and tried to please; more a function that they don't have many kid visitors. Spa was friendly but both my wife and I were not happy with our treatments; the spa director took them off our bill and called me up twice that week to make sure we were OK. Hotel has a great line of blood orange-flavored toiletry products; we liked them enough that we bought some (something I've never otherwise done). Hilltop tends to have weddings going on almost daily on the property and this does interfere a bit with the poolside. They need to properly direct people with cars onto the property off the main road and how to get back on the road. When you go out through the main exit, it is right turn only and that is a no-go since you have to go miles without a turnoff.

Reviews.Title: “Wine country bliss”
Reviews.Author: seikokai
Reviews.Content: This is a superb property a few minutes outside Napa in the Carneros region famous for its Pinot Noir. We stayed in one of the cottages for four nights (Sept./08) and were very impressed. Some observations in no particular order: 1) super staff who sincerely wanted to make your stay memorable. We didn't encounter one person who didn't seem genuinely interested in helping you enjoy your visit. 2) great accommodations in the cottages - their somewhat rustic appearance on the outside belies the upscale layout inside. 3) excellent cuisine in both the Farm restaurant and the Boon Fly Cafe. 4) if you're a fitness buff, more than adequate facilities including two pools, a fitness gym with plenty of treadmills, weight machines, free weights, etc. We would not hesitate to recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: ViennaVoyager
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day visit to the Carneros Inn. We arrived a little before noon after an early flight from the east coast. Since our room wasn't ready yet, we wandered to the Hilltop Restaurant that is just for hotel guests. We had a great table on the patio overlooking the beautiful pool and the vineyard covered countryside. We had a great lunch. Our waiter was great, and helped us have a relaxing lunch. After lunch we were offered a glass of wine in the lobby while we waited for our room to be ready. We reserved a vineyard view room. The room was well appointed The bathroom was fabulous -- heated floors, spacious, with a tub and a fantastic shower. The best part was the door from the indoor shower out to the outdoor shower. I enjoyed a refreshing shower outside every day. We enjoyed both the back deck that looked over the vineyard and the front porch complete with rockers. The property is fantastic with beautiful grounds, fruit trees, lots of water fountains in stainless steel tanks. Views of the vineyards. We enjoyed walking around the property. Even though it is a big place the layout of the cottages let you walk around and feel you are staying in a much smaller place. While we were there the apple trees had lots of fruit. During a morning walk one of the ladies who worked there offered a fig from one of the trees. It was sweet and tasty. We ate in all of the restaurants. FARM was elegant but not pretentious with great food. We waited in the outdoor lounge which had a great fire pit. The restaurant was open and airy. We also made our way to the Boon Fly Cafe. Friends had told us they had a great hamburger. Instead we had the daily special, fried chicken (we usually don't eat chicken in restaurants since we eat it at home so much), it was fantastic. The Market had a great selection of wine, cheese, sandwiches, salads, and other gourmet treats. After our morning walk we'd stop of a latte. There were lots of choices depending on what you're in the mood for. We used the gym. Very nice. The doors open to the family pool. Lots of air and the feel of being outside while working on the treadmill to work off all that wine and gourmet food. They even had the cutest little adirondack for the kids. Lots of towels around. We were offered bottled water at the pool. Everything is very well maintained. The staff was great. The valet staff provided cold water or soda when you drove up. (Temperatures were in the high 90s while we were there.) Check in/check out were flawless. We also got great advise on wineries and restaurants. The best advise when we were on the hunt for a good italian restaurant came from one of the valets who sent us to Don Giovanni, an excellent italian place in Napa. While the property is expensive, we thought it was worth the cost. I only have two complaints. First, the turn into the property comes up on you suddenly so plan ahead. Second, the lounge chair in the room looked good but didn't do much as a chair. It turned out not to be a problem since we had two chaise lounges and a table with chairs on the back deck and two great rockers in the front.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bell88
Reviews.Content: Spent sometime in Napa with my husband on a short get-away weekend. When we drove up to the property I was not sure what to expect. The check-in service was wonderful, however our room was not ready. They did buy us drinks by the pool and we enjoyed the view of the valley. Nothing else special. Our cottage was simple but comfortable. The floors heated up in the bathroom which was a nice touch. Had a good night sleep until the tall bushes started blowing and hitting the tin fence on the patio. At first when I woke up I thought someone was trying to break in. Given the price of $600+, I would have thought they could have provided breakfast and a wine and cheese event, as the other hotels do in the area. Would not stay here again. The price is not worth what you get

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jtbpdx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Carneros Inn. Picture yourself sitting on your private deck, in your private garden area, sipping a fine pinot noir. If you can, this is the place for you. Plane and simple: great accomodations, great service, and great surroundings. Other than some dogs barking in the distance...this place was a 9.5 out 10 for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In Napa”
Reviews.Author: JasBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Napa with friends, and decided to stay at one place (Carneros) for our entire visit, over one week. It was a great decision. The rooms were very nice - cottages, actually, with spacious bathrooms and large outdoor patios with plenty of seating. The patios also have heaters, which work very well during the chilly evenings and early mornings. Also loved the outdoor showers. Service was excellent overall. The only glitch was with the concierge desk - though they were nice enough, they incorrectly entered the time for one of our vineyard visits, and also didn't make follow-up calls for some other activities. The problems are correctable - seems like a management matter, perhaps too many people trying to do one job (I think we spoke with at least four different folks regarding plans). In any event, they did pick up the tab for the tasting at the rescheduled vineyard visit, which was the right thing to do. The "adult" pool area is the best spot at the resort - it sits atop a hill with fantastic views of a meadow, vineyard and mountains, with occasional horses and cows meandering about on the other side of the fence. Truly, it was difficult to leave - we actually spent some evenings enjoying the sunsets and having dinner and/or appetizers outside. The nearby outdoor fireplace is also a terriffic spot for an evening nightcap. Poolside service was excellent. Overall, we enjoyed the first rate service in a relaxed, more casual setting (compared to Auberge, for example). In fact, our friends had been to Auberge on a prior trip, and much preferred the ambiance at Carneros.

Reviews.Title: “Best property in Napa”
Reviews.Author: TexasAggie9800
Reviews.Content: My wife and I staying at The Carneros for 2 nights at the end of June for a romantic getaway. We loved it. Its a non-conventional type resort because its not setup like a hotel with doors right next to each other. Every unit is its own house, almost like a little apartment. They attention to detail is incredible. Outside gives the impression of a rustic cottage, if you don't prepare yourself you might think its just a shack. The inside is contemporary but very luxurious. Heated bathroom floors, excellent comfortable beds, outdoor shower ( you have to do this), flat screen TV, private heated patio.... The property is so quiet and peaceful that you almost feel like you are the only ones there. Very relaxing. The area outside the main bar is really neat. The restaurants are great. The market place has pretty much everything you'll need. The service is 1st class. The hilltop breakfast is to die for. The views are spectacular. If you are looking for 1st class in the wine country, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarrieLeighB
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING!!!! We stayed here for the three days/nights in the middle of our honeymoon - we didn't leave the grounds for three days! The spa is wonderful and has unique and refreshing touches; the restaurants are culinary delights [the decor in The Farm is SO COOL - I think they called it "aggro-sheek"]; the best part is the accomodations; I think my husband took seventeen showers because the indoor shower converts to a private outdoor shower. How fun is that?!?! The service is true service - the staff truly tries to accomodate your every request, and they even try to anticipate your requests before you have them! If you look on their website, the pictures are quite impressive, however they do not do this facility justice. I promise, if you go here, you will be talking about the experience for the rest of your life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Getaway for a Few Days”
Reviews.Author: CCSFBayArea
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our anniversary at the Carneros Inn. What a lovely place. The meals were outstanding at the Farm Restaurant, and good lunch at the Hilltop restaurant. We also had fabulous massages and we felt they weren't rushed whatsoever. Staff is top notch and so friendly. One thing l like too is our cottage room which had an outdoor private backyard with an outdoor shower. There were lounge chairs and table if you want to eat in-room dining. Also, the mini fridge was stocked w. drinks that were free. It was a full moon that evening so after dinner we went by the pool and sat at the lounge chairs and watched the moon rise. It was a special treat to see that as well. Breakfast at Boon Fly was good, but nothing spectacular. Farm Restaurant I thought had outstanding food. It was a 40 min drive to this place and felt we were worlds away. If I go stay next time, I would select the Fall or Spring. Summer time is quite hot in Napa. It got up to 99 degrees for both days, but the adult pool was refreshing to cool down. They served free strawberry lemonade and a frappacino at the pool which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: Yes it is a different set-up Yes the amenities are spread-out Yes it is expensive However it is located in a beautiful setting in the Carneros Region of Napa Valley, less than an hour from San Francisco and close to some amazing wineries and restaurants. The welcome was professional and warm, the rooms well appointed. The service went above and beyond (we have several special requests that were throughly met). We had one of our best meals EVER at The Farm (I believe they have a new Executive Chef) and without being snobbish have dined at some of the best. I would definitely return and highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: swankmommy
Reviews.Content: We just came back form a wonderful 5 night stay at Carneros Inn. There were three adults and a two year old. We had an Orchard Suite and then a cottage as well. It worked wonderfully for us. In the end we could have all stayed in the suite, but it was nice to have a get-a-way spot in the cottage for adults!!! They staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to do stuff for our daughter. She loved getting rides on the golf carts. She was at Otto's pool every day and had a blast. They have lots of toys for the wee ones. We had a private spa (hot tub) with the suite that the adults used every night before bed. Most of us were sick with colds on the trip so it really helped us relax at the end of the night looking up at the stars. Such a wonderful addition to the suite. The spa was fabulous. They went out their way to accommodate our requests. They even gave me a patch made of essential oils to help with my congestion from the cold. The treatments were heavenly and just what we needed! The products are so yummy. The beds were super comfy with lovely linens an the room was always filled with Frette cozy towels. They had the fridge stocked at all times with bottled water. Turn down service gave you Cocoa Bon mints every night. The bathrooms were filled with Red Flower products in Blood Orange. Mmmmm so nice. The only thing that bugged us were the TVs. They were hard to get working at first and very confusing at the best of times! Not a big deal, but definitely an issue! Make sure you have a chat with Paul up at the Hilltop restaurant. He's such an amazing guy and was so sweet with our daughter. Tell him Bella says "Hi Paul". A wonderful holiday destination. P.S When pulling back out onto highway 121 (going into Napa) make sure you go at least 60. I got pulled over by a State Trooper for going too slow!!!!!!! He told me, "Sundays are for sight seeing M'am". Rude!

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: AFBT
Reviews.Content: WOW! The Carneros Inns website does NOT do justice to the beauty of this property! Their service is outstanding! Everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable and treated us like VIP's! When you first pull in you are greeted by what we thought was a valet but he walked us in, waited and conversed with us until an agent could check us in then after we were checked in he guided us to our bungalow then pointed out all of the amenities and how they worked. All of the rooms are seperate bungalows with no shared walls. It was so peaceful it seemed as if we practically had the property to ourselves; however, there was a large wedding party and most of the rooms were booked. There is a fireplace in your room if you want to sleep by the fire. There is a large plasma t.v. over the fireplace if you need one.?? The back wall is french doors on to a private patio with your own table and chairs with an umbrella. There were a couple lounge chairs for sunbathing and a 10 foot fence all the way around so you can sunbathe in anything (or nothing!) The bathroom has heated slate floors so you don't get cold feet in the morning. There is a large bathtub with a separate shower that has a back door in it so you can step outside and have an outdoor shower! (The outdoor shower can also be accessed from the back yard if you get too hot sunbathing) The property has a vinyard, a wonderful grocery store with a made to order fresh deli, wine, coffee bar, smoothies, gifts, etc. There are several restaurants to choose from. The Farm was far and away our favorite! Very nice menu! A delicious, flounder, melt in your mouth scallops, tender steaks and a huge wine list. The staff at the Farm was the nicest I have ever met. There is indoor or outdoor seating and a more casual area if you want to sit out by the fire. The Boon Fly cafe was great for breakfast. They make mini homemade donuts every morning. Their spa was fantastic! Be sure to get one of the outdoor massages one morning. The weather and the view were so nice. There is a nice clothing shop for men and women. I found Tory Burch half off and a really cute swimsuit. The pool area is very relaxing. They have servers to bring you lunch and frosty adult beverages (if you choose) and the area overlooks the vinyards and where they keep their horses. I highly recommend The Carneros Inn! The ONLY thing I wasn't crazy about was the sheets. Kinda like starched hospital sheets and bring a sleep mask! The whole bungalow is windows. There are shades for privacy but it is really bright in the mornings! If you intend to sleep in past 6:30, bring that sleep mask!! One thing that they do that other hotels should adopt is that everything in the refrigerator is included. Charge me a little more for the room but do not abuse me with $8 bottles of water!!

Reviews.Title: “I Actual Believed the Customer Service People Liked Their Jobs!”
Reviews.Author: may2008LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: from the moment we checked in - it was so perfect. the grounds, the cottage, the food, THE POOL, and the outdoor shower!!! everything has a natural style and easy elegance to it that just puts you at ease. The bed gave me the best sleep I've ever had - we almost didn't want to leave to go visit the wineries. Beyond all of that it was the people running the place that made it fantastic! Everyone went above and beyond with grace and honest enthusiasm to make our stay perfect. I've never been to a place where the people were so nice - I kept waiting for the ball to drop but it didn't. If I could afford it I'd go back once a month.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous high end resort with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LawyerLady438
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 day celebration stay with 4 other adults for my mother's 87th birthday. We stayed in a 2 bedroom cottage that was a luxury home (for about $1600 a night) chocked with every top of the line convenience like Viking appliances, sets of 8 champagne glasses, wine glasses, great knives, pots, dishes coffee grinder, etc. Private jacuzzi on the patio with patio dining and a fabulous BBQ, washer and dryer and all the rest. Nothing but spices were needed for cooking. We had facials ($170 each) at the spa one day, tried out a wonderful gym, went swimming, wine tasting, dining, market on site. My brother is an architect and he thought the clean and modern look was just excellent and knew of their architectural awards. Nothing but the best with the friendliest staff I've ever encountered. Greeted with a complimentary bottle of Tattinger champagne, and a refrigerator with boutiful supply of complimentary bottled water with gorgeous fresh apples on the coffee table. The private patio for dining had an additional fireplace with piped in music from the Bosch stereo system and heating lamps, mood lighting and candles everywhere. Very lovely indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Your Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: MKRWeLuvTrips
Reviews.Content: What a truly unique spot! This place is so special that it is difficult to decribe but i will start by saying it is simply amazing. The property consists of "streets" surrounding the main lobby, pool, spa area. These "streets" are home to rows of little cabins. Your "cabin" is your "room" (only it's far more than a room!). Each cabin has a front porch with rocking chairs and inside features and sofa, working fireplace, lush linens, small desk and a spacious bathroom. Outside you will find a picturesque setting- beautiful patio area with lovely outdoor furniture. The gardens and furnishings make it more like your own backyard than a patio and is spacious enough to entertain 8-10 people. Adorable! Room service delivers your food in a large basket and when you are finished you just set the basket on your front porch and it disappears quickly! On the grounds meander through apple orchards past the fig and pomegranate trees (SO COOL!) and you will find an exceptional pool area overlooking the vineyards. There is also a wonderful gourmet market that carries many upscale, rare items and also serves hot food to go. An incredible place to stay- truly captures all things wonderful about this region! We Will Be Back!!

Reviews.Title: “Country Cottage”
Reviews.Author: mcbr
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort! Our room was small, barely large enough for two. But the beds were incredible...I could hardly drag myself out in the mornings. We had a pretty little deck where we enjoyed our breakfast. Room service was timely but never quite got our order correct. That would be our only criticism. The high light of the accomodation was the bath. The very large room had double basins, a normal sized jacuzzi tub and separate shower. From the shower you could step outside into an enclosed outdoor shower. Lots of fun and unique for the area. We also ate dinner at the Farm Restaurant . The food and service were excellent. I would love to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A three dressed up as a nine”
Reviews.Author: Realitychex
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most over-rated properties we have ever stayed at. A classic example of gross over-promising and under delivering. The check -in experience feels like a luxury property, but the wheels fall off very badly once you see the accomodations. To be fair, we didn't bother staying even a night of our planned 3 day stay. We left after a dinner at the Farm restaurant, and found a delightful place in Sonoma, 10 minutes away. We have stayed at about a half dozen $600++ a night properties over the past year so we're pretty dialed into what one expects at this sort of a price point. Upon arrival, you will drive through what looks like a trailer park on the way up to the Check-in area. If it doesn't remind you of a trailer park, it might remind you of PMQ's on a military base. Look very carefully, because chances are, you will be staying in the guest "cottages" that are crammed into the trailer park - like setting. After talking to locals, we are told, but can't confirm that this area was orginally zoned for mobile homes, thus the reason for the layout. Other locals thought it was going to be low income homes for migrant workers. Either way, the common response from folks around here when mentioning that we'd stayed there was initially a perplexed look, followed by a knowing grin, then a sly smile that said, "sucker"... Views? Are you kidding? Your front door will be looking out towards another 4-6 "cottages" - umm....trailers.... across a slightly landscaped courtyard. The good views (that you are led to believe are lovely on-line) are reserved for the as yet unbuilt "cottages" that they are selling...yep....this isn't a hotel, this is a real estate play. Your little private yard will have a scenic view of the board and batten of the next "cottage" , or if you are lucky, the corrugated tin siding used for screening. The landscaping is well done, but not mature. The interiors are quite nice, but very cramped. The TV / DVD players are not matched, so unless you are handy with these sorts of things, you will most likely be stymied. The internet, both via ethernet and wireless was so slow, it was effectively useless. You will need it if you do what we did and pull the pin and need to find another place on line. Best go up to the check - in area and do your search up there. I've never been in a $600+ a night hotel room, let alone a "cottage" where there is absolutely no space to place your baggage. We had to put ours on the bathroom floors, and the most obvious place to leave the bags was on the exterior patio. There was no room, other than for one bag in the closet. Want a swim? I don't mind a walk, but it's a hike up to the trophy swimming pool, and I'm not going to do it in shoulder season when it's barely 60 / 16c outdoors. It looks great in the brochure, but I suspect the folks in "steerage" won't be using it much. It's probably there as a selling feature for the as yet unbuilt cottages, being sold on a fractional basis. The staff are very pleasant and try hard, but they simply don't have the tools, infrastructure and accomodations to do the job. They quickly agreed to refund the deposits etc for our stay. We got the distinct impression this was not the first time this has happened. As for The Farm restaurant, the food was good, (albeit small portions), and the wine was not chilled to the proper temperature, which was surprising given this is wine country. In short, be very, very careful when booking this property. What you see online is NOT what you will experience when you arrive. After checking in, we had to call the main desk to see if meals were included because there was absolutely no value based upon the nightly price point pushing $700. It is $200 a night property. Nothing more, nothing less. We've read the reviews and they are clearly for a property in an alternate universe, or written by folks with little travel experience and are wowed by the prospects of a little "cottage" with, gosh darned it, heated floors.....or folks trying hard to impress a new girlfriend. Do yourself a favor and look further. Do not assume that because the price point is high that it will be luxurious, gracious and delightful, as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoWeekender
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Carneros Inn for an anniversary/weekend getaway and just fell in love with the place. There's really no way to put into words just how relaxing the Inn actually is. It's casual elegance and spacious grounds are simply fantastic. Breakfasts at the hilltop, overlooking the vineyards and rolling hills, were wonderful, as were our morning workouts and casual strolls around the property. The cottages themselves are awesome--very tastefully decorated with a modern flair and feel that's too often overlooked in upscale hotels these days. The outdoor shower is amazing! My wife and I are a younger(mid-thirtees), active couple, and we found the whole experience to be right up our alley. Its everything we want in a weekend getaway, and not a bad deal considering what you get. As another reviewer noted we heard nothing but great reviews about the Boonfly and FARM restaraunts from the locals we meet, so we decided to eat at both. Like everything else, they were fantastic. Tastes vary on food and wine of course, but we enjoyed our meals and were thrilled with the attentive service and fun atmosphere (which absolutely is the norm there). Overall, the Carneros Inn should not be missed. The whole staff really appears to enjoy working there and that feeling is quickly passed on to the guests. I can't say enough good things about the place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Escape”
Reviews.Author: MattSF76
Reviews.Content: The Carneros Inn is the perfect blend of simple elegance and chic surroundings. Privacy is key as each unit has it own private deck/yard with outdoor shower, patio furniture and heater. The rooms are simple, yet functionally and comfortable with french doors which allow you to open them and make the indoors part of the outdoors. The heated bathroom floor is fantastic as is the huge walk in shower. The resort is spread out, but you can walk from one end to the other in less than 10 minutes. You could go for a weekend, park your car and never have to leave. Between the two pools, the three restaurants, the onsite market, and the beautiful grounds, if relaxing is what you want to do, Carneros is the place to do it. There is also a spectacular spa, but we didn't have a chance to try it. The resort is also centrally located for wine tasting, just down the road from Artesa and other wineries. The views of the surrounding rolling hills are fantastic, especially in the spring when there is green everywhere you look. We will be going back to this resort as often as we can afford to!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great food, wine and what a room!!”
Reviews.Author: ashdown28
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with a restaurant worthy of a Michelin star, the restaurant manager ( Tom ) was very polite and helpful, very chaty without being obtrusive, and the wines he recommended each night with each dish perfect.
