The rooms are very nicely furnished, the patio and outside shower is great, the whole experience was 1 st class, why are more hotels not like this? the Mayor of San Fransisco ( co owner ) should be very proud of his hotel ans staff, i think he made a good investment!!!

Reviews.Title: “California Country at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: SavannahLove2travel
Reviews.Content: I am only writing this to address the negative comments made regarding this hotel. Yes, it is unlike any other hotel that you are likely to visit. All property amenities are not within a stone's throw of each other, but that is what made our stay so delightful! The walk from our cottage to the restaurants was beautiful and refreshing. The landscape is to die for and is what California wine-country is known for. (The hills, the roses and gardens, the farm scenes, etc...) The cottages were romantic and amazingly private. (Which is a good thing becuase there is a an outdoor shower.) It is well worth the price and just remember you come to California and especially the wine region to appreciate the out-doors, this hotel allows and encourages you to do that!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property & service”
Reviews.Author: wife-o-chris
Reviews.Content: This spot had it all, and was amazingly reasonable for the accommodations we had. Very hip spot, really great taste in the decor and the bath products. Both on site restaurants were terrific, and really pleasing to the senses. We would go back in a minute. The staff was really helpful and friendly, but our room was the big draw. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: elana1012
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night... and wished I stayed longer. Great hotel!! So unique! Loved the whole experience. The room was great, was very charming...the beds were so comfy, heated tiles in the bathroom, huge indoor and out door shower! To top it off... there is a fire place... its a great way to end the evening in Napa! The hotel grounds are beautiful.... great gym... The staff was very helpful with giving advice where to go in Napa. The food at the Hilltop breakfast was so fresh, the service was a little slow. In conculsion, this is a great place to stay in Napa and great way to experience the wine country!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Francine R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights and it was too short! The place was wonderful! Every staff member was helpful and the grounds were breathtaking! Our room was an oasis, and we truely enjoyed the private outdoor area. Breakfast at the Hilltop, was one of my favorite places to relax and enjoy the wonderful scenery. We ate dinner at the Farm, and the food and wine, were great. Service though was lacking a little. although, it got better towards the end of the evening. The only negative about The Carneros Inn , is the price and the lack of storage for clothes in the cottage. But everything else is so top notch and perfect, that it compensates for the few negatives. i love this place! We are already planning our next trip this fall, and the Carneros Inn will be our destination!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Loved every minute and can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: JB242
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend just took me here for my birthday and I had the most amazing time. I was very nervous as I had studied the reviews on Trip Advisor and many people said that the hotel was out of the way. The hotel has an awesome location (right in the middle of Sonoma and Napa). The land the hotel is on is gorgeous and it is the most relaxing place. The entire property is new and everything is clean and comfortable. I was shocked that the property was sold out because we rarely saw people walking around but at the restaurants it was clear that there were lots of people staying there. The hotel can be very private if you want (which I loved) but someone looking to be very social might not be so pleased. The staff was so nice and willing and happy to help. Especially Liz at the concierge desk. I highly recommend staying here. There are activities such as wine tastings, yoga, etc... The Spa was clean and fabulous too. The room is on the small side but the bathroom is huge and the fireplace is awesome. Also, the decor of the room is great. The Carneros Inn is incredible. I highly recommend staying there when you are in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Best honeymoon anyone could ask for”
Reviews.Author: BROD77381
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Carneros Inn for our honeymoon from October 15th - 19th and LOVED it. The property itself is so pretty and the cottages are really cute and cozy. Everyone at the property is very attentive and sweet. Our cottage had a fireplace, a heated bathroom tile floor (our favorite feature), an outdoor shower, a heated back patio, etc.... The bed was sooooo comfy. Our favorite night spot was the FARM. We brought our own bottle of wine and sat on the comfy couches by the fire. We can't wait to go back to this place next year!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Leighsah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come to Napa every year and, for the last two trips, we stayed at the Carneros Inn. We enjoy the little private cottages with the outdoor, heated patios, loungers, fireplace, and indoor/outdoor shower to enjoy the beautiful California weather. We booked "the good life" package which included two nights, dinner, massages, and passes to the Vintner's Collective Tasting Room (which I would recommend). Most of the cottages do not have a "view", but you can easily walk to grounds or hang out by the pool if you want to look out over the fields. The workout facility is great with all of the latest equipment, cold towels, etc. It always seems to be empty when I'm there. They offer little walking tours/exercise classes if that is what you are after. It is a little confusing to get around sometimes. Also, there seems to be some variation in the size of the cottages, so don't be afraid to ask for a different one if it doesn't meet your expectations. Our favorite place to eat is the Hilltop Dining Room for breakfast. The Boonfly Cafe was pretty good. I was not super impressed with the Farm. I like the local food idea, but the service needs to be improved. Maybe we were there on a bad night, but with so many great choices for dinner, I'd go elsewhere. Overall, this is a great place to go if you want some peace and solitude and an opportunity to just escape.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: JAMES_LEWIS_2004
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place!! We decided to tack on a 36 hour mini-vacation to the end of my wife's business trip to SF by heading to wine country. Fortunately we landed at Carneros Inn. I had been somewhat concerned about the recent negative reviews of the Inn. Well, don't be the least bit concerned. Ours was the opposite experience. The Carneros Inn is an architectural jewel, cleverly designed to echo a Napa Valley farm yet surprisingly luxurious. Our garden cottage was immaculate and filled with quality sheets, towels, and other fine details. The staff was uniformly cheerful and solicitous of our every desire. I must admit that we maximized our limited time at the Inn --- taking full advantage of a gorgeous fall day to bike to 2 wineries along near- traffic free back roads right near the Inn, swimming twice in the Hilltop pool, my wife's having a body scrub and a massage and I taking a yoga class for something novel, and eating at all 3 restaurants, enjoying each one's smart design and distinctive menu. Yes, this place is expensive, but I cannot think of a better value. Somewhere in the Inn's literature is the statement that "the land inspires." Well, basking in the hilltop pool's hot tub, with a glass of chardonnay in hand, and gazing out across the rolling hills and the autumn-colored vineyards, all bathed in that soft late afternoon light, toward a mountain range etched against a clear sky ---- I totally agree. It does not get any better than this!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort...a few little snags...”
Reviews.Author: MassLady
Reviews.Content: Interesting resort...I think it is supposed to give the appearance of a "working farm" as the buildings and cottages are very farm like (ie tin roofs, very plain and industrial looking outside, etc). Pros: Loved the outdoor shower, and the high thread count sheets, the view from the main pool is spectacular (view looks like the south of France)..the front desk will give you "horse cookies" to feed the very friendly horses on the property, and if you call the front desk, they will give you a ride in a golf cart to the main building as everything is a hike from the cottages. Cons: housekeeping was very bad - every single lampshade was covered with about 3 years of dust, curtains were stained and spotted, desk chair was stained on the seat, there is no permanent off switch for the porch light that shines into the room (even when they explained that we could turn it off, it is on an automatic timer and turned itself back on after an hour), hardwood floors were so filthy that our socks vere black, pillows on the bed are not down but foam (ick), there is no basic storage to stow your suitcase or clothes for that matter as there is one tiny cabinet so plan to not unpack, slippers they give you are made of straw and incredibly uncomfortable and room service food is expensive, not so great and they forget things on your order. There were extra charges on our bill when we checked out but they very nicely removed them without argument. The spa is also very, very expensive - almost too much so even for a splurge (and I live in a BIG city with a lot of spas). This resort is very centrally located and easy to get to all the wineries.....and the area is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: zofingen
Reviews.Content: In our view the hotel does not fit the overall standard it wants to represent and should be in a lower price class. This comes from an international traveller that is used to good quality and service. The cottages are rather cheap manufactured, and do need a better cleaning job. The views out of the cottages are equal to zero. On a positive note: The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: surf555
Reviews.Content: Had an EXCELLENT stay at the Carneros Inn. I would highly recommend this hotel for a nice relaxing and romantic getaway. Service was great, rooms were very modern, food was good, and resort was very quiet. Just had some very minor complaints: water leaked through shower door opening making bathroom floor a mess, heated bathroom floors did not work (minor), and as a previous reviewer mentioned, doesn't look like the beautiful wood floors are mopped daily. Didn't really matter as we brought our slippers and house slippers are also provided. The rooms are very comfortable and have everything you need. Flat screen TV, nice comfortable bed, great linens, apples were left in room, dvd player, and fireplace. I really liked the fact that Internet jacks are provided indoors and outdoors at no charge. I think the best part of the room is the outdoor shower and the heated patio area. Spent a lot of time using both of these! The location in the Carneros region is great. Since it's in the southern area of Napa, it is about 45 minutes to get to the city of S.F. for sightseeing. You can also get to Sonoma, Marin, Novato, Oakland, Vallejo, and Berekely very easily. Yet you are still not very far from all the wineries and restaurants up north. The food at the Farm and Boon Fly is excellent. Didn't try room service. The deli/gift shop is excellent to pick up snacks and drinks. The A-! market/liquor store just off the property is also a great place to pick up drinks and snack items. Overall, my wife and I had a great time. Would highly recommend this property and we hope to return. It's high end camping for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: JDVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this place on the internet and booked it because the other place we wanted was full. Boy are we glad! The online photos and website do not do this resort justice. On top of being top notch luxury while maintaining a quaint, charming feel the service was over the top. The hillside pool service was amazing - you only had to look in the direction of the staff and they were at your beck and call, the Farm restaurant served beautifully prepared meals and the wine choices we wonderful with a very reasonable range of prices. Our room was serviced multiple times through out the day and the staff was always polite, helpful and friendly. They have done a wonderful job with the layout of the "cabins" (initially I was worried that it would be weird - turned out to be wonderful) and the privacy the the back terraces offer is a real treat! The amenities are fantastic and it was in a perfect location for exploring a wide variety of wineries and vineyards. While the prices are on the upper end, you most definately get what you pay for. The Carneros Inn is worth the splurge! We've already booked again for next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Carneros Inn Weekend”
Reviews.Author: trojanking
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an impromptu 3 night stay. We have stayed at several very nice properties in Napa (Meadowwood, Harvest Inn, Sonoma Mission Inn, etc.) and the Carneros Inn compares favorably with the best. When we arrived we were a bit nervous about the layout and facilities; the "cottages" are constructed of rustic looking materials. When inside, however, they are plush and inviting. The "al fresco" shower is a great touch, as is the outside patio with heat lamp. We were fortunate to get a cottage adjacent to pool area and Hilltop Restaurant and Bar. If you are placed in middle of facility, it is quite a hike to the amenities. I would recommend requesting a unit near the FARM restaurant or near the Hilltop Restaurant. We found the service and hospitality well above average, the food good and the facilities extremely well kept. It is obvious, however, that this is a young property and the foliage and trees are not typical of a veteran Napa property. Within 10 years or so, it will be magnificent since they have planted fruit trees, vines and the like throughout. We also got the feeling that there was quite a bit of vacant rooms. They are selling fractional ownerships, and it appears this is slow going. The vacancy made our stay that much quieter and nice. With regards to restaurants, we felt the Boon Fly Cafe was as good as advertised, the FARM overrated. Did not try room service.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Property!”
Reviews.Author: AloftPDXStuart
Reviews.Content: This place has perfected the formula. Terrific service, understated elegance, and an outstanding location team to make a truly memorable experience. All of the amenities without an attitude. Every staff member we encountered was remarkably pleasant and affable. My stay was a terrific indulgance that I will recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: HappyNapa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a quiet, luxurious, romantic place for a short vacation without our boys. We picked The Carneros Inn and were thrilled with our experience. From the moment we contacted them via e-mail and got a return phone call within minutes, virutally every aspect of our stay was outstanding. The rooms were luxurious, the privacy was terrific, the food (especially at the Boon Fly Cafe) was delicious. The workout facilities and the pools were great. And having someone greet you with cold lemon water or frozen grapes is a nice touch. What particularly stood out for us was the quality of the service provided by all employees across the board. They were more than merely courteous; they went out of their way to be helpful on every occasion, big or small. This isn't an inexpensive place to stay, but it feels like a generous place, where every request (expressed or unarticulated) is satisfied. They don't "nickel and dime" you for anything. However, if you are going for the spa facilities, I'd recommend looking elsewhere. The couples massage we had was adequate, not excellent, and quite expensive ($270 total for one hour each) for something that was basic and mediocre. But we had a terrific time and would strongly recommend The Carneros Inn for couples seeking a quiet, romantic base in the Napa area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Oasis”
Reviews.Author: johnnyokim
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended to me by a good friend. He was dead on and the place was fantastic. A bit pricey, yes, but we are talking about a luxury retreat in Napa so not too ridiculous. At first it looked a bit blah of a property as it was pretty basic. Kind of reminded me of camp when i was a kit as the actual cottages look like tin tents from the outside. But the insides were very modern, comfortable, and gorgeous inside. The staff was very polite & helpful. We got a suite, which included 2 cottages, joined by a deck facing vineyards. First of all, looked as if they were just planting an new vineyard outside the room (behind that lot there are rolling hills of vineyards so the view was still great), but once this actually gets planted, I'd imagine it'll be spectacular. Now back to the suite. Not sure if it was necessary to have a seperate cottage for a living room, and not once did we ever even use it or step foot into it. Other than that, the restaurant Farm was great as well. All in all a great experience. Expensive...but still great.

Reviews.Title: “It's hip, it's cool and it's fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Parisawaits
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 1st wedding anniversary and booked through American Express, which offered a packaged deal, making the stiff price tage a bit easier to swallow since it included breakfasts and lunches daily. It's very hip and totally cute. We LOVED the heated bathroom floor! The outdoor shower was great, too. The staff was friendly and helped us with divising a two-day intinirary to maximize our stay and get as much in as possible. Both the Farm and the poolside were great for breakfast and lunch. They have bike you can take anytime-it's on the honor system, so you take them and and bring them back whenever you're done. We travel a lot, but this was the ist time we really did not want the trip to end and came home begrudgingly. The one thing we didn't like was that despite the fact that the Inn knew were there celebrating our anniversary, they never treated us specially- not even a bottle or wine or bubbly. At these prices, you'd think they would do something special for guests who're celebrating a special date.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BevoXV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Carneros Inn during the first weekend in June 2007. The Inn is not going to be for everyone. It definitely has a young, hip feel to it. It is also pretty expensive. We loved it, though. Our cottage was well appointed. It was a tad bit small and didn't have much of a closet. But, the bed and linens were great. The heated floor in the bathroom and the outdoor shower were awesome. Loved the back patio. The service was terrific - everyone was very nice and helpful. We ate at Farm and Boon Fly. Loved both. You have to try the dounts at Boon Fly for breakfast. Farm was the best restaurant we ate at and wasn't as expensive as a lot of others in Napa. We also had a massage at the Spa which we liked a lot. One thing to realize about the Inn is that it's way far south and almost as close to Sonoma as northern Napa (Calistoga, etc.). You defintiely have a long drive to a lot of the wineries further up the valley. We rented a driver/car for our wine tour day - highly recommended. All in all, I highly recommend The Carneros Inn as long as 1) you're ok with a young, hip place that is not anything like Auberge or Calistoga Ranch and 2) you don't mind paying $500/night for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: kiernin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights last week while on our honeymoon. It was absolutely fantastic. We loved our cottage and the private deck. The cottage was wonderfully appointed with features others have mentioned, including flat screen tv, heated tile floor in the bathroom, deep soaking tub. The views are fantastic, especially from the Hill restaurant where we ate breakfast most mornings. The spa was also nice, staff were very professional. We did not eat at the Farm so I can't comment on that. The concierge was also very helpful and seemed knowledgable. It was too cold to sit outside at night and I only wish our deck heater had had a little more oomph. Overall, we loved our time at Carneros Inn and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: WinegirlLa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous 2 night stay at The Carneros Inn. This was our 4th visit to Napa Valley and we have stayed at different hotels/inns each time. The Carneros Inn was by far the best yet and I would highly recommend this resort. We found the staff friendly and helpful, the food was good and the location was fine, particularly if you are spending any time in the Carneros region. I admit that the resort is not inexpensive; but I have yet to find luxury accommodations, food and spas in the Napa Valley that are not expensive!! Overall, I have nothing but POSITIVE things to say and will DEFINITELY return to The Carneros Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat!”
Reviews.Author: mblar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in February these past two years for weekend spa packages. In our opinion, this is as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: rwctraveler
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The separate little cottages were very nice and private. They come with a private back yard and patio with an outdoor heater. I liked not sharing any walls with any othor rooms. The bathroom was nice and big and the heated slate floors were awesome. The soaps they had in the bathroom were very nice. The staff was very nice and helpful. We had room service for breakfast which came in 20 minutes and was great. If you order room service, do not tip, they automatically add an 18% service charge to room service orders. The boonfly cafe was very good, especially the homemade donuts. Farm had great ambience with the outdoor fireplace and nice bar area, but we found our dinner to be so-so. The bed was very comfortable and the large flat screen tv with DVD player allowed us to watch movies comfortably after a great day of wine tasting in the valley. I will definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing place”
Reviews.Author: Karinna
Reviews.Content: We booked throuhg Virtuoso (travel agents) (im a member due to my saks elite 5th ave mastercard) booked a regular cottage room and were upgraded to an amazing vineyard view suite..free breakfast everyday and $50 spa credit...staff is very professional and helpful, lots of contruction going on around entrance but just make sure to get a room close to pool/spa and you will be far away from the noise......amazing view from pool, spa was also very nice, we had massages and pedicures.......the boutique has amazing things and make sure to have breakfast at the Hill top restaurant beautiful view.........dont miss the donuts at Boon Fly Cafe, The Farm is very chic for dinner (bar is great) food was ok.......service took forever on a Monday night?? overall, cant wait to go back.......very very peaceful and relaxing........centrally located to many wineries........dont let the cottage/rustic look fool you, the inside is all luxury! you must have dinner at Bouchon in Yountville, amazing meal!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, relaxing and serene”
Reviews.Author: g8rlover
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Carneros Inn was absolutely fantastic. From check-in to check-out, everything was amazing. Room service rivaled the quality and service of a 5 star restaurant. Boon Fly cafe is great for breakfast or lunch (though, so is room service). Our cottage was serene, large, comfortable and relaxing. The fireplace, flat panel HD tv, (large!) private patios with heaters, enormous bathrooms and heated slate floors all contributed to making the cottage experience top class. At Carneros Inn, you have all the privacy of having rented your own cottage with all the amenities of a hotel and spa. I highly recommend the Carneros Inn and will stay here everything I visit wine country!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful getaway!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2929
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort! It is set up with little "cottages" instead of rooms. It is very private and relaxing. Each cottage has its own front porch with mailbox for daily paper delivery and rocking chairs. The rooms have a sitting area with a plasma TV above a woodburning stove. The bed was SO comfortable! The bathroom was huge with a big shower with four shower heads and a soaking tub. They really like to tell you about the al fresco shower, which I guess is neat, but I personally did not use it. The bathroom also features a double vanity and heated slate floor. The room has two sets of double french doors that can be opened to your own private patio/deck with charis, table and lounge chair. The deck has a heater. The room is a nice, modern design with soothing colors and furniture with clean lines. We only stayed one night and ate at the Boon Fly Cafe, which was pretty good. This was a great resort! The pool looked amazing with a beautiful pool, but we did not have time to use it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Location!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessFilbert
Reviews.Content: My parents gave us a present for our first wedding anniversary--a weekend at the Carneros Inn in Napa. We had read all the reviews before we went and didn't understand the negative comments. My advice is to not book a hotel until you check it out on tripadvisor.com so you know what to expect! Anyway, we arrived about forty-five minutes before check-in and our room was not ready. Everyone was very nice and we waited in the lobby drinking champagne and reading the newspaper. When our room was ready, an attendant on a golf cart escorted our car to our cabin. Inside, he showed us around the cabin and showed us where everything was and how it worked. Within an hour, the hotel was bringing us complimentary wine for our first anniversary. We spent most of the day in our robes on the comfortable bed in front of the fire watching television. That night, we walked to the Boon Fly Cafe for dinner. The place was a lot smaller than it looked from the outside, but the food was good. The next day, we called ahead and my husband walked to the Boon Fly Cafe to pick up breakfast--Boon Fly donuts and yummy fruit. We walked around the grounds that day. Even though it was cold, everything was beautiful and clear. I loved the glass "fire pit" near Farm. We had "cottage dining" for lunch outside underneath the heat lamp. It was expensive (an 18% service charge), but good--ahi tuna salad with butternut squash soup. That night, we went to Farm for dinner. While the decor was beautiful, the food was just average. Since I don't eat meat, my food selection was limited, but I had a wonderful beet salad and homemade fettucine. The next morning, we had more "cottage dining" for breakfast. This time, they set up a table inside. Both times we ordered room sercvice, the food came within twenty minutes and the attendants were very nice. I would definitely recommend this place for a "get away" weekend. We would have liked to get massages, but their spa prices were too high for us. While we didn't pay for our room, I would definitely stay here again, but not pay full price. Is it worth $450 a night? Probably not. But if you have the money to spend, I would definitely recommend it for those looking for some R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the crowd who understand hip and chic”
Reviews.Author: ttangbee
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the previous reviews, I had good understanding of what to expect. In short, the Carneros Inn is an excellent choice if youâ€™re into hip, chic, modern and tranquility. However, if your taste is Victorian 19th century in the heart of the bustling plaza, this place is not for you. Some people complained about this inn being located too far from everything but what is everything? Donâ€™t you come to Napa valley to experience vineyards, good food and wine tasting? Artesa is just around the corner and other popular wineries and restaurants are just a few minutes drive away. No matter where you stay, youâ€™ll need to do some driving if you intend to visit the popular wineries. I think some people have to complain about everything. For me and my family, what we care most about top notch hotels are great service, quiet and attractive rooms, which Carneros inn delivered. We were greeted at check-in with champagne, with very proficient and professional staff. Always smiling and greeting you by your last name. The concierge was exceptionally delightful to speak to and she was always looking to make my wife and my 8 year old son feel comfortable. There is an actual farm and winery across the reception lobby (minus the smell from the animals) with simple but attractive landscaping throughout. Each cottage has modern dÃ©cor without being too cold. Hardwood floors in the bedroom and heated tiles in the bathroom, with indoor 3 headed shower connected to the outdoor shower make this cottage a unique feel. The concept is similar to that of the Sanctuary in Scottsdale except they have a soaking tub outside instead of the outdoor shower. The heated patio deck is spacious but some will find the actual bedroom a little too small. Counter space is abundant but closet space is limited. The mattress is comfortable but the pillows need to be lower in my opinion. You can rent complimentary DVD from the reception and they have a good library. You have to try their new restaurant, the Farm (reviewed separately) and also the Boon Fly CafÃ© (the donuts are delicious). All in all, it was a very pleasant stay and it would have been perfect if the pillows were more comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to all my chic loving friends and would come back the next time we visit the area.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: CatPaw7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 4th trip to the Carneros Inn, and again, find it one of our favorite places to stay in the world. If you are looking for a private, relaxing, comfortable setting in a contemporary cottage setting with agrarian views- this is for you. If you are looking for a lively atmosphere with ample fraternizing with our wine country guests close to town- this is not. The concierge is top notch, and has repeatedly made fantastic suggestions and planned and booked our entire stay. We have never been disappointed with any of their suggestions. It is private and off the path of the other inns, but there is not a view that can compete with the veranda overlooking the vineyards beyond the hilltop pool. A good choice if you are looking to spend your days touring and tasting and your evenings in front of a cozy fire eating room service. The service and staff can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places for the cost...”
Reviews.Author: napafiend
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - this is a lovely hotel. However, the bungalow feel reminded me of the Cottages of Napa Valley, which are far less expensive. Only difference is, that property didn't have an onsite restaurant. Crew was very helpful. Restaurant wasn't open to the general public yet, which was nice. Pool was okay. They weren't finished with construction, so there was a great deal of "stuff" going on around us, which probably ruined the experience a bit. I don't think I will be going back. Just not really what I wanted...

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Concept for the Few Who Get It”
Reviews.Author: IndianSummer67
Reviews.Content: The weather was beautiful, the cottages with their porches were creatively designed. These luxury "shacks" will absolutely thrill some of your readers and appall others. It is really a question of taste. The Auberge du Soleil crowd may not like the rustic ambience. You need to ask yourself what kind of resort you like. Spa and peace and quiet? Yes. Golf? No. IKEA and W Hotel styling in the middle of the country? Yes. Baroque French draperies or Victorian hangings, the 4 Seasons? No. Casual luxe? Yes. Snob appeal? No. Although construction was going on in front, it didn't affect us. The staff was polite and although the place was busy, we didn't have to interact much with anyone if we didn't wish to. There's always the bar and restaurants which are hopping, though, if you want more action! The area is still agricultural with cows and horses around, though this will change with more building. Enjoy it now and please drive carefully on those little roads through the Napa Valley and don't drink and drive so all of us can live to enjoy another summer or autumn in the wine country. Note: (I talked to the manager about not enough hot water for baths/showers so we'll see what happens next time.)

Reviews.Title: “Napa Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Karenbob
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at Carneros. Before we arrived we contacted the concierge and told them what we wanted to do. They had everything set up on a schedule and even mapped out for us in our itinerary that they gave us when we checked in. There was even a bottle of champagne from the neigboring winery chilling in our room for a birthday celebration. The room itself was nice and cozy. The beds are heaven. There's a fireplace, bar w/ stocked mini-fridge and even fresh apples from the orchard that surrounds you. The patio is private w/ plenty of seating and even a heater if you need it. The bathroom is nice w/ a spacious shower w/ lots of shower heads. You can even open a door and shower outside in private if you prefer. The toiletries from Redflower smell so fresh. We even had robes. The property is big but you rarely see or hear anyone. You think you are the only ones there. We dined at the Hilltop around the pool area one nite. The food was excellent. We also had room service for breakfast and it was there fast and hot. It's fun the way they deliver everything in a basket. I just can't say enough about the place. The spa is great ! My husband had a wonderful massage before we left. Everyone we dealt w/ was pleasant and very accomodating. We cannot wait to go back. It was a very peacful place to wind up a long day on the wine trail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Van12
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that provides unique luxury with a down to earth feel this is the pefect place. We picked carneros mainly because of the individual cabins, the private backyard space, and the modern gagets like heated bathroom tiles, glass enclosed shower with an alfresco option, and the flat screen T.V. We are tired of the same old thing and carneros was something different. We really enjoyed ourselves. Situated on top of a hill overlooking the valley, the grounds are quiet and beautiful. Every cabin has its own porch to enjoy the views and a sizeable private backyard. The backyard has a patio set and heaters so you can enjoy it at all times. We really enjoyed eating breakfast there. The cabins themselves we thought were beautiful. Loved the size, decor, and of course the bathroom! It really felt private. Also, like the other reviews mentioned ask for a cabin with a side entrance...a much better layout. We really enjoyed our dinner at the Hilltop restaurant. They surprised us sparkling wine to celebrate our anniversary. The duck was amazing and sitting outside with a view of the city lights was breathtaking. And the pool was amazing as well. Right now they are finishing up construction of new facilities at the front entrance. This will include yet another pool! The construction didn't bother us since it was only in the front, away from the accomodations. Overall it was a great experience and we will go back. Note: When I was reading the reviews on this place I was incredibly confused because of all the mixed reviews. What I have learned in the past from reading reviews of high-end hotels is that they attract more mixed reviews because those who can afford these hotels tend to be more critical. They expect the best. You should expect more when you pay more but I feel sometimes the demands tend to be excessive. I feel the carneros inn delievered everything we hoped for the amount of money we paid. If you want perfect than you have to pay for perfect and should seek out a place like the Auberge De Soleil which is tremendously more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Simple elegance”
Reviews.Author: HeartlandTravelers
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! My husband and I just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Carneros Inn. The individual cottages are clean, comfortable, and homey- not fstuffy and formal. The bathroom is very large with heated tile floors. Spacious outdoor patio with heater. The bedding was so comfortable- soft sheets, down comforter, and great mattress- the best sleep ever, especially with the cool fresh air coming through the windows. The outdoor shower overlooking the vineyard was heaven. We used it everyday and sometimes twice just for fun! Food was great. Concierge very helpful with winery suggestions and fun to dos. The staff was friendly and accomodating without being annoyingly attentive like at other fine hotels. Highly recommend. Wasn't able to enjoy the spa because it was booked up- kindof a bummer. Location was great- very serene and private setting yet close (20-30 minutes) to Napa and St. Helena. There was major construction going on, but it was in the front and we heard nothing! Weather was perfect- warm sunny days and cool nights. We rented a convertible for our daily trips to the wine country. The only drawback we found was that there isn't a great walking/running path on the property. The grounds are large and luscious, but not conducive to a walk/run. The bedroom is small with limited space for clothes so we lived out of our suitcases. Overall fantastic trip and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: tweets1
Reviews.Content: We found the Carneros Inn perfect for our trip to Wine Country. Although the hotel is undergoing construction, it's all taking place at the entrance to the property and few, if any, of the cottages are nearby. Our cottage was well removed from the construction and we never heard a thing (it's incredibly quiet there otherwise as well). I don't understand reviewers who complained about the cottages being "trailers." Yes, they are designed to look like farm cottages, but they are adorable. And, once you step inside, they are like any beautiful urban hotel you might have stayed in. Gorgeous linens, flat screen tvs, wood-burning fireplace and separate tub and shower with great bath products. My favorite part was the heated slate floor in the bathroom - wish I could bring that one home! The deck and outdoor shower were both wonderful treats - they even had an outdoor heater for when the temperature lowered at night. The cottages felt like a private home yet still offered the amenities of a larger property (restaurant, spa, pool, concierge, etc.) The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. The views of the mountains and vineyards from the pool area and restaurant were stunning. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “You will have to be dragged away.”
Reviews.Author: ReedC
Reviews.Content: It's almost sad this is in such a good wine region, because you'll probably be tempted to forgo the wineries and just stay in your room (cabin). Simply put, this place was done right. No expense was spared. No shortcuts were taken. The bed was coma-inducing. The heated tile floors were, well, heated. The Mojitos at the hilltop bar were the best I've ever had. The room service food was very unlike room service food. The staff seemed to be happy we were there. Best of all, when they say private, they mean private. No one bothers you, and the design makes it such that no one can see into your room, or for that matter, onto your own back yard and patio. Your cabin is your fortress here. I miss you, Carneros Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ashbudd
Reviews.Content: My party of four just returned from a two-night stay in two "Garden" Cottages at the Carneros Inn, and had a wonderful experience. The construction about which several reviewers have complained is only at the driveway to the resort--not visible from the lobby, the cabins, or anyplace you spend time. (Eventually, it will result in greatly expanded facilities, including a larger gym and, apparently, stores.) There was no construction noise. The lobby and "Hilltop" grounds are gorgeous, styled after a winery/farmhouse with clean, conteporary accents. The pool has a stunning view of the surrounding hillsides, and--even in 100-degree summer heat--provides an idyllic place to spend an afternoon. The cabins are gorgeous inside, and are not mobile "trailers" at all but small, self-contained little cabins with fireplaces, four-nozzle indoor showers, plus outdoor showers and private patios (perfect for light dinners and wine-drinking). The heated bathroom floors are particularly nice in the mornings. By all means, take advantage of both this resort and--in particular--the spectacular concierge staff, who not only got us reservations at the French Laundry (though they say they have no special influence/ability to do so, they nevertheless succeeded) but went to a party store to put fun "Happy Graduation" decorations in my recently-graduated-from-college friend's room. They went above and beyond. A note on booking: Their availability, in my experience, is not accurately represented on their website. Call before you lose hope of renting the kind of room you want.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Bliss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved the Inn's "Soak Up the Sun" package the day before 4th of July, which included a one night stay in any Cottage or Suite, two 1-hour massages, and full breakfast at either of their restaurants. The package cost was $730, which included tax and gratuity. Pricey for a one night stay, but well worth it. When we first arrived it was a bit confusing due to the construction in front and the small signs directing us to the reception area. But the staff were very friendly pointing us in the right direction. The customer service was excellent. Very friendly, accommodating and efficient. We were assigned the Gunter 1 cottage, which was the closest cottage near the main entry and construction. Although we had no problems with noise, I would request next time a cottage near the pool. The king bed was spacious and comfortable, the soaking tube and separate shower with a linking door to the outdoor shower luxurious (heated floor tiles in the bathroom was my favorite), and the flat screen t.v. above the fireplace was the icing on the cake. The turndown service was a pleasant surprise. They not only placed mints and their signature satchet on the bed, they also cleaned-up our room. My only recommended additions would to include extended/paid cable channels (only basic cable was available) and a room safe. The spa facilities were adequate (the space was small) and the staff were professional and friendly. My massage was given by Magnolia, who had magical hands. It is strongly recommended to book a time at the Spa during your reservations due to high demand. All in all, I would come back after construction is complete (the reception mentioned that it should be completed by March 2007) and stay more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place”
Reviews.Author: Lorna148
Reviews.Content: For anyone who doesn't like the Carneros Inn, then you won't like anything at all. This is a wonderful place. I won't repeat all the ameinities that people have alluded to, but I can guarantee that you will love the experience. As for the folks bashing the "hot walk" to the pool...here's a suggestion, wear flip flops...

Reviews.Title: “Mostly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: frtsam2la
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carneros Inn for two nights and generally enjoyed our stay. Like everyone else, we were quickly enthralled by and addicted to the outdoor shower, and we also loved the heated bathroom floor. We had problems with the TV, although it is a beautiful flat screen, and had to call them more than once for assistance. The service was ok, not as wonderful as a Four Seasons by any stretch of the imagination. We booked a package deal that included an amenity and a massage. I had to call for the amenity gift which was not waiting in the room. Little things but little things add up when you are paying for an expensive room. As part of our package we had a fairly large bedroom with a full bath, an outdoor patio that enjoined another room (also ours) and two outdoor showers. The second room was like a sitting room/living room and although lovely and well appointed we never used it and not sure when we would have as it was just the 2 of us. Breakfast there was just ok, although others have raved about it. The omelet special was the same each day we were there. The pool was divine and the spa treatment was very nice. The bar was lovely although we didn't really use it except at breakfast. The construction is off-putting and when its done the place is going to be huge by the looks of it. I would stay there again, but not necessarily with the same package as we felt the second room was wasted on us.

Reviews.Title: “Can we take the shower home?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a quick getaway. We've spent a lot of time in Napa and know the wineries well -- we just wanted an opportunity to stay someplace unique, private and luxurious. We were not disappointed. From the outset we were pleased. We called Carneros on a Saturday and were hoping for a one-night stay (contrary to the two-day stay minimum). Given it was Saturday, noon, they were quite willing to accomodate us. We drove up to Napa and spent the afternoon on the Silverado Trail, finally making our way over to Carneros around 5:00 p.m. We were initially a little put-off by the construction (where do we go? is this really it?), but once we negotiated the road to the top of the hill and made it to reception, we were very pleased. The property has a terrific view of the southern end of Napa Valley and the surrounding hills. It is very picturesque (aside from the neighboring farm and yard-junk). From the pool area, you have a gorgeous view nicely complimented by cocktails. The rooms were terrific. Really quite stunning. We had one of the smaller rooms, but combined with the outdoor patio it was spacious. We loved the indoor/outdoor living. The bed was terrific and we were able to plug our iPod into the stereo and enjoy our own music both from bed and the patio. We didn't bother with dinner on the property and brought in some great cheese, bread and salads from Dean & Deluca in the valley along with a bottle of wine we bought at V. Sattui. This was really enjoyable to eat on our private patio with the stereo blaring. Great food, good wine on our own private patio. Perfect. But it was the outdoor shower that really sold us on the place. The indoor shower has a door to the outside that allows you to open it and create an indoor/outdoor wet room with a rain shower head on the outside and multiple jets on the inside. We spent a lot of time enjoying both -- feeling only a little guilty about abusing the property's water supply. The service was very casual. If you're looking for super-attentive service, this isn't it. The service is what I like to call casual luxury -- they'll take care of anything you might need, but it won't feel like they're everywhere waiting on your every need. For two Californian's, this was perfect. Our only regret was not taking advantage of the concierge to get us reservations at the French Laundry -- next time!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: PA2CVA
Reviews.Content: The Carneros Inn is like no place else. You will love it, and probably won't want to go home. It's very peaceful. Enjoy every minute of it. The pool was beautiful and sitting in the hot tub looking at the views was absoultely amazing. If you want a massage, have them come to your cottage, and they will do it outside on the patio. That was great. Perhaps the best part of the Carneros Inn was the outdoor shower. The only part about the Carnero Inn (and it wasn't their fault) is that there were a fair about of young and unsupervised children playing near the pool. The parents were eating dinner, and could see their children. However, a resort like this is hardly the place for children. Parents, leave them behind.

Reviews.Title: “A Different Experience”
Reviews.Author: newsguy
Reviews.Content: From what I gather by reading prior reviews of the Carneros Inn, folks either love it or hate it. It's either a modern marvel or a gravel-pathed trailer park. You really ought to take a look at pictures of the place before you book here... because it IS one of the most unique places I've had the pleasure of staying at. Here are some random observations from our stay (two nights), in no particular order of significance: 1. It is a considerable distance away from the heart of Napa Valley. We didn't find it inconvenient, but folks who want to be right in the thick of it all would be better off booking in Yountville or St. Helena. We actually enjoyed the relative seclusion... especially since we were in the valley over a weekend. It has more of a 'resort-unto-itself' type of a feel. 2. The construction at the entrance is still going on, and while a sign out front says that the project will be complete in 'Summer 2006', it certainly appears that there will be work going on well after that. This was not a problem for us, though - it seemed like crews had the weekend off. On Monday morning, the day we left, we woke up to sounds of a construction truck backing up, and there were workers all over the place. We were in the 'Knittel' cottages near the center of the property. 3. The rooms are gorgeous. The outdoor space is gorgeous, too - our cottage had a deck with 2 chaise lounges and a 5 piece outdoor dining set. The heated bathroom floors were really neat. The 3-head indoor shower looked great - but I never used it. I fell in love with the al fresco shower, which is attached. I was in that thing every chance I got. The shampoo/soap/bath products were wonderful as well. My only knock on the rooms: storage space. It was great to have two leather chairs and a sitting area, but there was no way to use them - there was nowhere else to put our bags. It seems like a major oversight to me that in such a great space, there is such little... space. There was a note in the room from the general manager, apologizing for the construction. Part of the project, according to that note, is to 'improve the functionality of our current cottages'. I can only hope that he's talking about the storage situation. 4. Our experience with housekeeping service was pretty spotty. Details such as a fresh bag of coffee were not seen to. There was water on the floor - from a recent mopping, I presume - when we returned to our room. Turndown, on the other hand, was excellent. 5. I had the best massage of my life at the Spa. The therapist's name was Christina. 6. The pool and jacuzzi area are magnificent. Open 24 hours. Jacuzzi + 1/2 bottle of champagne + full moon = a night I'll never forget. And there are a number of horses that live right next door. Very cool to see them grazing and running around while taking a dip in the 'edgeless' pool. 7. Breakfast at the Boon Fly Cafe is not to be missed. If you can roll out of bed and go down there, it's worth it - there are more interesting items on the menu than on the room service menu. The room service food comes from BFC's kitchen. All in all, would I stay here again? I think I would. It's pretty expensive, but it doesn't seem to be too out of line for the area, in terms of getting what you pay for. It was a splurge trip for us, and the Carneros Inn helped make it very memorable. In that sense, it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “My #1 hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at!! My boyfriend surprised me this weekend and swept me away to The Carneros Inn in Napa. I was so shocked, they have really thought of everything and more at this hotel. Our cottage had a King bed with Italian linens, fireplace with a flat screen tv above it, comfy chair and ottoman, and beautiful french doors that open up to .....your own backyard!!! The backyard had a patio table and chairs with a heat lamp and a lounge chair for sun bathing. The bathroom had heated floors, soaking tub, huge shower and ....wait for it....a connecting outside shower with a rainfall shower head!!!! The outsite shower was completely private and because of it we didn't even bother using the regular shower. The grounds are beautiful and peaceful, you can't really hear your neighbors much. The main lobby is a short 5 minute walk and has a restaurant, spa and beautiful pool area. The hotel is located about a 10 minute drive from Napa and about a 15 minute drive from my favorite winery V.Sattui. If you stay in this hotel you will agree with me that it is the best hotel you have ever stayed at. It is the perfect hotel to get away from all the hussle and bussle of regular life at!

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hotelgirl111
Reviews.Content: Carneros Inn is amazing! People who don't like the style shouldn't stay in the Carneros region. The Inn has done an incredible job building a luxury inn in a style that doesn't compete with the natural modesty of this area of the Napa Valley. The beds and linens are heavenly - my favorite thing about the inn! The outdoor showers are truly wonderful way to start the day - ours had a little window that looked out over the vinyards. The staff is attentive and the views from the porches are just magnificent. I love the infinity jacuzzi up by the main house too. It was our 2nd stay, and the concierge left a bottle of wine in our room to welcome us back. The whole experience was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Impressions”
Reviews.Author: Tricie
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Inn. I wanted a location between Napa and Sonoma valleys, and this worked, but dinner in St. Helena was too far, with a CHP sobriety check on the way home, no less. My husband thought the cottage garden room too small, with only a couple of feet at the end of the bed to walk around. Other room ammenities were nice--flat screen tv, heated bathroom floor, indoor/outdoor shower, and private heated patio area. Didn't eat at the restaurant or BoonFly Cafe, but breakfast room service was not impressive. Mediorcre pastry assortment. Staff was pleasant. After we returned home, I realized I had left a small bag behind, and Housekeeping was kind enough to immediately send it to me without charge. Bottom line--nice enough place, but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “What a relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara48
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful three day stay at the Caneros Inn. The staff could not do enough for us including a reservation at the French Laundry. Although the weather was not great the little cottages were a welcome retreat from the cold rain. the cottages had fireplaces with little bags of wood which are easy to use and replenished twice a day. The heated bathroom floors were a special treat and the back deck with the heaters would be great at a different time. We loved the food at the Boon Fly Cafe which is casual. The only problem was the lack of a real fitness center. They used a cottage but it only had four pieces of equipment. They are doing a large construction project which will include a larger space but when we complained they sent us passes to a gym in Napa. Not quite the same but a nice gesture. The construction project is huge but it did not seem to bother us since we were there on the weekend. Most of it is at the front of the property and does not impact the resort except visually as you arrive. I would love to return and enjoy that back porch with a nice bottle of cab!

Reviews.Title: “Calm in the Valley”
Reviews.Author: suzabanana
Reviews.Content: I was very surprized to see all the negative reviews of the Carneros Inn, because we want to live there! My husband & I spent a weekend in early March & could not have had a better experience. Fortunately we made travel arrangements through Diner's Club points and the stay & spa treatments were free, so I cannot comment on value. I recognize that the rack rate price point is very high, but with some online comparison, it seems that you can easily get half off that rate, for which it seems reasonable to me. The cottage was beautifully appointed (I love modern, clean lines - the whole look) & extremely comfortable. I could have slept in that bed for days! The linens luxurious, the furnishings tastful & the mattress like a cloud. I am also a bathroom fanatic & this one won major points. The heated slate floor was just divine, the tub made for a great bath (post-Bouchon & stuffed to the gills!) & the indoor/outdoor shower reminded me of our honeymoon in Fiji (minus the lizards!). The fireplace was the icing on the cake as it flickered while we were snuggled in bed. On the rest of the property we had no evidence of construction, so we may have come in an inbetween projects time for them. We enjoyed walking around the property in plush robes, whispering hellos to other similarly-dressed guests enjoying the quiet & fresh air. The pool was warm & relaxing; and the hot-tub perfect as the sun went down! The Spa was just perfect for me. Just the right combination of luxury & pampering mixed with wellness & nature. I enjoyed a Goat Butter massage, which is from Napa & is very moisturizing. The steam room was my favorite! Usually they are gross, smelly breeding grounds for bacteria - not at the Carneros! Very clean, not scorchingly hot & with a bucket of fresh herbs to release their delicious oils into the air. All in all we had a fabulous time & are contemplating purchasing one of the residences that they are constructing that everyone is complaining about! It was wonderful & I can't wait to go back & decompress.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend at Carneros”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start...I was surprising my wife with a trip to Napa for her birthday and our 5 yr anniversary. After looking at several properties, I decided on The Carneros Inn. After speaking with the concierge, Siobhan (sho-bahn), I knew I had made the right decision. She is very knowledgeable about the area and made some fantastic reservations for dinner and wine tastings. She did mention that there was some construction, but it stops on the wknds. We arrived on Fri 11/11 in the afternoon and we did notice the apparent expansion. You will find some of the roads are gravel, however if you can look past this, it is like getting through the desert to find an oasis! Upon checking in, we were delighted to find out that Cadillac was offering the free use of their new SRX Suv for the entire day. The valet was nice enough to drop the Suv to our room and showed us the amenities in the room. When my wife walked into the cottage, I knew I had picked the right place...she was smiling from ear to ear! The cottage is the ultimate in high technology meets California rustic chic! From the plasma TV and DVD player, thermostat controlled heated bathroom floors, indoor/ outdoor showers, to the outdoor patio with overhead heater. The list goes on and on!! Awaiting our arrival was a nice package from Siobhan detailing our reservations/points of interests and maps. We spent Fri checking out some local wineries and grabbed some dinner at Rutherford Grill. On returning to our room, there was chilled champagne! WOW!! Saturday, we had breakfast at the Hilltop dining room and enjoyed the extraordinary view of the mountains, the changing colors of the vines and the steam rising from the heated pool. The heated pool and Jacuzzi were open on the wknd. Siobhan had made reservations at a winery named Del Dotto (which was a romantic dream) and also checked out another recommended winery; Regusci - awesome winery! We had reservations Auberge du Soleil which started at 4:30 watching the spectacular sunset and eating dinner on the balcony! Sunday, I checked out the outdoor shower...nothing like being able to look up and see the sky--priceless! Had tea on our private patio and also started off the morning with the most relaxing therapeutic massages. We then had lunch at Hilltop again, outside this time. By the time we knew it, it was time to leave our hideaway cottage. Although, we never had a chance to met Siobhan in person, we cannot thank her enough along with the attentive, most accommodating staff at Carneros; it made for one of the most amazing, romantic weekends we have ever had. Contact Siobhan and tell her Van sent you...you will not be disappointed! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay in the beautiful Napa Valley during harvest season was outstanding except for my accomodations. The Carneros Inn, while in an absolutely picturesque location, leaves a lot to be desired at this point in time. There is a lot of construction going on which is slated to continue through most of 2006. It is very obtrusive as one must drive through a construction zone to get to the property and walk through a construction zone to get to dinner at one of the restaurants. The service is mediocre, at best and very tardy. My cottage, while very well appointed, was not as clean as one would expect for having paid nearly $500/night. For example, the glass shower was opaque with water stains and soap scum which the property exclaimed was due to the hard water in the valley. Overall, I was very disappointed with what I got for the price that I paid. I may return, someday, but only well after the construction/renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: livlarge
Reviews.Content: I can understand differences in opinion as it is all subjective, but my goodness, the Carneros Inn is spectacular. The rooms are fabulous with a very simple clean line and the surrounding area is what wine country is all about, surrounded by the mountains, vineyards and agriculture...Needless to say they are still doing construction, but once past the entrance, unless you dwell on it, it is easily overlooked...the opportunity to sleep with a fire going and doors open where you can smell the fresh air and hear owls while you drift off to sleep, well, it was just heaven. The staff although in some cases quite young, were attentive, friendly and accomodating. Our last evening we ordered room service and watched a DVD from their library, by the time I put the basket out after finishing, they picked it up before I could unpause the DVD, p.s. the food was delivered within 20 min and was hot and delicious. I can not say enough about the Spa...small and nurturing with attention to personal detail. It was not ornate or super plush, but I have not ever felt so relaxed and pampered in a spa (and I am a spa girl), both my services were longer than promised and there was no feeling of being a number and having to move it along. If you are looking for an ornate lobby, loud bar, snotty concierge and no fresh air, no this is not your place, if you are looking for a homey and private atmosphere with elegant and sophisticated touches to come home to after a day of wine tasting or ballooning, where you can walk up to a lovely restaurant and put the car keys away..you can stop searching. Don't miss the moon rise from the hot tub!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what some of these people were thinking when they gave their reviews but we had an incredible time at the Carneros Inn. My wife and I just celebrated our 20th anniversary there this past week for 5 days and had such a good time. First off, it is an interesting looking resort but, that's part of it's charm. The rooms were incredibly comfortable and luxurious with the heated floors in the bathroom, plasma tv's, comfortable bed, fireplace, and best of all alfrescco shower. I took an outside shower in the cool air every morning. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning visiting both the Hilltop and Boonfly cafe and both were beyond excellent. The food was outstanding. Both my wife and I had massages at the spa and I for one had one of the best I have ever had. My wife and I have stayed at some of the nicest hotels around the country and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Upon arriving at the hotel, they offered to upgrade us to a family suite because of our anniversary but we declined as we really weren't going to use the extra space. They did send us a bottle of sparkling wine which was very appreciated. A couple of days before our trip I had worked with Christy at the concierge who was very helpful and went out of her way to make sure we got reservations wherever we wanted them. If you are looking for a generic hotel with no real ambiance this is not the place. If you want out of the box luxury and a pampered touch you need to try The Carneros Inn. I would come back here anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Areas to improve, given the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my wife. Nice interior fitting; real fire place, heated slate floor in bath room. Over all landscaping to be improved, and too much construction is going on for the new phase. Construction begin at 8:00 in the morning, when my wife & I tried to sleep in duirng our getaway. (Given the construction, request for room that is far from the worksite) Service is OK, an impression that the overall staff is friendly but new to the Inn. House-keeping is not taking attention to details. (house-keeping staff has tidy-up our room, but "carelessly" left our sleepwear on a rather dirty suitcase after all the travel. On the day we check-out, house-keeping came to our room at around 10 given check-out time at noon. Felt like being pushed to leave) Given the price, we expect better attention to details Competent staff on concierge. They were able to reserve a table for me, hassle-free, at the French Laundry given I'm at the other side of the world (Hong Kong). p.s. the ranch style is a highly subjective preference, you either found it hip or concern it's like a converted trailer park

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool! Some missed opportunities....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I went to Napa for my birthday. After much research for wineries, restaurants and hotels--I decided on the Carneros Inn. I wanted a boutique hotel experience with Spa amenities--this seemed good. I was a little leary of the newness factor, but I also liked the newness factor. I made reservations on-line, when I called back with a Priceline deal-- they were very accomodating in adjusting the rate. We drove and it was a hard place to find. The concierge directed us to enter the property from the back--there were no signs and lots of construction. The arrival experience was disappointing. Once inside the property, the rooms are delightful-- unique architecture and streamlined decor (with plasma TVs), although the cottage was narrow and hard to manuever in, especially with 2 Double beds. There were also no mirrors in the room, except the bathroom-- it was hard for all of us to get ready. The outdoor fireplaces near the lobby were great--very cozy and crackling! Regarding the SPA, the website is confusing and the reps were unclear about treatment schedules and locations and mixed up the treatments that were booked by me and my sisters. I was excited about the Garden Scrub --grape seeds, fruit pulp and other ingredients, but it was a lackluster experience and I found it disappointing for a 4-star Spa. Sadly, our original lunch plans at well-known Buchon were cancelled due to a fire. The hotel concierge were not helpful in arranging other plans. I wish I had spent more time at the pool-- it was fantastic! An amazing infinity pool overlooking the vineyards--very beautiful and tranquil. The white adirondack chairs were pure solace on the hillside. The server brought wines poolside--it was fabulous, truly a dreamy experience. The restaurant overlooking the pool served a nice breakfast. That was my only restaurant meal on property. Mustards restaurant was amazing!--worth the wait! Despite the glitches, I would try Carneros again--these issues could get resolved as they get more experienced and established.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: UpgradeQueen
Reviews.Content: I'm at the Carneros right now, as I write this, and just read some of the reviews. I think they're all accurate. I love this place, but it's definitely not for everyone. If you want that woodsy, European, old-world style atmosphere, go elsewhere. This place is contemporary and high-tech. There are lovely grasses instead of colorful flowers, gravel pathways instead of concrete, gorgeous Brazilian wood floors instead of carpeting or tile, and corrugated metal patio walls instead of stone or brick. The rooms are beautiful and luxurious, very comfy beds. It's true, not a lot of storage. Just two drawers at the foot of the bed, plus a closet. Big bathroom, separate tub and indoor/outdoor shower. The individual cottages are grouped together around little courtyards, and each has a private patio and a little front deck with rocking chairs. I'm here with a group of 5 rooms, so I saw all of them. The rooms are pretty much the same, but the backyards vary greatly - some much larger than others, some have views. In DiRosa section, the 9/10 suite and #1 has a view, #8 sits on the parking small parking area, but has the largest yard. Service here seems fine so far, they've been very responsive. Haven't tried the dining room yet, but I hear it's great. I just wish the sun would come out!! We selected this place over Meadowood, which is a zoo in my opinion, and over the new Auberge in Calistoga. Nothing wrong with that place, but kind of woodsy and dark, and I wanted vineyard views for my east coast guests. One important thing: because of the construction going on here, they are offering very discounted rates. We're paying half what we would have paid at Meadowood or Auberge. But I would only stay here in rooms at the top of the hill. The ones down below do look like trailers, and are too close to the road, at any price. If your taste runs toward the New York metropolitan loft style, you'll love it. If you're looking for Tuscany, go to Auberge (and pay for it). Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The prior posts are generally correct about the unusual layout of the property. But don't be fooled by the little huts -- they are hardly military style housing. Ours was luxurious, with a comfortable bed, big bathrooms, a wonderful private patio that included a heat lamp for cool mornings / evenings, a refreshing outdoor shower, and an indoor fireplace. I can understand why the other posts wanted the little shampoos and soap bottles replaced daily -- I didn't understand why our suitcase was so heavy until I saw all the 'blood orange body wash' containers my wife theived away. The pool area is very nice, with a great view of the vineyards. I never saw the spa, so no comment there. There were a few drawbacks, I suppose, including the previously noted limited storage space in the room. And we did hear some construction noise on the day we arrived but didn't hear it again for the rest of our stay. Even with those minor complaints, this is an excellent hotel in a great location, one I will return to as soon as my bank account and my wine-soaked liver recover. It is a unique place, so it is hard to compare to more traditional hotels, but we can think of only a few we have been to that we liked so much. The Ritz-Carlton Naples and the Phonoecian maybe, but that is about it.

Reviews.Title: “It grows on you”
Reviews.Author: LOGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I entertained 30 clients last week at the Carneros. While I had deep concerns about the property driving in, the surroundings eventually grew on me. Our "shanty" was a two room suite. The bedroom area was well appointed. Bed was great. Large bathroom with nice ammenities. Private courtyard with nice patio furniture. View of the vineyard over tall fence. The pool area is pretty. Very adult oriented. I would not take children to this Inn. The spa is VERY small. Make appointments well in advance. I had a facial and massage and both were OK. The facilities are sparse. No hot tub- not a place to lazily spend an afternoon. I had my treatment and returned to my room to shower. Room service from the Boon Fly Cafe was average. Delivered in a big wicker basket, the presentation was the best part. Dinner at the hilltop restaurant was good, not great. construction noise during the day... Overall The Carneros is charming in a weird way. I enjoyed it, but won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience! Accommodations, pool, spa, restaurant - all superior. Just take a lot of money! A few nitpicks - very limited closet/storage in the cottage, bath amenities not replenished (admittedly, we hadn't exhausted them, but at those prices we wanted them!), shower less than it's touted to be. Get the donuts for breakfast - yummy! Restaurant turned out to be best we visited in the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Carneros”
Reviews.Author: lcoopwood
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for two nights and I was a little nervous to go there based on the reviews, but I have to say that it was beyond my expectations. I was a little scared when we drove up with the construction happening right next door, but we were not bothered at all. Each of the cottages have their own "backyard" which is totally private for taking a shower in their indoor outdoor shower. The grounds are beautiful (especially if you realize that this isn't supposed to look like the Villagio). The service was impeccible and I loved walking on the gravel paths. Our room had the most comfortable bed, plasma tv, two leather chairs, heated bathroom floor, indoor/outdoor shower. There is also a heater out on the back patio (which was fun to use even in the summer). We also had room service delivered to our back patio. This place is private and out of the way. We loved it and will definitely come back. Don't be alarmed when you see the construction. Just stay away from the rooms that are close. We stayed in Larsen 6 which was very nice. O

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome”
Reviews.Author: GreatFalls-Traveler
Reviews.Content: We went to the Carneros Inn for our 10 year anniversary. It was just awesome. The individual units were extremely cool. Ours had a great private yard and deck along with an outdoor shower. The room itself was extremely nice with a flat screen TV, fireplace, down bed and incredible bedding. There was champagne in the room from Domaine Carneros- the Taittinger owned vineyard just across the street. The restaurants at the Hotel were marvelous. The layout of the resort was much nicer than some of the other reviews suggested. It apparently was very difficult to get through the local land use regulators in Napa. I personally found the layout very refreshing as it was quiet, the landscaping lovely and the individual units very large. The bathroom was wonderful with heated marble flooring and glass shower that opens onto your deck for the aforementioned outdoor shower. I cannot say enough about the staff. They were unfailingly helpful, charming and seemingly very proud of their workplace. Everyone there went out of their way to be helpful. Anyone who compares this great place to a trailer park is looking for something to complain about that sounds like a cool comment but instead relects a passion for form over substance.

Reviews.Title: “Just the perfect gift.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I surprised my wife for her birthday last year and with the Help of the staff at the carneros inn(especially Tina DiVita) it was the perfect gift. I called in advance and spoke with Tina about planning a surprise vacation to Napa, and the Carneros Inn, we first planned a diversion to the city at a hotel that Tina reccommended, When we arrived at the airport were met in the terminal by our driver with a limo to take us in to the city, stayed at a very hip hotel and the next day picked up again by another limo( A white stretch) to be driven to Napa where visitied great winerys, and later took us to our final destination, the Carneros Inn. My advise is use the staff at this great place to help you with hotels and transportation, it took a lot of the headache out of planning the trip, as you know it's the little details that make the difference. Everything was pre arranged, massages when we arrived, we stayed in one of the two bedroom suites (and well worth it) which were very cooly decorated and had champagne waiting when we arrived. The food was excellent, the surroundings beautiful and we topped the evening with coming back to our room with red rose peddles in our room. Needless to say my wife was pretty impressed, the only way I may be able top this experinece is to go back there, which I plan on doing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I sincerely do not understand some of the negative reviews on this site. My husband and I spent all 6 nights of our honeymoon at the Carneros from July 31, 2005 through August 6, 2005. The room was beautiful. The views from the pool and property were amazing. I had a facial at the spa, which was one of the best I have had in my life. The concierge led us to some of the best and out of the way wineries and a great cooking class. Visit the Carneros Inn, you will not be disappointed. Some northern California residents advised us that discounted rates can be found by calling at the last minute during the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at The Carneros Inn; would go back in a second”
Reviews.Author: jdvmd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeklong trip to Napa and Sonoma. We do this trip on the average of twice a year. This time we were celebrating my 40th birthday and wanted to stay someplace different than on our previous 15 trips or so. The Carneros Inn was wonderful. While we were there, I decided to read the reviews from Trip Advisor to see what accuracies or inaccuracies there were. Let's suffice it to say, we would return in a second. It is different but we liked that and we have stayed at top-notch places around the world. I don't think it is for everyone though. Our family (two kids, ages 15 and 7) stayed in Crane 3 (king size cottage with a sleeper sofa that will accommodate four).
