On their website, it looks like your only choices are a double-double or the family cottage ($1,200 a night, HA!). Upon calling the resort, the reservationist said there are a limited amount of sleeper sofas available in the garden cottages. We were planning on using a PlumpJack Winery discount but ended up finding another deal through the FiveStar Alliance, which basically was the same price as the PlumpJack offer except it included a free American Breakfast for two ($350 a night). There were so many nice touches in the cottage. There was also a sweet note and complementary bottle of Carneros Pinot Noir to celebrate my birthday that Guest Services had surprised me with. The wonderful amenities included the fireplace (replenished with a "burlap" sack to burn each day), the heated floors, plasma TV, wonderful blood orange spa products, candles, the outdoor shower, overhead heater on the deck, teak dining table and chairs, a bowl of Granny Smith apples, robes, nightly turn down service with a sachet and bottled water. I could go on an on. There were nice little touches as well such as room service delivery your food in big huge wicker baskets, rocking chairs on the front porch, a galvanized steel mailbox with USA Today every morning or the San Francisco Chronicle on Sunday, also on the front porch. Lemon-basil water by the pool. Being able to pick a lime or fig from the orchards. We found the accomodations quite comfortable and well-appointed, think Restoration Hardware or Pottery Barn. It took everything to get me out of bed in the morning because it was just so comfy with all the pillows and nice linens. Gorgeous Brazilian mahogany floors. We took so many baths and showers on this trip. We loved how the indoor shower opened up to the outdoor one. You can also turn on four different shower heads at the same time. There was also a Cuisinart coffee maker with tea and coffee as well as bottled water (Carneros water is very mineral rich and tastes weird), DVD player (free DVD's and board games in the main building), a mini bar fridge but I managed to fit some things in there as well. Wine glasses, cork screw, ice bucket were provided as well but you must call for ice since there are no vending or ice machines. Free Internet access. There was a closet but a definite lack of storage space so we didn't unpack. We know some guests have been critical of the external appearance of the units, but we found this unique and interesting. And it mimics Wine Country. The bell hops will drive you around the property on golf carts if you need a ride. Room service was very fast, 10-15 minutes for breakfast; 20 minutes for dinner. One negative, there was some confusion about what type of breakfast for two was included with our package. Better knowledge among the staff would alleviate this. Prices were not bad for room service; there is an 18 percent service charge and 7.75 percent sales tax added. We used the heated pool area only twice but it was satisfactory. It measures approximately 18 feet by 75 feet. There were always people using the pool and whirlpool. The outdoor whirlpool was a bit small. No problems getting chaises, chairs or towels. We took our own bottle of wine and enjoyed the views. I did see servers taking orders from other guests for bar service. We didn't use the spa facilities so we cannot comment on that. There is a lot of construction going on right now. Hopefully, the vineyard views will improve. Definately ask if your cottage is near any of the construction. They are building 20 one and two-bedroom cottages, a fitness center, yoga building, another lap pool, a children's pool, Jacuzzi, conference center with meeting facilities, a Carneros post office, town center, retail space and a new 100-seat restaurant. They are also upgrading the gardens and public areas as well as addressing the functionality of the current cottages. At check out, they offer you bottled water. Also, upon completing the trip, we were also contacted by the assistant to the general manager Paul Horner, regarding our stay, just making sure everything went well. It would be nice if the resort would lower their prices but we don't think that is going to happen. We liked it so much that we are going to stay there at least once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay @ Carneros”
Reviews.Author: Zin Fan
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Carneros in June for our second time (first one was July '04). A couple of impressions about our second stay: the units with the doors in the middle are definitely better than those with the doors on the end - much better use of space. They've expanded their breakfast menu on the patio - food is very good and reasonably priced. No problems with any of the staffs' service. Rooms and bathrooms are quite comfortable and well appointed and we have never stayed in any hotel which affords its guests the privacy which these patios do. We really enjoy this place, although the rates remain very high - we had 3 nights for the price of two last year, no such deal this summer except about a $75 discount for one night. One of the staff said the hotel lost about $5M last year and would do so again this year (it wasn't even full for July 4th weekend and was under 50% during the week) - so I guess they have to try to protect the high room rate if they ever hope to break even. They could easily save money by cutting down on staffing, but they choose to keep the service level high. Overall, its expensive, but we love it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am sorry the hotel is not getting better reviews because my husband and I loved our stay! We loved that we had such privacy and that the hotel was not on the main drag. As we came for both my husband's birthday and our anniversary, our hopes were pretty high! We were not disappointed at all. Upon our arrival in our beautiful room, we were treated with a note and champagne! We had a garden cottage with a plasma tv, a fireplace, very comfy bed, heated bathroom floors, in a huge bathroom, a jacuzzi, the outdoor shower that was SO wonderful and our own heated patio. The pool and whirlpool area was very nice - nested between vineyards. The dinner we shared at the main restaurant was excellent and our waiter could not have provided better service or suggestions. The service and food itself at breakfasts were not as good, but our breakfast expectations were not as high as for dinner. Because so much of our days were spent wine-tasting, it was such a treat for us to unwind at the pool, have a glass of wine on our patio, and even treated ourselves to a DVD our last night just to relax. I have asked my husband to treat me for a birthday down the road as we really did love the Carneros Inn, and we are VERY picky!

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Something happened to this place over the past year or so, but the bloom is definitely off this rose. My wife and I still loved the cottages, but since we were at the Inn last (last summer), the food has gone from great to mediocre and the service, which was once just so warm and welcoming, is really off-putting. It wasn't just that they were unbearably slow (which they were), but there was a real change in attitude at the front desk, at the pool, by the staff. Even asking a simple question was met with an "I can't be bothered" attitude. It made me re-think a recommendation to my friends about staying there and all in all, I think Auberge du Soleil is preferable for the price. I love the Auberge location and I've only been treated with a genuine welcoming attitude. The Auberge food is now far, far better than the restaurant (Hilltop) at Carneros. Too bad about Carneros Inn. I had looked forward to many weekend getaways there.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL experience at the Carneros Inn!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's too bad that fellow reviewers did not enjoy their stay at this gorgeous Inn! I think that if they even thought that the beautiful cottages were 'trailers', then they don't belong out in the Carneros valley, but in a big city at a fu-fu hotel. The cottages were amazing; heated tile floors, fireplace, outdoor shower, beautiful backyard and private porch. The rooms were very nice, as was the room service and Inn staff. My husband and I celebrated a very romantic wedding anniversary there - really enjoyed the breakfasts, both at the Hilltop and Boon Fly Cafe. I highly suggest them, not even one more than the other, as Hilltop made delcious homemade sourdough bread, and the Boon Fly amazing fresh donuts. Yum! We also enjoyed how beautiful the property itself was - our first nite we spent out on the green enjoying the sunset with some nice wine, then later an evening jacuzzi overlooking the evening valley and lights. We indulged in spa treatments and really enjoyed them.... their therapists were very attentive and experienced. So, in a nutshell, we very much enjoyed our time there, and can't wait to go back! Stay here, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Serene”
Reviews.Author: JayBird007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carneros Inn for a weekend and loved it! It was so relaxing and serene. The room was fabulous and the linens were so soft I could have stayed there all day. We loved sitting by the pool even in November taking in the beautiful scenery! We ate a few times at the Boon Fly Cafe which is on the property. The staff there were excellent. I would not hesitate to stay there again on our next trip to the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Christmas Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carneros Inn this past Christmas and it was the Best time ever! I would recommend this resort to everyone and have! The rooms or should I say cottages are Beautiful and the furnishings make them even nicer. From the flat screen TV above the fireplace to the heated bathroom floor/ and the topper was the outdoor shower under the stars! I can honestly say this is the Best place I have ever stayed in Napa and hopefully will be making a yearly adventure to the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Just got home & I'm ready to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: kperk13
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! It was exactly as I pictured it from all the descriptions I'd read. I loved that the cottages were private and detached - great design concept. The rooms themselves were beautiful - love the heated bathroom floors and the outdoor showers. Beds were super comfy. There could have been more drawer storage but that's just being nit-picky. The service was very good - we had one issue with room service delivering to the wrong cottage but they fixed the situation and took care of the bill which makes it right in my book. The pool and hot tub were fabulous - didn't try to spa. Maybe next time. We've stayed at some very high end resorts and this ranks right up there with them.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: lalagirl22
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Carneros Inn in August 2004. I really wish we could have stayed longer. The resort combines a rustic setting with the amenities of a luxury hotel. My favorite was the bathroom- heated marble floors, multiple shower heads, deep bathtub, and even an outdoor shower. The pool is beautiful. I actually found the location to be perfect, situated between Sonoma and Napa with easy access to both. The Carneros is great for those who need some peace and want to feel like they are hiding away for a little while, not for those who want to be in the center of all the "action." The only hesitation, and disappointment, I have about returning is that the current room rates are so high.

Reviews.Title: “Very Swank!”
Reviews.Author: BNATraveller
Reviews.Content: It was really great. When you book, ask for a cottage close to the Hilltop restaurant/Lobby. That way, you can walk to the pool. I booked the cottage on their parent website and got a discount over what was on the Inn website. Once you check in, you have totally privacy. The little cottages are small, but very swank--fireplace (they bring you wood in a burlap bag that you just light), flat screen tv, a private patio with its own "overhead" heater that heats your patio so you can have a drink at night or breakfast in the morning), heated bathroom floors, a shower with multiple jets and an exterior door so you can choose to take a hot shower outdoors. Very, very upscale and most all the guests were in hip in attitude and an affluent 30-40's age group. The pool setting is spectacular. It overlooks a vineyard--just breathtaking. There are two restaurants--The Hilltop which is for guests only. Service is SLOW! They serve B,L, & D. At the entrance, there's the Boon Fly Cafe. With pretty much the same breakfast menu, the Boon Fly is faster and they serve their signature homemade donuts. I'm still working those off! The only downsides was their workout facility is under construction and they only have three machines--treadmill, elliptical, & stairmaster. Good quality machines, but not many. The machines are housed in an empty cottage. The other downside is that once you leave in the morning to go to vineyards, its not like you can pop back in for a quick rest. The Inn is located at the bottom of the valley. It really didn't bother us because we had full winery days planned and then we had an early dinner before returning to the Inn. As for dinner, Mustards Grill was great as was the Martini House. The Inn recommended La Toque where they have a prix fixed menu w/wine pairings. It was the worst meal we had the entire trip--the food was not fresh at all--and it was one of the more expensive, about $450-500. I would not recommend it! Make sure you make appointments at your favorite wineries. I was a little concerned that we would get to these small wineries and we would feel pressured to purchase wines that we really didn't like, but that was not the case at all. No pressure at any of them! We went to Swanson, Opus One, Shafer & Far Niente. There were between 8-12 people in each of our groups. Swanso was cool because they served food with their different wines. It was a great trip and if you get to spend a night or two in San Francisco, it makes for a great trip. We stayed at the Clift there and it, too, was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: Traveler004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 weeknight in late March and LOVED it. It was the best lodging I have encountered in a long time, maybe ever. The Inn was practically desserted, so very quiet. I love that no walls are shared with other guests, so you don't have much chance of hearing anyone else anyway. The bathroom, private deck, and sunny, airy interiors were amazing. I ordered breakfast via room service and it was just ok. Service and food quality were nothing exceptional considering the price. Unfortunately the price is really outrageous so I only stayed the 1 night and went to other hotels (the River Terrace Inn in Napa is closer to average but still very nice and a third of the price) for other nights. I would give it 5 stars except for the price, so it gets 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at The Carneros Inn. It was our second trip to the wine country, but our first to The Carneros Inn. The weather, grounds and service were all wonderful. If we visit this area again we will stay at The Carneros Inn. The food at the Boon Fly was great too. We ate a meal there two times during our stay and ate dessert there at least three times. The Boon Fly Pie is great. The view from the pool and spa area is amazing. I only wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Carneros Inn”
Reviews.Author: Winmax
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the fabulous Carneros Inn. Everything about this wonderful Inn lives up to their promises. The cottages are a lovely somewhat rustic elegance. Very comfortable beds, terrific bathroom, great patio area and marvelous service. The employees could not be better. They are all so helpful and 100% pleasant regarding any request. I personally think that the Carneros area is a perfect location for seeing all of the Napa region. My husband and I can not wait to go back to The Carneros Inn. A totally fullfilling experience! Just a tip if you go there the Boon Fly Restaurant on the premises is great.

Reviews.Title: “A Rich Napa Experience”
Reviews.Author: californiann
Reviews.Content: A birthday trip to Napa turned out to be a magical experience for my family. We were celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday and gave this very special place a try. We enjoyed every moment and amenity of this hotel. It has a style unlike any other we have been to. The concierge was extremely helpful in setting up some experiences for us that we will never forget. She suggested a wine tasting appointment at Swanson Winery that was nothing short of amazing. It had a great atmosphere, nice tasting experience complete with cheese, crackers, and chocolates making a great 21st celebration. It was raining the whole weekend and we loved running into our cottages to warm up near the fireplace and sleep in the luxurious beds. Loved the showers and heated bathroom floors. We can't wait to return this summer during warmer weather to enjoy the pool near the vineyards!

Reviews.Title: “How could you not like this place?”
Reviews.Author: FLcs
Reviews.Content: If you have some extra cash to burn or if you make a good buck, definitely check into this place. The only thing I was worried about before checking in was whether the staff would be pretentious, which is a huge turn off. They weren't at all, but rather were extremely friendly and bent over backwards to try to do whatever they could to make our stay the best possible. While we didn't get upgraded to the Lee Suite like one reviewer (that would have been a definite plus), we had a "hamburger" garden cottage in the interior. Hamburger means that the door is in the middle; hotdog means that the door is on the end. That should pretty much sum up that while the place is extremely nice, there is no attitude whatsoever. The only negative about the cottage was the nonexistant view. It would have been nice to have one of the vineyard views, but whatever, the cottage itself was great. One reviewer said that if he hadn't have been upgraded to the suite, he would have felt cramped. Wow. You must stay in some huge hotel rooms when you travel. I guess if you expect the cottage to have a living area other than the outside deck and garden, you may be dissapointed, but the cottage isn't lacking in size by any means. The bathroom is fantastic, and the shower is by far my favorite shower ever. It has four showerheads that are all adjustable and you can open the door that leads to the "al fresco" shower outside. If you open the door 90 degrees, it locks into the al fresco shower to create about a 12-15 foot shower stall, half inside and half outside. Pretty sweet. I think I took the longest shower of my life. The plasma TV w/ DVD and VCR were also great, and the fireplace was a nice touch, though the "firewood" (it's not real wood, but rather a pile of firestarter logs I think) only lasted for about 15 minutes before it went out. We might have done something wrong, I don't know. The staff are fantastic...really, really friendly and also very knowledgeable of the surrounding wineries. I would recommend taking a trip up to Alexander Valley and the Russian River areas of Sonoma. Also, if it's a nice day out, the view from the Artesa winery is amazing, and that winery is also only a couple of miles from the inn. It's a great place to stay, and I definitely look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “I HAD TO HAVE ONE !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I could not help myself, I had such a good time at Carneros Inn I had to buy one of their high fashion homes.

Reviews.Title: “loved the comfort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just came back from the most relaxing vacation we ever had, thanks to the incredible carneros inn. the inn itself is so perfect its hard to describe. i'll start with the cottages: they were the sweetest buildings i ever saw. the rooms were very clean and comfortable, the bed was heavenly, the shower had the best water pressure i ever felt and the flat screen tv and fireplace were just bonuses. the staff and service were a-one. they made you feel right at home, as if they were waiting just for us to arrive. we only stayed one night and then we went down to san francisco, although, san francisco was beautiful, i was sorry we didn't stay at the carneros longer. we would have liked to enjoyed the beautiful spa. we can't wait to visit again. thanks again to the carneros inn.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Extra Special For No Reason!”
Reviews.Author: Michaela
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a one night romantic getaway to The Carneros Inn for an early Valentine's celebration. I read all the Trip Advisor reviews - and reading the details from contributors really paid off! Because we read the reviews, we gathered that paying the extra amount for a Vineyard View room would not be worth it, so we booked a Garden Cottage for $435 for a Saturday night. I booked it on-line in November. A few weeks later when I checked the web-site, a weekend stay for that weekend had a 2 night minimum - which was not what we wanted, so I felt fortunate that I had booked far ahead. I read the review entitled "Best Trip Ever", written on 12/30/04. Towards the end of the review the writer stated "Get a cottage with a king bed and the entry door in the "middle", not on the end...trust me. Better layout by far and feels larger." I wasn't sure what that meant but I trusted her, and asked the front desk upon check-in what exactly this reviewer was referring to. Samantha, at the front desk, knew exactly what this was and why this may have been mentioned (though she certainly did not disparage the units with doors not in the middle - she said it was simply personal preference by some). She checked to see which layout we were slotted for, and we indeed were set to be put into the type of room with the layout the writer did not recommend. When Samantha saw that she said, "Let's see what we can do for you that may be better - I think we can give you a suite." Not only did they give us a suite - but apparently the best suite in the hotel according to where it is located, and according to the opinions of many staff members! It was Rooms 9 & 10, Lee section. Room 10 is the sleeping room, and Room 9 is the entertainment area. They are separate buildings laid out end by side in a L-shape pattern, with the very large private deck connecting the two. The outdoor patio has a gate that opens onto the edge of the vineyard and you could wander out - and apparently this room has the best view of the vineyards as it is sloping downward. What was also nice was to have 2 fireplaces, and also 2 bathrooms and 4 showers!! (2 indoor and 2 outdoor). We had our computer with us and checked the Carneros web-site and saw that this suite goes for $1000/night! We had friends driving over from Santa Rosa to meet us for dinner at the Hilltop, so this set-up worked out fantastic! We spent and hour and a half having wine at the suite - enjoying the beautiful view on our deck (outdoor heaters are wonderful when the sun sets), and then into the entertainment room to share a platter of hor' doeuvres in front of the lovely fire to continue our festivities before dinner. Carneros - you truly made our trip special with treatment like this! A resort will do this obviously upon occasion for PR purposes - and I will pay them back by letting Trip Advisor readers know of their generosity! We had lunch at the Boon Fly before check-in which was quite nice, and we had dinner at the Hilltop. The food was fantastic at the Hilltop! There are 3,4 & 5 course prix fix meals to choose from. We thought it was very reasonably priced for $50 for a 3 course dinner - especially considering you could pick whatever 3 courses you wanted!! For example, I didn't want an traditional appetizer - and I was torn between wanting the Monkfish and the lamb for my entree. The solution was simple. Choose 2 main courses! The Monkfish is apparently one of their specialities, and it almost tasted like lobster! Just wonderful as was the lamb! Prior reviews of Carneros showed controversy in opinion of the appearance of this stylized hotel. The cottages are meant to be reminiscent of the vineyard worker's homes of past. It is very different. And I don't know if I would have been happy in a room that was on the interior of the grounds. (Check the grounds map before you accept your room). We decided that we appreciated what they were doing stylistically - but it is different. I have given this resort a 4-rating, but my 5's are reserved for only the best spots in the world - and we do travel well and frequently. My criticism would be that the cottages are very small - too small for my taste. If we had not had a suite, I would have felt very crowded with only the sleeping room. I will not repeat all the praise already given the hotel on the wonderful room amenities, and will only say I agree. Give Carneros a try. The staff was great, the food was fantastic - and this experience is simply unique!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carneros Inn from 12/27-30. My husband and I loved it. So private and quiet. Sorry we stayed only 3 nights. The indoor/outdoor shower was magnificent. There was a lot of rain over those 3 days, but that's what made the outdoor shower the highlight of my stay. The plasma tv and the real wood burning fireplace were nothing to cough at. Did I mention the heated bathroom floors? Would recommend staying here. Staff were very courtious and the restaurants served large portions of good food. Don't forget your laptop as they provide free DSL hookup.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Private Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While I can understand why some would be put off by the metal fencing surrounding the cottage gardens, it really comes down to aesthetic preference. Personally, I preferred the privacy provided by the fencing, and I and enjoyed the clean lines and modern look. If you want sweeping views, the majority of cottages won't provide it. However, if you want a very private getaway while obtaining your views during day trips, this is it. I went here to get away from the city and ponder a career change. Spent all weekend soaking in the tub, enjoying the heated deck, and luxuriating in the privacy of my own charming cottage. Loved the heated bathroom tiles, al fresco shower, and the high-speed internet access. While I couldn't get in for a massage, the facial was very relaxing and the spa premises were top-notch. It was all exactly what I wanted. The staff were all very courteous, attentive, and professional. Aside from a small room service mix-up, I have absolutely no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. Its expensive but worth it. My husband and I spent 2 nights at Carneros for Thanksgiving. We stayed in a room overlooking the vineyard - the views were fantastic and it was very romantic.We loved the decor of the rooms and the spacious bathrooms , not forgetting the outside shower! The rooms are small but decorated well. We had Thanksgiving dinner in the Hill top restaurant and the food and service were good. We also had a spa treatment each - both of us felt very relaxed and the facilities were great. We have stayed at a number of great hotels around the world and often say "why go back to the same place again?" However, we may just make an excpetion here for another "romantic get away from it break"

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 2 nights at The Carneros Inn to celebrate his birthday. I learned of the resort in a magazine but had no idea of the real treat we had lying ahead of us. The concept is called "Agricultural Chic" and it is just that. For anyone who would like a spa getaway and has an appreciation for Ian Shrager meets the outdoors, this is truly it. It is simple elegance with a modern style interior. The cottages are warm and inviting, and the views of the vineyards are wonderful. There are many cottages, my experience is the DiRosa 1 cottage has the best view. The beds are lush, the flat screen a treat for the men (plus you can rent for free any movie they have in their collection for as long as you want), the fireplace is wood burning, the outdoor patio with heater is wonderful, and the shower with all of the heads? Heavenly. Tips: we brought along a small portable sound system and a few edibles with us which turned out to be perfect, we could store the edibles in the refridgerator. Also, be ready to request from them an extra round of wood for the fireplace as it burns very quickly and one round is not enough for a night. Also book your spa treatments before you arrive. The grounds are rustic and you truly feel connected with the outdoors. The smells of the rosemary and gardens and vineyards is in the air. The hot tub facing the vineyards up by the pool is heavenly! The Boon Fly was delicious for dinner (and casual) and the Hill Top for breakfast is easy to get to with wonderful views. (Try the green eggs and ham-yum!) The food is so incredibly fresh. The spa is the best part, however. It was the best facial my husband and I have ever had-ask for Marcia. Also, my massage was ranked right up there-ask for Sherrie. The spa is located very close to many fantastic wineries, and the consierge lead us in the right direction with VIP tasting passes to boot. Don't forget to visit Artesa Winery, the best views in Napa. I recommend autumn in Napa, it is gorgeous with the colors! We will definitely go back to this resort. The only down side is I agree with some of the previous reviews that mention the staff is "young and unpolished". That does not go for all of them, but you can tell it is a new resort and they are still ironing out some kinks. Make sure if you have a package, for instance, that you inquire upon check in on all of the treatments and items you should be receiving. But I think the fact that the resort is only 1 year old allows a little room for polishing. Regardless, the privacy and amenities were more then worth it for us. This is a true secret that is quickly circulating through many travel magazines and even the tabloids, as many celebrities are attracted to it. So get there before it becomes impossible to reserve a cottage!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect escape”
Reviews.Author: beeclean
Reviews.Content: We visited the inn in mid september on the "escape" package. Simply put, this property is outstanding. I've read the reviews posted here before we went and since we've been back and am honestly astounded at the criticism levied against the inn. Agreed, the architecture takes some getting used to, and the vineyard cottages are a bit view challenged, but the overall feel is so unique and luxurious that I am honestly hard pressed to identify a better property that offered so much. I suppose being in a cottage far away from the pool area could be disappointing (we were adjacent), but other than that this place is the perfect escape. The rooms were the ultimate in self indulgent luxury. The beds, the plasma television, the bathroom, and of course the shower are as good a framework for relaxation as you are going to find. I suppose one could complain that it was difficult to hear the ocean. Our experience with the conceirge was more than adequate. I would just view it as more of a country inn with friendly staff, than a major metropolitan 5 star. The most difficult part of our stay was deciding where to hang out. The pool, the room, the spa and private courtyard were each idyllic in their own ways. It would have been very easy to ignore the wineries and never leave the property during the day. We loved the breakfast by the pool, and the prix fix dinner in the guests only hilltop dining room added an additional sense of exclusivity. To summarize, if you want a generic property with shared walls and a view out of the end of the room then the Carneros Inn is not for you. But, if you are looking for something different, something private, something bordering on hedonistic, then you should absolutely give this property a try.

Reviews.Title: “Vineyard view?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Vineyard View! Seems like an easy enough statement to live up to but in the case of the Carneros Inn - if you wanted an unobstructed view of the vineywards you weren't going to get it unless you stood on stilts to look over the tin fence that surrounded your patio. Driving into the property, my husband and I had a sinking feeling when we saw the "stockade fencing' on either side of the driveway. Why would they block the view of these beautifuly 'cottages' and vineyards? Leaving the main fencing behind, we drove into the complex of huts - surrounded by their OWN tin fencing. Fencing at least 6' high. As other people have mentioned, the patios are certainly private. I am only thankful that we were there in October rather than in the dead of summer when those fences would prevent any breeze to enter and any air that was inside would be so hot from the reflection of the tin. My main complaint - we paid top dollar for a Vineyard View Cottage. We've stayed at other places where we've been situated right in the middle of a vineyard. Or, we've walked onto our balcony/patio and have a complete unobstructed view of a vineyard. Those places were private and delivered what they advertised - all without putting us in a hut with tin fencing around it. I noticed that the pictures on CI website have been changed from what we saw when we made our reservations. Those pictures showed a view from inside a cottage looking outside to the vineyards. Obviously those were taken before all the fences were erected. Would we go back - no! Remember - vineyard view room .... where I couldn't see the vineyard as I sat on my patio or anywhere from my room. I could only see a small slice of the vineyard if I went out on the front porch and looked to the right down an alley. Other cottages, that weren't priced as Vineyard View had the same view as we did - they just had to look further down the alley. Yes, the rooms were ok. But calstraphobic because you had to keep the blinds down for privacy. And looking out any window that wasn't closed up would only let you look at a tin fence. Shudder. The only reason we didn't change our reservations to another place was because after I indicated how unhappy we were with our room we were told there was another available. Room 10 Lee Section. This is the best vv cottage. The patio overlooked the vineyards (the fence was still 6' high but the lay of the land was slanting downhill and we were able to actually lay in bed and see the sun rise and vineyards. That was luck on our part. If you go, make sure you get this room if you want vineyard view. Otherwise just get a hut, hunker down behind your tin barricades and hope for cool weather and find yourself shaking your head for not paying attention to this review. The staff seemed inexperienced. It didn't seem that they were very well trained and there didn't seem to be a main person in charge. When we inquired about their making appointments at vineyards that required appointments - they gave us the phone numbers so we could make the calls. Staff coming in and out of the main reception area never made eye contact, said hello or acknowledged any of their guests. Again, inadequate training. All in all, the only thing that saved the visit was Cottage 10, but even with that - we wouldn't go back. Not a good value for the money and we felt we were in a shanty town.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: tarheelgirl03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent six nights at Carneros Inn (thank goodness for the special offer) to celebrate our wedding anniversary and all we can say isâ€¦â€�WOW!!!â€� The place is absolutely incredible! We both work in the hospitality industry and travel a lot for business (and pleasure) and have stayed at many luxurious hotels but this was truly the best product weâ€™ve ever seen! We fell in love with the cottage and all of its amenities! The heated tile floor and the shower(s) were awesome (especially the outside shower)! I think my husband must have showered three times a day (yes, the shower is THAT good!) Our room was huge and looked exactly as it is pictured on their website. The outside area with the table and chairs (and heater) was a very nice touch as well. It really made you feel at home with all of the great landscaping and it provided total privacy. Part of me didnâ€™t want to post this because I donâ€™t want the secret to get out but I felt the need to dispel the negative remarks that have been previously posted. As for the comments regarding it looking like a trailer park, that is entirely not true. Yes, it does have different architecture than what many people are used to but that was the vision when it was built. Call me crazy but I think their originality adds to their charm. The majority of the other inns/hotels in the area all look the same and although offer really nice accommodations, they all appear to be relatively standard. Rooms at Carneros are definitely not standard and its so nice to have your own cottage (no worries about how loud your neighbors are)! For the most part, the service we experienced was great. Christy (Concierge) was fabulous! She got us into some wonderful restaurants and let us know that one of the wineries we had hoped to visit required reservations. She was very proactive and ensured everything was taken care of prior to our arrival. The service we received at the Spa was also incredible and the massages ranked right up there with the best weâ€™ve had. The only poor service we had came from one individual and was by no means indicative of the overall service we received. Our lunch at the Hilltop Restaurant was really good and we especially enjoyed eating outside looking over the pool and vineyards (the landscape is really incredible). We also ate breakfast at the Boon Fly CafÃ© on two mornings and really enjoyed that as well (everything tasted so fresh!) We met a couple that had eaten dinner there one night and raved about it also. Iâ€™m sorry to write so much but wanted to give everyone whoâ€™s interested in Carneros Inn a full account of our fabulous stay. Although it is a bit expensive for many of us (but not by Napa/Sonoma standards), it is worth EVERY penny! ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but service needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here last August. I completely agree with the reviewer from Plano, Texas, who said that the product was good but the service was a problem. It's not that the service is bad, only that it's wildly inconsistent. One of the waiters at the poolside restaurant was fantastic, but the front desk when we checked in was hopeless. There is room service, but we became so skeptical about the staff's competence that we never tried it. Management needs to train their staff to operate at a consistent level. Right now, it's left to the individual staff member -- if they're smart and on the ball, you get great service; if they're witless (and we came across more than one of these), you're out of luck. As for the "product" -- the cottages are outstanding, everything done to a high standard. I'm not an expert on these things, but the finishes and materials struck me as expensive. The tin fences and walls that some reviewers complained about are actually an interesting choice; according to the brochure, they're meant to echo the traditional workers' buildings of the past. The pool was the highlight. It was so beautiful out there that we spent one day doing nothing but lounging on the deck, reading. It's glorious. (I did notice, though, that some of the hardscaping and steps were already chipped and cracked. Not a good sign for such a new hotel.) In conclusion -- go! There are problems, but the beauty of the surroundings, and the great cottages, more than make up for it. Another plus (for us, anyway) is that Carneros is quieter than much of Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, You can't go wrong here!!”
Reviews.Author: caribcarib
Reviews.Content: This place rules. The property is amazing, views, pools, spas (yes pricey), you name it. The rooms were incredible. The staff was very good, whatever you wanted the front desk sent someone ASAP. Cathy in concierge had the complete low down on touring Napa and had connections to help us out. The cabin set up was so unique and so cool, its nice to be at a place like this and not have to worry about hearing any neighbors through the adjoining walls. Lets just say after a day of wine tasting, coming back to the carneros, walking by vineyards and lighting a fire in your own personal cottage, it is nice to know that the neighbors can't hear you either. The fireplaces were a great touch. The room had the perfect bed. Too perfect to be honest, it was a challenge to get out, it was that comfortable. Yes the plasmas and DVD was a nice touch, but the real treat is the bathrooms. Like your own spa. Heated floors, indoor showers that felt like a car wash, outdoor showers that felt amazingly refreshing. I did have the vineyard view and you can see them from parts of your own private courtyard. you have your own outdoor area with a space heater so you can sit outside in privacy, (or you can enjoy a rocking chair by your front door and get an unobstructed view.) So what if the boundaries are tin ? It feels rustic and quaint. I loved it. And seeing the vineyards from your bed in the morning and out your bathroom window make you realize what a treat you have in store for that day. I really don't understand people who complain on these things. Service I can understand as everyone receives different service, and they perceive it differently, but as far as the beds, showers, fireplace, vineyards, ranch, good food, friendly people, infinity pool, private courtyard, and plasma TV to name a few, I do not see how anyone can complain about this property. Check out their website, it doesn't lie, it shows exactly what you will get when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great mix of rustic and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: TwinCitian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Carneros, and we both thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The exterior has a farmy, rustic feel (e.g., cows graze just a few feet from the jacuzzi in a pool area with a great vineyard view) -- both don't let that fool you. Once you get inside the cottages, you'll again feel just an hour outside San Fran. From heated floors to a great bed, three-head showers to a plasma TV, every detail has been paid careful attention. Cottages are swanky and luxurious. A couple tips: 1. Luggage wheels don't roll well. The lot and walkways are gravel, so be prepared to struggle a bit with the luggage. 2. The plasma TV on the wall swivels. Our room was situated so that the bed was not in front of the TV, but no problem. Just turn the TV toward you, no matter you may want to sit. 3. Bring your MP3 player if you have one. I brought an iPod and played it through the plasma TV speakers via the DVD player. It's easy. Just plug RCA jacks into the front of the player, put the TV on input 2, and enjoy your own tunes. Otherwise, enjoy! If you appreciate a combination of rustic and luxurious, you can't miss.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Carneros Inn is nothing short of a little slice of heaven on earth. We loved the king size bed with the softest of Italian linens, the plasma tv and the nightly "clean wood" fireplace. The deck is not just a little sitting area - its your own little garden away from home. Breakfast on the deck, after an outside shower, was nothing short of decadent! This is no standard hotel room made up with a few amenities to make you feel like you are being treated special. No, it is a totally unique and wonderful escape. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a unique, pampering and luxurious break from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy, peaceful, and unique hideaway in wine country”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carneros Inn September 7 through the 10th. We were able to receive our 3rd night free by booking on expedia.com. The service upon check-in and check-out were fine. Maid service is twice daily--which is very nice as well. We did not eat at the hilltop, but we did dine at the boonfly on our first night. The servers were great (we were the only customers); however there were so many flies bothering us during our meal that we could not enjoy it. I agree that the rooms are very small, and I was a little disappointed at first; however there is a small closet and extra storage by the bed if you would like to unpack. What made this place special was not only the intimate location and setting, but the extra perks included in your room. The location has excellent accessibility to Napa, Sonoma, and Carneros wine regions. The privacy of each unit was unparalleled--my husband loved the alfresco outdoor shower so much he never used the inside one. The bathroom takes up about a third of the room--the heated floors are very nice and the spaciousness is indulgent. The plasma TV, minibar, private patio with heater, free internet access were all nice features. The exercise facility has not been completed, so guests must use a very small work-out room. My husband used this facility and reports there are still kinks with having towels and bottled water available there. If you would like a truly unique experience in wine country in an excellent location and tranquil setting--I would recommend the Carneros Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Product- Very Inconsistant Service Levels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The physical product and the setting are wonderful. The private garden/patio which was dinged in an earlier review is actually a great feature which affords ample privacy which was the actual intent. The cottages are wonderfully appointed, with the exception of easy access to coffee/ice. (Wood flooring is quickly becoming scratched however) Service at the Front Desk was sorely lacking. They never failed to underwhelm me. Slow/indifferent/very poorly trained. Especially Samantha. Tips: The Boon Fly has wonderful food. Have breakfast at the bar counter. The female staff member (cannot recall name:() is absolutely wonderful. Very personable and attentive. Gave us great guidedance on exploring the valley. The male waitstaff are sorely lacking in even the basic hospitality skills. Not a gender issue, just the reality. Avoid the private multi-course private dining... Not worth the cost and food is average. On balance, a great faciility. I have personally been involved in the lodging industry for over 20 years. I am somewhat bewildered by the very inconsistant service levels, some which are rudimentary. The property could be well served by a more observant/effective management team.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Very quiet surrounding with beautiful vineyard”
Reviews.Author: Yoshinori
Reviews.Content: At first we were afraid of staying there because some of the reviews are not so nice. But it was a mistake. We stayed just two nights, enjoying The Hilltop Dining Room. It was a woderful place. Unfortunately The dining room open only in the weekend. Five course testing is $75 per person , $110 with wine pairing. The food is pretty excellent, comparing with other places at this area. Philp Wang, executive chef is doing great job! We won`t forget all the working staff were very friendly and nice to us, smiling and kind! We would like to visit again soon. One reason, we are living in a big small city, which we want to leave. This is not Fourseasons Hotel ! But it will make us more comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: RedSpinner
Reviews.Content: Feels like part hotel, part commune - all modern. Cleanly constructed cottages organized in simple mini-neighborhoods. Be sure to pick some pomegranates or figs on the way to the pool. The cottages each have an outdoor shower accessible from the indoor shower - USE IT & YOUR LIFE WILL CHANGE. The bed is luscious. Spa services are good, not amazing. The hotel is about a 15-minute drive from old town Napa and 15 minutes from the first vineyards at the bottom of the Valley. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Carneros Inn delivers the goods!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is fabulous! If you want to relax, this is where you go! Flat out, this Inn has it going on. My Wife and I arrived on Friday July 23rd. We stayed for one week. The front desk is friendly, helpful and always came through with any request. We never waited or wanted for anything. The cottage was great. The exterior was rustic, which blends in to the surrounding environment. The interior exceeded our expectations. The bed was like a cloud. Definitely the best week of sleep in a long time, great pillows too. The Plasma TV, the fireplace, leather chair, the bar, the bathroom all added to our comfort and enjoyment. We could live here. It's that comfortable. The double french doors open to a big deck w /a flagstone patio. The vineyard view is definiely worth it if you can swing it. Our view of the vineyards and mountains made leaving very hard. The overhead heater keeps you warm in the morning while sipping coffee and warm at night having a glass of wine. The alfresco shower is like a waterfall. It feels great. We liked the relaxed atmosphere of the entire Inn and cottages. You feel relaxed, wandering around the grounds, you realize that some talented people came together and thought to do this. The Infinity pool is beautiful. The view is phenomenal. The vineyards unfold in front of you as you drink your chardonnay, iced tea, bloody mary, whatever...the mountains in the distance top it off. We would sit from 3:00 - 8:00 PM every day, just relaxing by the pool. Really has to be one of the best views in Napa. We spoke w/ Keith the owner one night and he was really great to us. He made us feel welcome and and appreciated. He is very proud of what he built and it shows. The boon fly cafe is great for all meals, we ate many meals here and the room service is speedy and efficient. Summing up, by staying here, you don't feel pressure to go to Napa or any other place, you can just relax and enjoy all the effort that went into building this beautiful Inn. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Romantic Getaway for Any Occasion”
Reviews.Author: calady
Reviews.Content: I am still daydreaming about my last few nights at the Carneros Inn. It was tough getting back to reality. It was a wonderful 2-year anniversary experience. The cottage was more than I could've imagined. I even asked the Concierge to set up a little romantic candlelight welcoming for us which included some sparkling wine from the Domaine Carneros, candles from the Carneros Spa (which have a citrus smell to them), and rose petals everywhere. They did an excellent job!!! We had dinner on our patio the first night. The food was a little salty though for our taste. The shower was the best. Those were the longest showers I have ever taken. And both my husband and I took 3 of them a day so we took full advantage, including the one outside. The beds were a little soft for us but all the pillows made up for it. The pool and jacuzzi are open 24/7 so we went for a late night swim and we had the whole pool to ourselves. Everyone is very friendly and the service is excellent. I would highly recommend staying here and I would definitely come back again. I do recommend the Rutherford Grill (ribs and prime rib are to die for!!) and Celadon, btw. The only negative thing was the food. I expected more from this high class inn. It was a little high priced for the quality of food they served. We also had to get new card keys twice too so that was a pain. But that's about all the negatives I can think of! So have fun and enjoy!! We did!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice night for second honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandcris
Reviews.Content: We stayed mid-week in early June and felt like we were the only ones there. The place has a funky look...cottages. It's a place that would be perfect if on the beach somewhere. The rooms are outstandingly appointed. However, for the money, they should include breakfast and perhaps a wine reception in the afternoon. The rooms lacked only a coffee maker to make it perfect. It's pricey, but if you want a unique, nice, place to stay for a romantic night, this is it. ( Just bring your own coffee machine!)

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular....but please don't tell anyone....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful experience during our stay at the Carneros Inn. We went up mid-week, after the Fourth of July holiday (we also took advantage of the stay 2 nights, 3rd is free special) and can honestly not say enough good things about our entire experience. The staff is amazingly accomodating, every request was addressed instantly. Austin was especially wonderful, offering the best advice as to which vineyards to visit, and even took our calls while we were on the road to direct us to some of the "local's spots" he had told us about. The rooms are amazing. The pillows are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The fireplace (with the instant bags for burning every night), the plasma tv, the heated tile floors in the bathroom, the extra deep soaking tub, the private patio, the double-paned windows (so quiet inside), the relaxing color scheme in the rooms, the fresh green apples in you room every day.....and the SHOWER!!!!! Oh, the outside shower is absolute heaven. We plan on making this an annual trip and stay in the same room each time (no, I won't tell you which one!). The only negative I can note at this time is the fitness facility. The machines are very nice, water, towels, instructional tapes, and, of course, apples, are made available, it's very private and it was refreshing to grab a mat and work out by yourself on the deck or open the french doors to breath in the fresh air...but it was a very tight squeeze. If there had been more than the two of us in there at one time, it may have gotten a bit too much. I can only assume the location is temporary at this time, until a larger facility is made available. But, I imagine, most folks staying here are not too worried about getting their workouts in, rather than relaxing in their rocking chairs on the front porches of their cottages. I'm glad we went up mid-week (Tuesday through Saturday). As we were leaving Saturday, I noticed all of the cars rolling in and was glad we had a chance to have the place all to ourselves!!! I am especially elated with the level of privacy associated with the layout of the cottages, and the cottages themselves. I know there were other people there when we were, but we honestly hardly ever saw anyone, which was just wonderful (can you tell I'm a privacy freak?) Overall, I must rate this experience in my top 3 vacation destinations, if just for the relaxation factor alone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited in mid-May for two nights. I'm glad we were prepared for the initial views of the property -- it truly looks more like a collection of farm structures than an upscale resort! However, as noted by other visitors, the rooms are fantastic. Despite needing a few opening kinks worked out (out outdoor patio heater did not work but was promplty repaired within 5 minutes), the cottages are great. The beds are comfy and the heated tile floors in the spacious bathroom were a treat, as the weather had turned a bit cold and windy while we were there. We braved the wind one afternoon to visit the hilltop pool & spa, which offer fabulous views of the carneros region.

Reviews.Title: “Visited early May...you will love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Inn was great. I was a bit skeptical after reading these reviews, but we loved it. The pool is the best part. The chairs are so comfy and it was great to just sit out and relax with vineyard views. We stayed in a garden cottage...the back patio was kind of disappointing, it was just a fenced in area with some plantings that haven't grown in yet, and a table and chairs. The outdoor shower is great...the tvs are nice, along with a collection of free dvds to sign out at the main house, and the beds are to die for! Some of the fixtures could use improvement, our doorhandle to the patio fell off, the faucet in the bathroom was not all the way screwed in, and the shower door that opens to the alfresco could barely scrape over the wood. That being said, I loved the place. The bar is fun, the staff was nice, and the architecture is original and funky. The restaurant could use improvement, there were limited selections on the dinner menu and I got the pasta which was nothing spectacular for 20 dollars. We had lunch and breakfast out on the patio though and both were great. I suggest the burger at lunch, it was awesome. Since they have no 2 night minimum, the place got pretty crowded on saturday night and sunday morning, so if you can also go friday night, I'd recommend it...we had the place to ourselves friday night and saturday during the day. They kept telling us that they "were almost full" and at dinner on friday they said they "had a few spaces left", and it seemed that they were at about half capacity and only 3 tables were being used in the restaurant during our dinner. It's tough for their business but great right now if you are a guest because obviously word hasn't gotten around yet about them, and as a result, you get the place to yourself. I would definitely recommend it and will hopefully return...very convenient location for going to wineries and for dinner in Sonoma, and the entire concept of the place is really different.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights at Carneros Inn and it made me cry to leave. The weather was unusually hot but the breeze and champage by the spectacular infinity pool made it all just right. Loved the cottages with the plasma TV's and huge bathrooms. The big soaking tub was great but nothing compared to the outdoor shower which was the best. Service was friendly and attentive and seemed to have a true desire to please. I've stayed at all the traditional places in the valley, and this one (at almost half the price of the big names) has won my heart -- and so close to the city compared to trekking all the way up the napa valley. Hit the local wineries pretty hard so decided to try the restaurant and it was tasty and as good of a meal as we've ever had -- actually went back for our third night as well. try stone masssage as it made me melt. on the down side, hard to find the turnoff and entrance is still a bit rough as is first view of cottage roofs but once you get through the gate and settle in, it's a great place to kick back.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par yet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great concept, wonderful rooms -- especially the private patio w/heater and the roman-style shower -- friendly staff, but lacking the experience and professionalism expected in this type of property. The SPA is incredibly overpriced for the services. I continue to feel that I was ripped off. The mani-pedi station was an afterthought and far from relaxing because of location, uncomfortable seating position and the location next to a busy office. The technician was inexperienced as well (but friendly!). The massage however was professionally executed, albeit the thin walls in the room in which sounds from the hallways and other rooms were heard. The staff, again friendly, but not experienced and seemed a bit confused about some of the services offered. The meal service was also lacking in experience -- with no waiters to be found at some times and inexperience in timing the meal (starters and entrees served almost simultaneously). The food was good but not excellent as expected from the prices. For the same price, visit Bernardus in the Carmel Valley. Same luxury-group, but superior property. With time perhaps this property will shine.
